68 #define CLI11_VERSION_MAJOR 1

76 // Verbatim copy from Macros.hpp:
77 
78 
79 // The following version macro is very similar to the one in PyBind11
80 #if !(defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
81 #if __cplusplus >= 201402L
82 #define CLI11_CPP14
83 #if __cplusplus >= 201703L
84 #define CLI11_CPP17
85 #if __cplusplus > 201703L
86 #define CLI11_CPP20
87 #endif
88 #endif
89 #endif
90 #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L
91 // MSVC sets _MSVC_LANG rather than __cplusplus (supposedly until the standard is fully implemented)
92 // Unless you use the /Zc:__cplusplus flag on Visual Studio 2017 15.7 Preview 3 or newer
93 #if _MSVC_LANG >= 201402L
94 #define CLI11_CPP14
95 #if _MSVC_LANG > 201402L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
96 #define CLI11_CPP17
97 #if __MSVC_LANG > 201703L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
98 #define CLI11_CPP20
99 #endif
100 #endif
101 #endif
102 #endif
103 
104 #if defined(CLI11_CPP14)
105 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) [[deprecated(reason)]]
106 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
107 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __declspec(deprecated(reason))
108 #else
109 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __attribute__((deprecated(reason)))
110 #endif
111

115 // Verbatim copy from Validators.hpp:
116 
117 
118 // C standard library
119 // Only needed for existence checking
120 #if defined CLI11_CPP17 && defined __has_include && !defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
121 #if __has_include(<filesystem>)
122 // Filesystem cannot be used if targeting macOS < 10.15
123 #if defined __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED && __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 101500
124 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
125 #else
126 #include <filesystem>
127 #if defined __cpp_lib_filesystem && __cpp_lib_filesystem >= 201703
128 #if defined _GLIBCXX_RELEASE && _GLIBCXX_RELEASE >= 9
129 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
130 #elif defined(__GLIBCXX__)
131 // if we are using gcc and Version <9 default to no filesystem
132 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
133 #else
134 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
135 #endif
136 #else
137 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
138 #endif
139 #endif
140 #endif
141 #endif
142 
143 #if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
144 #include <filesystem> // NOLINT(build/include)
145 #else
146 #include <sys/stat.h>
147 #include <sys/types.h>
148 #endif

162 namespace CLI {
163 
166 namespace enums {
167 
169 template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type>
170 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &in, const T &item) {
171  // make sure this is out of the detail namespace otherwise it won't be found when needed
172  return in << static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(item);
173 }
174 
175 } // namespace enums
176 
178 using enums::operator<<;
179 
180 namespace detail {
183 constexpr int expected_max_vector_size{1 << 29};
184 // Based on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/236129/split-a-string-in-c
186 inline std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &s, char delim) {
187  std::vector<std::string> elems;
188  // Check to see if empty string, give consistent result
189  if(s.empty()) {
190  elems.emplace_back();
191  } else {
192  std::stringstream ss;
193  ss.str(s);
194  std::string item;
195  while(std::getline(ss, item, delim)) {
196  elems.push_back(item);
197  }
198  }
199  return elems;
200 }
201 
203 template <typename T> std::string join(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
204  std::ostringstream s;
205  auto beg = std::begin(v);
206  auto end = std::end(v);
207  if(beg != end)
208  s << *beg++;
209  while(beg != end) {
210  s << delim << *beg++;
211  }
212  return s.str();
213 }
214 
216 template <typename T,
217  typename Callable,
218  typename = typename std::enable_if<!std::is_constructible<std::string, Callable>::value>::type>
219 std::string join(const T &v, Callable func, std::string delim = ",") {
220  std::ostringstream s;
221  auto beg = std::begin(v);
222  auto end = std::end(v);
223  if(beg != end)
224  s << func(*beg++);
225  while(beg != end) {
226  s << delim << func(*beg++);
227  }
228  return s.str();
229 }
230 
232 template <typename T> std::string rjoin(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
233  std::ostringstream s;
234  for(std::size_t start = 0; start < v.size(); start++) {
235  if(start > 0)
236  s << delim;
237  s << v[v.size() - start - 1];
238  }
239  return s.str();
240 }
241 
242 // Based roughly on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25829143/c-trim-whitespace-from-a-string
243 
245 inline std::string &ltrim(std::string &str) {
246  auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
247  str.erase(str.begin(), it);
248  return str;
249 }
250 
252 inline std::string &ltrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
253  auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
254  str.erase(str.begin(), it);
255  return str;
256 }
257 
259 inline std::string &rtrim(std::string &str) {
260  auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
261  str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
262  return str;
263 }
264 
266 inline std::string &rtrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
267  auto it =
268  std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
269  str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
270  return str;
271 }
272 
274 inline std::string &trim(std::string &str) { return ltrim(rtrim(str)); }
275 
277 inline std::string &trim(std::string &str, const std::string filter) { return ltrim(rtrim(str, filter), filter); }
278 
280 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str) {
281  std::string s = str;
282  return trim(s);
283 }
284 
286 inline std::string &remove_quotes(std::string &str) {
287  if(str.length() > 1 && (str.front() == '"' || str.front() == '\'')) {
288  if(str.front() == str.back()) {
289  str.pop_back();
290  str.erase(str.begin(), str.begin() + 1);
291  }
292  }
293  return str;
294 }
295 
297 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
298  std::string s = str;
299  return trim(s, filter);
300 }
302 inline std::ostream &format_help(std::ostream &out, std::string name, std::string description, std::size_t wid) {
303  name = " " + name;
304  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << std::left << name;
305  if(!description.empty()) {
306  if(name.length() >= wid)
307  out << "\n" << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
308  for(const char c : description) {
309  out.put(c);
310  if(c == '\n') {
311  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
312  }
313  }
314  }
315  out << "\n";
316  return out;
317 }
318 
320 template <typename T> bool valid_first_char(T c) {
321  return std::isalnum(c, std::locale()) || c == '_' || c == '?' || c == '@';
322 }
323 
325 template <typename T> bool valid_later_char(T c) { return valid_first_char(c) || c == '.' || c == '-'; }
326 
328 inline bool valid_name_string(const std::string &str) {
329  if(str.empty() || !valid_first_char(str[0]))
330  return false;
331  for(auto c : str.substr(1))
332  if(!valid_later_char(c))
333  return false;
334  return true;
335 }
336 
338 inline bool isalpha(const std::string &str) {
339  return std::all_of(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char c) { return std::isalpha(c, std::locale()); });
340 }
341 
343 inline std::string to_lower(std::string str) {
344  std::transform(std::begin(str), std::end(str), std::begin(str), [](const std::string::value_type &x) {
345  return std::tolower(x, std::locale());
346  });
347  return str;
348 }
349 
351 inline std::string remove_underscore(std::string str) {
352  str.erase(std::remove(std::begin(str), std::end(str), '_'), std::end(str));
353  return str;
354 }
355 
357 inline std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to) {
358 
359  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
360 
361  while((start_pos = str.find(from, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
362  str.replace(start_pos, from.length(), to);
363  start_pos += to.length();
364  }
365 
366  return str;
367 }
368 
370 inline bool has_default_flag_values(const std::string &flags) {
371  return (flags.find_first_of("{!") != std::string::npos);
372 }
373 
374 inline void remove_default_flag_values(std::string &flags) {
375  auto loc = flags.find_first_of('{');
376  while(loc != std::string::npos) {
377  auto finish = flags.find_first_of("},", loc + 1);
378  if((finish != std::string::npos) && (flags[finish] == '}')) {
379  flags.erase(flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(loc),
380  flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(finish) + 1);
381  }
382  loc = flags.find_first_of('{', loc + 1);
383  }
384  flags.erase(std::remove(flags.begin(), flags.end(), '!'), flags.end());
385 }
386 
388 inline std::ptrdiff_t find_member(std::string name,
389  const std::vector<std::string> names,
390  bool ignore_case = false,
391  bool ignore_underscore = false) {
392  auto it = std::end(names);
393  if(ignore_case) {
394  if(ignore_underscore) {
395  name = detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(name));
396  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
397  return detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(local_name)) == name;
398  });
399  } else {
400  name = detail::to_lower(name);
401  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
402  return detail::to_lower(local_name) == name;
403  });
404  }
405 
406  } else if(ignore_underscore) {
407  name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
408  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
409  return detail::remove_underscore(local_name) == name;
410  });
411  } else {
412  it = std::find(std::begin(names), std::end(names), name);
413  }
414 
415  return (it != std::end(names)) ? (it - std::begin(names)) : (-1);
416 }
417 
420 template <typename Callable> inline std::string find_and_modify(std::string str, std::string trigger, Callable modify) {
421  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
422  while((start_pos = str.find(trigger, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
423  start_pos = modify(str, start_pos);
424  }
425  return str;
426 }
427 
430 inline std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter = '\0') {
431 
432  const std::string delims("\'\"`");
433  auto find_ws = [delimiter](char ch) {
434  return (delimiter == '\0') ? (std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()) != 0) : (ch == delimiter);
435  };
436  trim(str);
437 
438  std::vector<std::string> output;
439  bool embeddedQuote = false;
440  char keyChar = ' ';
441  while(!str.empty()) {
442  if(delims.find_first_of(str[0]) != std::string::npos) {
443  keyChar = str[0];
444  auto end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
445  while((end != std::string::npos) && (str[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
446  end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
447  embeddedQuote = true;
448  }
449  if(end != std::string::npos) {
450  output.push_back(str.substr(1, end - 1));
451  str = str.substr(end + 1);
452  } else {
453  output.push_back(str.substr(1));
454  str = "";
455  }
456  } else {
457  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(str), std::end(str), find_ws);
458  if(it != std::end(str)) {
459  std::string value = std::string(str.begin(), it);
460  output.push_back(value);
461  str = std::string(it + 1, str.end());
462  } else {
463  output.push_back(str);
464  str = "";
465  }
466  }
467  // transform any embedded quotes into the regular character
468  if(embeddedQuote) {
469  output.back() = find_and_replace(output.back(), std::string("\\") + keyChar, std::string(1, keyChar));
470  embeddedQuote = false;
471  }
472  trim(str);
473  }
474  return output;
475 }
476 
481 inline std::string fix_newlines(const std::string &leader, std::string input) {
482  std::string::size_type n = 0;
483  while(n != std::string::npos && n < input.size()) {
484  n = input.find('\n', n);
485  if(n != std::string::npos) {
486  input = input.substr(0, n + 1) + leader + input.substr(n + 1);
487  n += leader.size();
488  }
489  }
490  return input;
491 }
492 
497 inline std::size_t escape_detect(std::string &str, std::size_t offset) {
498  auto next = str[offset + 1];
499  if((next == '\"') || (next == '\'') || (next == '`')) {
500  auto astart = str.find_last_of("-/ \"\'`", offset - 1);
501  if(astart != std::string::npos) {
502  if(str[astart] == ((str[offset] == '=') ? '-' : '/'))
503  str[offset] = ' '; // interpret this as a space so the split_up works properly
504  }
505  }
506  return offset + 1;
507 }
508 
510 inline std::string &add_quotes_if_needed(std::string &str) {
511  if((str.front() != '"' && str.front() != '\'') || str.front() != str.back()) {
512  char quote = str.find('"') < str.find('\'') ? '\'' : '"';
513  if(str.find(' ') != std::string::npos) {
514  str.insert(0, 1, quote);
515  str.append(1, quote);
516  }
517  }
518  return str;
519 }
520 
521 } // namespace detail
522 
523 } // namespace CLI
524 
525 // From Error.hpp:
526 
527 namespace CLI {
528 
529 // Use one of these on all error classes.
530 // These are temporary and are undef'd at the end of this file.
531 #define CLI11_ERROR_DEF(parent, name) \
532  protected: \
533  name(std::string ename, std::string msg, int exit_code) : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
534  name(std::string ename, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) \
535  : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
536  \
537  public: \
538  name(std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
539  name(std::string msg, int exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {}
540 
541 // This is added after the one above if a class is used directly and builds its own message
542 #define CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(name) \
543  explicit name(std::string msg) : name(#name, msg, ExitCodes::name) {}
544 
547 enum class ExitCodes {
548  Success = 0,
549  IncorrectConstruction = 100,
550  BadNameString,
551  OptionAlreadyAdded,
552  FileError,
553  ConversionError,
554  ValidationError,
555  RequiredError,
556  RequiresError,
557  ExcludesError,
558  ExtrasError,
559  ConfigError,
560  InvalidError,
561  HorribleError,
562  OptionNotFound,
563  ArgumentMismatch,
564  BaseClass = 127
565 };
566 
567 // Error definitions
568 
574 
576 class Error : public std::runtime_error {
577  int actual_exit_code;
578  std::string error_name{"Error"};
579 
580  public:
581  int get_exit_code() const { return actual_exit_code; }
582 
583  std::string get_name() const { return error_name; }
584 
585  Error(std::string name, std::string msg, int exit_code = static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::BaseClass))
586  : runtime_error(msg), actual_exit_code(exit_code), error_name(std::move(name)) {}
587 
588  Error(std::string name, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) : Error(name, msg, static_cast<int>(exit_code)) {}
589 };
590 
591 // Note: Using Error::Error constructors does not work on GCC 4.7
592 
594 class ConstructionError : public Error {
595  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ConstructionError)
596 };
597 
599 class IncorrectConstruction : public ConstructionError {
600  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, IncorrectConstruction)
601  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(IncorrectConstruction)
602  static IncorrectConstruction PositionalFlag(std::string name) {
603  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Flags cannot be positional");
604  }
605  static IncorrectConstruction Set0Opt(std::string name) {
606  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set 0 expected, use a flag instead");
607  }
608  static IncorrectConstruction SetFlag(std::string name) {
609  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set an expected number for flags");
610  }
611  static IncorrectConstruction ChangeNotVector(std::string name) {
612  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": You can only change the expected arguments for vectors");
613  }
614  static IncorrectConstruction AfterMultiOpt(std::string name) {
615  return IncorrectConstruction(
616  name + ": You can't change expected arguments after you've changed the multi option policy!");
617  }
618  static IncorrectConstruction MissingOption(std::string name) {
619  return IncorrectConstruction("Option " + name + " is not defined");
620  }
621  static IncorrectConstruction MultiOptionPolicy(std::string name) {
622  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": multi_option_policy only works for flags and exact value options");
623  }
624 };
625 
627 class BadNameString : public ConstructionError {
628  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, BadNameString)
629  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(BadNameString)
630  static BadNameString OneCharName(std::string name) { return BadNameString("Invalid one char name: " + name); }
631  static BadNameString BadLongName(std::string name) { return BadNameString("Bad long name: " + name); }
632  static BadNameString DashesOnly(std::string name) {
633  return BadNameString("Must have a name, not just dashes: " + name);
634  }
635  static BadNameString MultiPositionalNames(std::string name) {
636  return BadNameString("Only one positional name allowed, remove: " + name);
637  }
638 };
639 
641 class OptionAlreadyAdded : public ConstructionError {
642  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, OptionAlreadyAdded)
643  explicit OptionAlreadyAdded(std::string name)
644  : OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " is already added", ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded) {}
645  static OptionAlreadyAdded Requires(std::string name, std::string other) {
646  return OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " requires " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded);
647  }
648  static OptionAlreadyAdded Excludes(std::string name, std::string other) {
649  return OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " excludes " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded);
650  }
651 };
652 
653 // Parsing errors
654 
656 class ParseError : public Error {
657  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ParseError)
658 };
659 
660 // Not really "errors"
661 
663 class Success : public ParseError {
664  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, Success)
665  Success() : Success("Successfully completed, should be caught and quit", ExitCodes::Success) {}
666 };
667 
669 class CallForHelp : public ParseError {
670  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, CallForHelp)
671  CallForHelp() : CallForHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {}
672 };
673 
675 class CallForAllHelp : public ParseError {
676  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, CallForAllHelp)
677  CallForAllHelp()
678  : CallForAllHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {}
679 };
680 
682 class RuntimeError : public ParseError {
683  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RuntimeError)
684  explicit RuntimeError(int exit_code = 1) : RuntimeError("Runtime error", exit_code) {}
685 };
686 
688 class FileError : public ParseError {
689  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, FileError)
690  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(FileError)
691  static FileError Missing(std::string name) { return FileError(name + " was not readable (missing?)"); }
692 };
693 
695 class ConversionError : public ParseError {
696  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConversionError)
697  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConversionError)
698  ConversionError(std::string member, std::string name)
699  : ConversionError("The value " + member + " is not an allowed value for " + name) {}
700  ConversionError(std::string name, std::vector<std::string> results)
701  : ConversionError("Could not convert: " + name + " = " + detail::join(results)) {}
702  static ConversionError TooManyInputsFlag(std::string name) {
703  return ConversionError(name + ": too many inputs for a flag");
704  }
705  static ConversionError TrueFalse(std::string name) {
706  return ConversionError(name + ": Should be true/false or a number");
707  }
708 };
709 
711 class ValidationError : public ParseError {
712  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ValidationError)
713  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ValidationError)
714  explicit ValidationError(std::string name, std::string msg) : ValidationError(name + ": " + msg) {}
715 };
716 
718 class RequiredError : public ParseError {
719  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiredError)
720  explicit RequiredError(std::string name) : RequiredError(name + " is required", ExitCodes::RequiredError) {}
721  static RequiredError Subcommand(std::size_t min_subcom) {
722  if(min_subcom == 1) {
723  return RequiredError("A subcommand");
724  }
725  return RequiredError("Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_subcom) + " subcommands",
726  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
727  }
728  static RequiredError
729  Option(std::size_t min_option, std::size_t max_option, std::size_t used, const std::string &option_list) {
730  if((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used == 0))
731  return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
732  if((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used > 1)) {
733  return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "] is required and " + std::to_string(used) +
734  " were given",
735  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
736  }
737  if((min_option == 1) && (used == 0))
738  return RequiredError("At least 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
739  if(used < min_option) {
740  return RequiredError("Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_option) + " options used and only " +
741  std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
742  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
743  }
744  if(max_option == 1)
745  return RequiredError("Requires at most 1 options be given from [" + option_list + "]",
746  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
747 
748  return RequiredError("Requires at most " + std::to_string(max_option) + " options be used and " +
749  std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
750  ExitCodes::RequiredError);
751  }
752 };
753 
755 class ArgumentMismatch : public ParseError {
756  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ArgumentMismatch)
757  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ArgumentMismatch)
758  ArgumentMismatch(std::string name, int expected, std::size_t received)
759  : ArgumentMismatch(expected > 0 ? ("Expected exactly " + std::to_string(expected) + " arguments to " + name +
760  ", got " + std::to_string(received))
761  : ("Expected at least " + std::to_string(-expected) + " arguments to " + name +
762  ", got " + std::to_string(received)),
763  ExitCodes::ArgumentMismatch) {}
764 
765  static ArgumentMismatch AtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
766  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At least " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " +
767  std::to_string(received));
768  }
769  static ArgumentMismatch AtMost(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
770  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At Most " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " +
771  std::to_string(received));
772  }
773  static ArgumentMismatch TypedAtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
774  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + std::to_string(num) + " required " + type + " missing");
775  }
776  static ArgumentMismatch FlagOverride(std::string name) {
777  return ArgumentMismatch(name + " was given a disallowed flag override");
778  }
779 };
780 
782 class RequiresError : public ParseError {
783  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiresError)
784  RequiresError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
785  : RequiresError(curname + " requires " + subname, ExitCodes::RequiresError) {}
786 };
787 
789 class ExcludesError : public ParseError {
790  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExcludesError)
791  ExcludesError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
792  : ExcludesError(curname + " excludes " + subname, ExitCodes::ExcludesError) {}
793 };
794 
796 class ExtrasError : public ParseError {
797  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExtrasError)
798  explicit ExtrasError(std::vector<std::string> args)
799  : ExtrasError((args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
800  : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
801  detail::rjoin(args, " "),
802  ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
803  ExtrasError(const std::string &name, std::vector<std::string> args)
804  : ExtrasError(name,
805  (args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
806  : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
807  detail::rjoin(args, " "),
808  ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
809 };
810 
812 class ConfigError : public ParseError {
813  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConfigError)
814  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConfigError)
815  static ConfigError Extras(std::string item) { return ConfigError("INI was not able to parse " + item); }
816  static ConfigError NotConfigurable(std::string item) {
817  return ConfigError(item + ": This option is not allowed in a configuration file");
818  }
819 };
820 
822 class InvalidError : public ParseError {
823  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, InvalidError)
824  explicit InvalidError(std::string name)
825  : InvalidError(name + ": Too many positional arguments with unlimited expected args", ExitCodes::InvalidError) {
826  }
827 };
828 
831 class HorribleError : public ParseError {
832  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, HorribleError)
833  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(HorribleError)
834 };
835 
836 // After parsing
837 
839 class OptionNotFound : public Error {
840  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, OptionNotFound)
841  explicit OptionNotFound(std::string name) : OptionNotFound(name + " not found", ExitCodes::OptionNotFound) {}
842 };
843 
844 #undef CLI11_ERROR_DEF
845 #undef CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE
846 
848 
849 } // namespace CLI
850 
851 // From TypeTools.hpp:
852 
853 namespace CLI {
854 
855 // Type tools
856 
857 // Utilities for type enabling
858 namespace detail {
859 // Based generally on https://rmf.io/cxx11/almost-static-if
861 enum class enabler {};
862 
864 constexpr enabler dummy = {};
865 } // namespace detail
866 
872 template <bool B, class T = void> using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
873 
875 template <typename... Ts> struct make_void { using type = void; };
876 
878 template <typename... Ts> using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
879 
881 template <bool B, class T, class F> using conditional_t = typename std::conditional<B, T, F>::type;
882 
884 template <typename T> struct is_vector : std::false_type {};
885 
887 template <class T, class A> struct is_vector<std::vector<T, A>> : std::true_type {};
888 
890 template <class T, class A> struct is_vector<const std::vector<T, A>> : std::true_type {};
891 
893 template <typename T> struct is_bool : std::false_type {};
894 
896 template <> struct is_bool<bool> : std::true_type {};
897 
899 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr : std::false_type {};
900 
902 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
903 
905 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<const std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
906 
908 template <typename T> struct is_copyable_ptr {
909  static bool const value = is_shared_ptr<T>::value || std::is_pointer<T>::value;
910 };
911 
913 template <typename T> struct IsMemberType { using type = T; };
914 
916 template <> struct IsMemberType<const char *> { using type = std::string; };
917 
918 namespace detail {
919 
920 // These are utilities for IsMember and other transforming objects
921 
924 
926 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct element_type { using type = T; };
927 
928 template <typename T> struct element_type<T, typename std::enable_if<is_copyable_ptr<T>::value>::type> {
929  using type = typename std::pointer_traits<T>::element_type;
930 };
931 
934 template <typename T> struct element_value_type { using type = typename element_type<T>::type::value_type; };
935 
937 template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct pair_adaptor : std::false_type {
938  using value_type = typename T::value_type;
939  using first_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
940  using second_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
941 
943  template <typename Q> static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
944  return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
945  }
947  template <typename Q> static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
948  return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
949  }
950 };
951 
954 template <typename T>
955 struct pair_adaptor<
956  T,
957  conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type::first_type, typename T::value_type::second_type>, void>>
958  : std::true_type {
959  using value_type = typename T::value_type;
960  using first_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::first_type>::type;
961  using second_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::second_type>::type;
962 
964  template <typename Q> static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
965  return std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
966  }
968  template <typename Q> static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
969  return std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
970  }
971 };
972 
973 // Warning is suppressed due to "bug" in gcc<5.0 and gcc 7.0 with c++17 enabled that generates a Wnarrowing warning
974 // in the unevaluated context even if the function that was using this wasn't used. The standard says narrowing in
975 // brace initialization shouldn't be allowed but for backwards compatibility gcc allows it in some contexts. It is a
976 // little fuzzy what happens in template constructs and I think that was something GCC took a little while to work out.
977 // But regardless some versions of gcc generate a warning when they shouldn't from the following code so that should be
978 // suppressed
979 #ifdef __GNUC__
980 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
981 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnarrowing"
982 #endif
983 // check for constructibility from a specific type and copy assignable used in the parse detection
984 template <typename T, typename C> class is_direct_constructible {
985  template <typename TT, typename CC>
986  static auto test(int, std::true_type) -> decltype(
987 // NVCC warns about narrowing conversions here
988 #ifdef __CUDACC__
989 #pragma diag_suppress 2361
990 #endif
991  TT { std::declval<CC>() }
992 #ifdef __CUDACC__
993 #pragma diag_default 2361
994 #endif
995  ,
996  std::is_move_assignable<TT>());
997 
998  template <typename TT, typename CC> static auto test(int, std::false_type) -> std::false_type;
999 
1000  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1001 
1002  public:
1003  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, C>(0, typename std::is_constructible<T, C>::type()))::value;
1004 };
1005 #ifdef __GNUC__
1006 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
1007 #endif
1008 
1009 // Check for output streamability
1010 // Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22758291/how-can-i-detect-if-a-type-can-be-streamed-to-an-stdostream
1011 
1012 template <typename T, typename S = std::ostringstream> class is_ostreamable {
1013  template <typename TT, typename SS>
1014  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() << std::declval<TT>(), std::true_type());
1015 
1016  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1017 
1018  public:
1019  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1020 };
1021 
1023 template <typename T, typename S = std::istringstream> class is_istreamable {
1024  template <typename TT, typename SS>
1025  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() >> std::declval<TT &>(), std::true_type());
1026 
1027  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1028 
1029  public:
1030  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1031 };
1032 
1034 template <typename T, enable_if_t<is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1035 bool from_stream(const std::string &istring, T &obj) {
1036  std::istringstream is;
1037  is.str(istring);
1038  is >> obj;
1039  return !is.fail() && !is.rdbuf()->in_avail();
1040 }
1041 
1042 template <typename T, enable_if_t<!is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1043 bool from_stream(const std::string & /*istring*/, T & /*obj*/) {
1044  return false;
1045 }
1046 
1047 // Check for tuple like types, as in classes with a tuple_size type trait
1048 template <typename S> class is_tuple_like {
1049  template <typename SS>
1050  // static auto test(int)
1051  // -> decltype(std::conditional<(std::tuple_size<SS>::value > 0), std::true_type, std::false_type>::type());
1052  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::tuple_size<SS>::value, std::true_type{});
1053  template <typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1054 
1055  public:
1056  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<S>(0))::value;
1057 };
1058 
1060 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1061 auto to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(std::forward<T>(value)) {
1062  return std::forward<T>(value);
1063 }
1064 
1066 template <typename T,
1067  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value,
1068  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1069 std::string to_string(const T &value) {
1070  return std::string(value);
1071 }
1072 
1074 template <typename T,
1075  enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<std::string, T>::value && !std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1076  is_ostreamable<T>::value,
1077  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1078 std::string to_string(T &&value) {
1079  std::stringstream stream;
1080  stream << value;
1081  return stream.str();
1082 }
1083 
1085 template <typename T,
1086  enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1087  !is_vector<typename std::remove_reference<typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::type>::value,
1088  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1089 std::string to_string(T &&) {
1090  return std::string{};
1091 }
1092 
1094 template <typename T,
1095  enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1096  is_vector<typename std::remove_reference<typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::type>::value,
1097  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1098 std::string to_string(T &&variable) {
1099  std::vector<std::string> defaults;
1100  defaults.reserve(variable.size());
1101  auto cval = variable.begin();
1102  auto end = variable.end();
1103  while(cval != end) {
1104  defaults.emplace_back(CLI::detail::to_string(*cval));
1105  ++cval;
1106  }
1107  return std::string("[" + detail::join(defaults) + "]");
1108 }
1109 
1111 template <typename T1,
1112  typename T2,
1113  typename T,
1114  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1115 auto checked_to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(to_string(std::forward<T>(value))) {
1116  return to_string(std::forward<T>(value));
1117 }
1118 
1120 template <typename T1,
1121  typename T2,
1122  typename T,
1123  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1124 std::string checked_to_string(T &&) {
1125  return std::string{};
1126 }
1128 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1129 std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1130  return std::to_string(value);
1131 }
1133 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_enum<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1134 std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1135  return std::to_string(static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(value));
1136 }
1138 template <typename T,
1139  enable_if_t<!std::is_enum<T>::value && !std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1140 auto value_string(const T &value) -> decltype(to_string(value)) {
1141  return to_string(value);
1142 }
1143 
1145 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count { static const int value{0}; };
1146 
1148 template <typename T> struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1149  static constexpr int value{std::tuple_size<T>::value};
1150 };
1152 template <typename T>
1153 struct type_count<
1154  T,
1155  typename std::enable_if<!is_vector<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1156  static constexpr int value{1};
1157 };
1158 
1160 template <typename T> struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1161  static constexpr int value{is_vector<typename T::value_type>::value ? expected_max_vector_size
1162  : type_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1163 };
1164 
1166 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct expected_count { static const int value{0}; };
1167 
1169 template <typename T>
1170 struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<!is_vector<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1171  static constexpr int value{1};
1172 };
1174 template <typename T> struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1175  static constexpr int value{expected_max_vector_size};
1176 };
1177 
1178 // Enumeration of the different supported categorizations of objects
1179 enum class object_category : int {
1180  integral_value = 2,
1181  unsigned_integral = 4,
1182  enumeration = 6,
1183  boolean_value = 8,
1184  floating_point = 10,
1185  number_constructible = 12,
1186  double_constructible = 14,
1187  integer_constructible = 16,
1188  vector_value = 30,
1189  tuple_value = 35,
1190  // string assignable or greater used in a condition so anything string like must come last
1191  string_assignable = 50,
1192  string_constructible = 60,
1193  other = 200,
1194 
1195 };
1196 
1198 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct classify_object {
1199  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::other};
1200 };
1201 
1203 template <typename T>
1204 struct classify_object<T,
1205  typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_signed<T>::value &&
1206  !is_bool<T>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1207  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integral_value};
1208 };
1209 
1211 template <typename T>
1212 struct classify_object<
1213  T,
1214  typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value && !is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1215  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::unsigned_integral};
1216 };
1217 
1219 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1220  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::boolean_value};
1221 };
1222 
1224 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value>::type> {
1225  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::floating_point};
1226 };
1227 
1229 template <typename T>
1230 struct classify_object<
1231  T,
1232  typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1233  std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value && !is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1234  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_assignable};
1235 };
1236 
1238 template <typename T>
1239 struct classify_object<
1240  T,
1241  typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1242  !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1243  std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value && !is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1244  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_constructible};
1245 };
1246 
1248 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1249  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::enumeration};
1250 };
1251 
1254 template <typename T> struct uncommon_type {
1255  using type = typename std::conditional<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1256  !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1257  !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value && !is_vector<T>::value &&
1258  !std::is_enum<T>::value,
1259  std::true_type,
1260  std::false_type>::type;
1261  static constexpr bool value = type::value;
1262 };
1263 
1265 template <typename T>
1266 struct classify_object<T,
1267  typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1268  is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1269  is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1270  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::number_constructible};
1271 };
1272 
1274 template <typename T>
1275 struct classify_object<T,
1276  typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1277  !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1278  is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1279  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integer_constructible};
1280 };
1281 
1283 template <typename T>
1284 struct classify_object<T,
1285  typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1286  is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1287  !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1288  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::double_constructible};
1289 };
1290 
1292 template <typename T>
1293 struct classify_object<T,
1294  typename std::enable_if<(type_count<T>::value >= 2 && !is_vector<T>::value) ||
1295  (is_tuple_like<T>::value && uncommon_type<T>::value &&
1296  !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1297  !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value)>::type> {
1298  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::tuple_value};
1299 };
1300 
1302 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1303  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::vector_value};
1304 };
1305 
1306 // Type name print
1307 
1311 
1312 template <typename T,
1313  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
1314  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible,
1315  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1316 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1317  return "INT";
1318 }
1319 
1320 template <typename T,
1321  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1322 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1323  return "UINT";
1324 }
1325 
1326 template <typename T,
1327  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point ||
1328  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible ||
1329  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible,
1330  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1331 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1332  return "FLOAT";
1333 }
1334 
1336 template <typename T,
1337  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1338 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1339  return "ENUM";
1340 }
1341 
1343 template <typename T,
1344  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1345 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1346  return "BOOLEAN";
1347 }
1348 
1350 template <typename T,
1351  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value >= object_category::string_assignable, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1352 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1353  return "TEXT";
1354 }
1355 
1357 template <typename T,
1358  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value && type_count<T>::value == 1,
1359  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1360 inline std::string type_name() {
1361  return type_name<typename std::tuple_element<0, T>::type>();
1362 }
1363 
1365 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1366 inline typename std::enable_if<I == type_count<T>::value, std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1367  return std::string{};
1368 }
1369 
1371 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1372  inline typename std::enable_if < I<type_count<T>::value, std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1373  std::string str = std::string(type_name<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>()) + ',' + tuple_name<T, I + 1>();
1374  if(str.back() == ',')
1375  str.pop_back();
1376  return str;
1377 }
1378 
1380 template <typename T,
1381  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value && type_count<T>::value >= 2,
1382  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1383 std::string type_name() {
1384  auto tname = std::string(1, '[') + tuple_name<T, 0>();
1385  tname.push_back(']');
1386  return tname;
1387 }
1388 
1390 template <typename T,
1391  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::vector_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1392 inline std::string type_name() {
1393  return type_name<typename T::value_type>();
1394 }
1395 
1396 // Lexical cast
1397 
1399 inline std::int64_t to_flag_value(std::string val) {
1400  static const std::string trueString("true");
1401  static const std::string falseString("false");
1402  if(val == trueString) {
1403  return 1;
1404  }
1405  if(val == falseString) {
1406  return -1;
1407  }
1408  val = detail::to_lower(val);
1409  std::int64_t ret;
1410  if(val.size() == 1) {
1411  if(val[0] >= '1' && val[0] <= '9') {
1412  return (static_cast<std::int64_t>(val[0]) - '0');
1413  }
1414  switch(val[0]) {
1415  case '0':
1416  case 'f':
1417  case 'n':
1418  case '-':
1419  ret = -1;
1420  break;
1421  case 't':
1422  case 'y':
1423  case '+':
1424  ret = 1;
1425  break;
1426  default:
1427  throw std::invalid_argument("unrecognized character");
1428  }
1429  return ret;
1430  }
1431  if(val == trueString || val == "on" || val == "yes" || val == "enable") {
1432  ret = 1;
1433  } else if(val == falseString || val == "off" || val == "no" || val == "disable") {
1434  ret = -1;
1435  } else {
1436  ret = std::stoll(val);
1437  }
1438  return ret;
1439 }
1440 
1442 template <typename T,
1443  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1444 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1445  try {
1446  std::size_t n = 0;
1447  std::int64_t output_ll = std::stoll(input, &n, 0);
1448  output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1449  return n == input.size() && static_cast<std::int64_t>(output) == output_ll;
1450  } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1451  return false;
1452  } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1453  return false;
1454  }
1455 }
1456 
1458 template <typename T,
1459  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1460 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1461  if(!input.empty() && input.front() == '-')
1462  return false; // std::stoull happily converts negative values to junk without any errors.
1463 
1464  try {
1465  std::size_t n = 0;
1466  std::uint64_t output_ll = std::stoull(input, &n, 0);
1467  output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1468  return n == input.size() && static_cast<std::uint64_t>(output) == output_ll;
1469  } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1470  return false;
1471  } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1472  return false;
1473  }
1474 }
1475 
1477 template <typename T,
1478  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1479 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1480  try {
1481  auto out = to_flag_value(input);
1482  output = (out > 0);
1483  return true;
1484  } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1485  return false;
1486  } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1487  // if the number is out of the range of a 64 bit value then it is still a number and for this purpose is still
1488  // valid all we care about the sign
1489  output = (input[0] != '-');
1490  return true;
1491  }
1492 }
1493 
1495 template <typename T,
1496  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1497 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1498  try {
1499  std::size_t n = 0;
1500  output = static_cast<T>(std::stold(input, &n));
1501  return n == input.size();
1502  } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1503  return false;
1504  } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1505  return false;
1506  }
1507 }
1508 
1510 template <typename T,
1511  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_assignable, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1512 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1513  output = input;
1514  return true;
1515 }
1516 
1518 template <
1519  typename T,
1520  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1521 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1522  output = T(input);
1523  return true;
1524 }
1525 
1527 template <typename T,
1528  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1529 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1530  typename std::underlying_type<T>::type val;
1531  bool retval = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
1532  if(!retval) {
1533  return false;
1534  }
1535  output = static_cast<T>(val);
1536  return true;
1537 }
1538 
1540 template <
1541  typename T,
1542  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1543 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1544  int val;
1545  if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1546  output = T(val);
1547  return true;
1548  } else {
1549  double dval;
1550  if(lexical_cast(input, dval)) {
1551  output = T{dval};
1552  return true;
1553  }
1554  }
1555  return from_stream(input, output);
1556 }
1557 
1559 template <
1560  typename T,
1561  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1562 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1563  int val;
1564  if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1565  output = T(val);
1566  return true;
1567  }
1568  return from_stream(input, output);
1569 }
1570 
1572 template <
1573  typename T,
1574  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1575 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1576  double val;
1577  if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1578  output = T{val};
1579  return true;
1580  }
1581  return from_stream(input, output);
1582 }
1583 
1585 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1586 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1587  static_assert(is_istreamable<T>::value,
1588  "option object type must have a lexical cast overload or streaming input operator(>>) defined, if it "
1589  "is convertible from another type use the add_option<T, XC>(...) with XC being the known type");
1590  return from_stream(input, output);
1591 }
1592 
1594 template <
1595  typename T,
1596  typename XC,
1597  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, XC>::value && (classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_assignable ||
1598  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_constructible),
1599  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1600 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1601  return lexical_cast(input, output);
1602 }
1603 
1605 template <typename T,
1606  typename XC,
1607  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, XC>::value && classify_object<T>::value != object_category::string_assignable &&
1608  classify_object<T>::value != object_category::string_constructible,
1609  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1610 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1611  if(input.empty()) {
1612  output = T{};
1613  return true;
1614  }
1615  return lexical_cast(input, output);
1616 }
1617 
1619 template <
1620  typename T,
1621  typename XC,
1622  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T, XC>::value && std::is_assignable<T &, XC &>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1623 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1624  XC val{};
1625  bool parse_result = (!input.empty()) ? lexical_cast<XC>(input, val) : true;
1626  if(parse_result) {
1627  output = val;
1628  }
1629  return parse_result;
1630 }
1631 
1633 template <typename T,
1634  typename XC,
1635  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T, XC>::value && !std::is_assignable<T &, XC &>::value &&
1636  std::is_move_assignable<T>::value,
1637  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1638 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1639  XC val{};
1640  bool parse_result = input.empty() ? true : lexical_cast<XC>(input, val);
1641  if(parse_result) {
1642  output = T(val); // use () form of constructor to allow some implicit conversions
1643  }
1644  return parse_result;
1645 }
1647 template <
1648  typename T,
1649  typename XC,
1650  enable_if_t<!is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<XC>::value && !is_vector<T>::value && !is_vector<XC>::value,
1651  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1652 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1653  return lexical_assign<T, XC>(strings[0], output);
1654 }
1655 
1657 template <typename T,
1658  typename XC,
1659  enable_if_t<type_count<T>::value == 1 && type_count<XC>::value == 2, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1660 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1661  typename std::tuple_element<0, XC>::type v1;
1662  typename std::tuple_element<1, XC>::type v2;
1663  bool retval = lexical_assign<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings[0], v1);
1664  if(strings.size() > 1) {
1665  retval = retval && lexical_assign<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings[1], v2);
1666  }
1667  if(retval) {
1668  output = T{v1, v2};
1669  }
1670  return retval;
1671 }
1672 
1674 template <class T,
1675  class XC,
1676  enable_if_t<expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size &&
1677  expected_count<XC>::value == expected_max_vector_size && type_count<XC>::value == 1,
1678  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1679 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1680  output.clear();
1681  output.reserve(strings.size());
1682  for(const auto &elem : strings) {
1683 
1684  output.emplace_back();
1685  bool retval = lexical_assign<typename T::value_type, typename XC::value_type>(elem, output.back());
1686  if(!retval) {
1687  return false;
1688  }
1689  }
1690  return (!output.empty());
1691 }
1692 
1694 template <class T,
1695  class XC,
1696  enable_if_t<expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size &&
1697  expected_count<XC>::value == expected_max_vector_size && type_count<XC>::value == 2,
1698  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1699 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1700  output.clear();
1701  for(std::size_t ii = 0; ii < strings.size(); ii += 2) {
1702 
1703  typename std::tuple_element<0, typename XC::value_type>::type v1;
1704  typename std::tuple_element<1, typename XC::value_type>::type v2;
1705  bool retval = lexical_assign<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings[ii], v1);
1706  if(strings.size() > ii + 1) {
1707  retval = retval && lexical_assign<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings[ii + 1], v2);
1708  }
1709  if(retval) {
1710  output.emplace_back(v1, v2);
1711  } else {
1712  return false;
1713  }
1714  }
1715  return (!output.empty());
1716 }
1717 
1719 template <class T,
1720  class XC,
1721  enable_if_t<(expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size) && (expected_count<XC>::value == 1) &&
1722  (type_count<XC>::value == 1),
1723  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1724 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1725  bool retval = true;
1726  output.clear();
1727  output.reserve(strings.size());
1728  for(const auto &elem : strings) {
1729 
1730  output.emplace_back();
1731  retval = retval && lexical_assign<typename T::value_type, XC>(elem, output.back());
1732  }
1733  return (!output.empty()) && retval;
1734 }
1735 // This one is last since it can call other lexical_conversion functions
1737 template <typename T,
1738  typename XC,
1739  enable_if_t<!is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_vector<T>::value && is_vector<XC>::value, detail::enabler> =
1740  detail::dummy>
1741 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1742 
1743  if(strings.size() > 1 || (!strings.empty() && !(strings.front().empty()))) {
1744  XC val;
1745  auto retval = lexical_conversion<XC, XC>(strings, val);
1746  output = T{val};
1747  return retval;
1748  }
1749  output = T{};
1750  return true;
1751 }
1752 
1754 template <class T, class XC, std::size_t I>
1755 inline typename std::enable_if<I >= type_count<T>::value, bool>::type tuple_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &,
1756  T &) {
1757  return true;
1758 }
1760 template <class T, class XC, std::size_t I>
1761  inline typename std::enable_if <
1762  I<type_count<T>::value, bool>::type tuple_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, T &output) {
1763  bool retval = true;
1764  if(strings.size() > I) {
1765  retval = retval && lexical_assign<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type,
1766  typename std::conditional<is_tuple_like<XC>::value,
1767  typename std::tuple_element<I, XC>::type,
1768  XC>::type>(strings[I], std::get<I>(output));
1769  }
1770  retval = retval && tuple_conversion<T, XC, I + 1>(strings, output);
1771  return retval;
1772 }
1773 
1775 template <class T, class XC, enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1776 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1777  static_assert(
1778  !is_tuple_like<XC>::value || type_count<T>::value == type_count<XC>::value,
1779  "if the conversion type is defined as a tuple it must be the same size as the type you are converting to");
1780  return tuple_conversion<T, XC, 0>(strings, output);
1781 }
1782 
1784 template <class T,
1785  class XC,
1786  enable_if_t<expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size &&
1787  expected_count<XC>::value == expected_max_vector_size && (type_count<XC>::value > 2),
1788  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1789 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1790  bool retval = true;
1791  output.clear();
1792  std::vector<std::string> temp;
1793  std::size_t ii = 0;
1794  std::size_t icount = 0;
1795  std::size_t xcm = type_count<XC>::value;
1796  while(ii < strings.size()) {
1797  temp.push_back(strings[ii]);
1798  ++ii;
1799  ++icount;
1800  if(icount == xcm || temp.back().empty()) {
1801  if(static_cast<int>(xcm) == expected_max_vector_size) {
1802  temp.pop_back();
1803  }
1804  output.emplace_back();
1805  retval = retval && lexical_conversion<typename T::value_type, typename XC::value_type>(temp, output.back());
1806  temp.clear();
1807  if(!retval) {
1808  return false;
1809  }
1810  icount = 0;
1811  }
1812  }
1813  return retval;
1814 }
1820 template <typename T,
1821  enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1822 void sum_flag_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &flags, T &output) {
1823  std::int64_t count{0};
1824  for(auto &flag : flags) {
1825  count += detail::to_flag_value(flag);
1826  }
1827  output = (count > 0) ? static_cast<T>(count) : T{0};
1828 }
1829 
1835 template <typename T,
1836  enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_signed<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1837 void sum_flag_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &flags, T &output) {
1838  std::int64_t count{0};
1839  for(auto &flag : flags) {
1840  count += detail::to_flag_value(flag);
1841  }
1842  output = static_cast<T>(count);
1843 }
1844 
1845 } // namespace detail
1846 } // namespace CLI
1847 
1848 // From Split.hpp:
1849 
1850 namespace CLI {
1851 namespace detail {
1852 
1853 // Returns false if not a short option. Otherwise, sets opt name and rest and returns true
1854 inline bool split_short(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &rest) {
1855  if(current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '-' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
1856  name = current.substr(1, 1);
1857  rest = current.substr(2);
1858  return true;
1859  }
1860  return false;
1861 }
1862 
1863 // Returns false if not a long option. Otherwise, sets opt name and other side of = and returns true
1864 inline bool split_long(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value) {
1865  if(current.size() > 2 && current.substr(0, 2) == "--" && valid_first_char(current[2])) {
1866  auto loc = current.find_first_of('=');
1867  if(loc != std::string::npos) {
1868  name = current.substr(2, loc - 2);
1869  value = current.substr(loc + 1);
1870  } else {
1871  name = current.substr(2);
1872  value = "";
1873  }
1874  return true;
1875  }
1876  return false;
1877 }
1878 
1879 // Returns false if not a windows style option. Otherwise, sets opt name and value and returns true
1880 inline bool split_windows_style(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value) {
1881  if(current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '/' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
1882  auto loc = current.find_first_of(':');
1883  if(loc != std::string::npos) {
1884  name = current.substr(1, loc - 1);
1885  value = current.substr(loc + 1);
1886  } else {
1887  name = current.substr(1);
1888  value = "";
1889  }
1890  return true;
1891  }
1892  return false;
1893 }
1894 
1895 // Splits a string into multiple long and short names
1896 inline std::vector<std::string> split_names(std::string current) {
1897  std::vector<std::string> output;
1898  std::size_t val;
1899  while((val = current.find(",")) != std::string::npos) {
1900  output.push_back(trim_copy(current.substr(0, val)));
1901  current = current.substr(val + 1);
1902  }
1903  output.push_back(trim_copy(current));
1904  return output;
1905 }
1906 
1908 inline std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> get_default_flag_values(const std::string &str) {
1909  std::vector<std::string> flags = split_names(str);
1910  flags.erase(std::remove_if(flags.begin(),
1911  flags.end(),
1912  [](const std::string &name) {
1913  return ((name.empty()) || (!(((name.find_first_of('{') != std::string::npos) &&
1914  (name.back() == '}')) ||
1915  (name[0] == '!'))));
1916  }),
1917  flags.end());
1918  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> output;
1919  output.reserve(flags.size());
1920  for(auto &flag : flags) {
1921  auto def_start = flag.find_first_of('{');
1922  std::string defval = "false";
1923  if((def_start != std::string::npos) && (flag.back() == '}')) {
1924  defval = flag.substr(def_start + 1);
1925  defval.pop_back();
1926  flag.erase(def_start, std::string::npos);
1927  }
1928  flag.erase(0, flag.find_first_not_of("-!"));
1929  output.emplace_back(flag, defval);
1930  }
1931  return output;
1932 }
1933 
1935 inline std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string>
1936 get_names(const std::vector<std::string> &input) {
1937 
1938  std::vector<std::string> short_names;
1939  std::vector<std::string> long_names;
1940  std::string pos_name;
1941 
1942  for(std::string name : input) {
1943  if(name.length() == 0) {
1944  continue;
1945  }
1946  if(name.length() > 1 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] != '-') {
1947  if(name.length() == 2 && valid_first_char(name[1]))
1948  short_names.emplace_back(1, name[1]);
1949  else
1950  throw BadNameString::OneCharName(name);
1951  } else if(name.length() > 2 && name.substr(0, 2) == "--") {
1952  name = name.substr(2);
1953  if(valid_name_string(name))
1954  long_names.push_back(name);
1955  else
1956  throw BadNameString::BadLongName(name);
1957  } else if(name == "-" || name == "--") {
1958  throw BadNameString::DashesOnly(name);
1959  } else {
1960  if(pos_name.length() > 0)
1961  throw BadNameString::MultiPositionalNames(name);
1962  pos_name = name;
1963  }
1964  }
1965 
1966  return std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string>(
1967  short_names, long_names, pos_name);
1968 }
1969 
1970 } // namespace detail
1971 } // namespace CLI
1972 
1973 // From ConfigFwd.hpp:
1974 
1975 namespace CLI {
1976 
1977 class App;
1978 
1980 struct ConfigItem {
1982  std::vector<std::string> parents{};
1983 
1985  std::string name{};
1986 
1988  std::vector<std::string> inputs{};
1989 
1991  std::string fullname() const {
1992  std::vector<std::string> tmp = parents;
1993  tmp.emplace_back(name);
1994  return detail::join(tmp, ".");
1995  }
1996 };
1997 
1999 class Config {
2000  protected:
2001  std::vector<ConfigItem> items{};
2002 
2003  public:
2005  virtual std::string to_config(const App *, bool, bool, std::string) const = 0;
2006 
2008  virtual std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &) const = 0;
2009 
2011  virtual std::string to_flag(const ConfigItem &item) const {
2012  if(item.inputs.size() == 1) {
2013  return item.inputs.at(0);
2014  }
2015  throw ConversionError::TooManyInputsFlag(item.fullname());
2016  }
2017 
2019  std::vector<ConfigItem> from_file(const std::string &name) {
2020  std::ifstream input{name};
2021  if(!input.good())
2022  throw FileError::Missing(name);
2023 
2024  return from_config(input);
2025  }
2026 
2028  virtual ~Config() = default;
2029 };
2030 
2032 class ConfigBase : public Config {
2033  protected:
2035  char commentChar = ';';
2037  char arrayStart = '\0';
2039  char arrayEnd = '\0';
2041  char arraySeparator = ' ';
2043  char valueDelimiter = '=';
2044 
2045  public:
2046  std::string
2047  to_config(const App * /*app*/, bool default_also, bool write_description, std::string prefix) const override;
2048 
2049  std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &input) const override;
2051  ConfigBase *comment(char cchar) {
2052  commentChar = cchar;
2053  return this;
2054  }
2056  ConfigBase *arrayBounds(char aStart, char aEnd) {
2057  arrayStart = aStart;
2058  arrayEnd = aEnd;
2059  return this;
2060  }
2062  ConfigBase *arrayDelimiter(char aSep) {
2063  arraySeparator = aSep;
2064  return this;
2065  }
2067  ConfigBase *valueSeparator(char vSep) {
2068  valueDelimiter = vSep;
2069  return this;
2070  }
2071 };
2072 
2074 using ConfigINI = ConfigBase;
2075 
2077 class ConfigTOML : public ConfigINI {
2078 
2079  public:
2080  ConfigTOML() {
2081  commentChar = '#';
2082  arrayStart = '[';
2083  arrayEnd = ']';
2084  arraySeparator = ',';
2085  valueDelimiter = '=';
2086  }
2087 };
2088 } // namespace CLI
2089 
2090 // From Validators.hpp:
2091 
2092 namespace CLI {
2093 
2094 class Option;
2095 
2097 
2104 
2106 class Validator {
2107  protected:
2109  std::function<std::string()> desc_function_{[]() { return std::string{}; }};
2110 
2113  std::function<std::string(std::string &)> func_{[](std::string &) { return std::string{}; }};
2115  std::string name_{};
2117  int application_index_ = -1;
2119  bool active_{true};
2121  bool non_modifying_{false};
2122 
2123  public:
2124  Validator() = default;
2126  explicit Validator(std::string validator_desc) : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }) {}
2128  Validator(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op, std::string validator_desc, std::string validator_name = "")
2129  : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }), func_(std::move(op)),
2130  name_(std::move(validator_name)) {}
2132  Validator &operation(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op) {
2133  func_ = std::move(op);
2134  return *this;
2135  }
2138  std::string operator()(std::string &str) const {
2139  std::string retstring;
2140  if(active_) {
2141  if(non_modifying_) {
2142  std::string value = str;
2143  retstring = func_(value);
2144  } else {
2145  retstring = func_(str);
2146  }
2147  }
2148  return retstring;
2149  }
2150 
2153  std::string operator()(const std::string &str) const {
2154  std::string value = str;
2155  return (active_) ? func_(value) : std::string{};
2156  }
2157 
2159  Validator &description(std::string validator_desc) {
2160  desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
2161  return *this;
2162  }
2164  Validator description(std::string validator_desc) const {
2165  Validator newval(*this);
2166  newval.desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
2167  return newval;
2168  }
2170  std::string get_description() const {
2171  if(active_) {
2172  return desc_function_();
2173  }
2174  return std::string{};
2175  }
2177  Validator &name(std::string validator_name) {
2178  name_ = std::move(validator_name);
2179  return *this;
2180  }
2182  Validator name(std::string validator_name) const {
2183  Validator newval(*this);
2184  newval.name_ = std::move(validator_name);
2185  return newval;
2186  }
2188  const std::string &get_name() const { return name_; }
2190  Validator &active(bool active_val = true) {
2191  active_ = active_val;
2192  return *this;
2193  }
2195  Validator active(bool active_val = true) const {
2196  Validator newval(*this);
2197  newval.active_ = active_val;
2198  return newval;
2199  }
2200 
2202  Validator &non_modifying(bool no_modify = true) {
2203  non_modifying_ = no_modify;
2204  return *this;
2205  }
2207  Validator &application_index(int app_index) {
2208  application_index_ = app_index;
2209  return *this;
2210  }
2212  Validator application_index(int app_index) const {
2213  Validator newval(*this);
2214  newval.application_index_ = app_index;
2215  return newval;
2216  }
2218  int get_application_index() const { return application_index_; }
2220  bool get_active() const { return active_; }
2221 
2223  bool get_modifying() const { return !non_modifying_; }
2224 
2227  Validator operator&(const Validator &other) const {
2228  Validator newval;
2229 
2230  newval._merge_description(*this, other, " AND ");
2231 
2232  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
2233  const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f1 = func_;
2234  const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f2 = other.func_;
2235 
2236  newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
2237  std::string s1 = f1(input);
2238  std::string s2 = f2(input);
2239  if(!s1.empty() && !s2.empty())
2240  return std::string("(") + s1 + ") AND (" + s2 + ")";
2241  else
2242  return s1 + s2;
2243  };
2244 
2245  newval.active_ = (active_ & other.active_);
2246  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
2247  return newval;
2248  }
2249 
2252  Validator operator|(const Validator &other) const {
2253  Validator newval;
2254 
2255  newval._merge_description(*this, other, " OR ");
2256 
2257  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
2258  const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f1 = func_;
2259  const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f2 = other.func_;
2260 
2261  newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
2262  std::string s1 = f1(input);
2263  std::string s2 = f2(input);
2264  if(s1.empty() || s2.empty())
2265  return std::string();
2266 
2267  return std::string("(") + s1 + ") OR (" + s2 + ")";
2268  };
2269  newval.active_ = (active_ & other.active_);
2270  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
2271  return newval;
2272  }
2273 
2275  Validator operator!() const {
2276  Validator newval;
2277  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = desc_function_;
2278  newval.desc_function_ = [dfunc1]() {
2279  auto str = dfunc1();
2280  return (!str.empty()) ? std::string("NOT ") + str : std::string{};
2281  };
2282  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
2283  const std::function<std::string(std::string & res)> &f1 = func_;
2284 
2285  newval.func_ = [f1, dfunc1](std::string &test) -> std::string {
2286  std::string s1 = f1(test);
2287  if(s1.empty()) {
2288  return std::string("check ") + dfunc1() + " succeeded improperly";
2289  }
2290  return std::string{};
2291  };
2292  newval.active_ = active_;
2293  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
2294  return newval;
2295  }
2296 
2297  private:
2298  void _merge_description(const Validator &val1, const Validator &val2, const std::string &merger) {
2299 
2300  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = val1.desc_function_;
2301  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc2 = val2.desc_function_;
2302 
2303  desc_function_ = [=]() {
2304  std::string f1 = dfunc1();
2305  std::string f2 = dfunc2();
2306  if((f1.empty()) || (f2.empty())) {
2307  return f1 + f2;
2308  }
2309  return std::string(1, '(') + f1 + ')' + merger + '(' + f2 + ')';
2310  };
2311  }
2312 }; // namespace CLI
2313 
2315 class CustomValidator : public Validator {
2316  public:
2317 };
2318 // The implementation of the built in validators is using the Validator class;
2319 // the user is only expected to use the const (static) versions (since there's no setup).
2320 // Therefore, this is in detail.
2321 namespace detail {
2322 
2324 enum class path_type { nonexistent, file, directory };
2325 
2326 #if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
2327 inline path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
2329  std::error_code ec;
2330  auto stat = std::filesystem::status(file, ec);
2331  if(ec) {
2332  return path_type::nonexistent;
2333  }
2334  switch(stat.type()) {
2335  case std::filesystem::file_type::none:
2336  case std::filesystem::file_type::not_found:
2337  return path_type::nonexistent;
2338  case std::filesystem::file_type::directory:
2339  return path_type::directory;
2340  case std::filesystem::file_type::symlink:
2341  case std::filesystem::file_type::block:
2342  case std::filesystem::file_type::character:
2343  case std::filesystem::file_type::fifo:
2344  case std::filesystem::file_type::socket:
2345  case std::filesystem::file_type::regular:
2346  case std::filesystem::file_type::unknown:
2347  default:
2348  return path_type::file;
2349  }
2350 }
2351 #else
2352 inline path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
2354 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
2355  struct __stat64 buffer;
2356  if(_stat64(file, &buffer) == 0) {
2357  return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
2358  }
2359 #else
2360  struct stat buffer;
2361  if(stat(file, &buffer) == 0) {
2362  return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
2363  }
2364 #endif
2365  return path_type::nonexistent;
2366 }
2367 #endif
2368 class ExistingFileValidator : public Validator {
2370  public:
2371  ExistingFileValidator() : Validator("FILE") {
2372  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2373  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2374  if(path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
2375  return "File does not exist: " + filename;
2376  }
2377  if(path_result == path_type::directory) {
2378  return "File is actually a directory: " + filename;
2379  }
2380  return std::string();
2381  };
2382  }
2383 };
2384 
2386 class ExistingDirectoryValidator : public Validator {
2387  public:
2388  ExistingDirectoryValidator() : Validator("DIR") {
2389  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2390  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2391  if(path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
2392  return "Directory does not exist: " + filename;
2393  }
2394  if(path_result == path_type::file) {
2395  return "Directory is actually a file: " + filename;
2396  }
2397  return std::string();
2398  };
2399  }
2400 };
2401 
2403 class ExistingPathValidator : public Validator {
2404  public:
2405  ExistingPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(existing)") {
2406  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2407  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2408  if(path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
2409  return "Path does not exist: " + filename;
2410  }
2411  return std::string();
2412  };
2413  }
2414 };
2415 
2417 class NonexistentPathValidator : public Validator {
2418  public:
2419  NonexistentPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(non-existing)") {
2420  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2421  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2422  if(path_result != path_type::nonexistent) {
2423  return "Path already exists: " + filename;
2424  }
2425  return std::string();
2426  };
2427  }
2428 };
2429 
2431 class IPV4Validator : public Validator {
2432  public:
2433  IPV4Validator() : Validator("IPV4") {
2434  func_ = [](std::string &ip_addr) {
2435  auto result = CLI::detail::split(ip_addr, '.');
2436  if(result.size() != 4) {
2437  return std::string("Invalid IPV4 address must have four parts (") + ip_addr + ')';
2438  }
2439  int num;
2440  for(const auto &var : result) {
2441  bool retval = detail::lexical_cast(var, num);
2442  if(!retval) {
2443  return std::string("Failed parsing number (") + var + ')';
2444  }
2445  if(num < 0 || num > 255) {
2446  return std::string("Each IP number must be between 0 and 255 ") + var;
2447  }
2448  }
2449  return std::string();
2450  };
2451  }
2452 };
2453 
2455 class PositiveNumber : public Validator {
2456  public:
2457  PositiveNumber() : Validator("POSITIVE") {
2458  func_ = [](std::string &number_str) {
2459  double number;
2460  if(!detail::lexical_cast(number_str, number)) {
2461  return std::string("Failed parsing number: (") + number_str + ')';
2462  }
2463  if(number <= 0) {
2464  return std::string("Number less or equal to 0: (") + number_str + ')';
2465  }
2466  return std::string();
2467  };
2468  }
2469 };
2471 class NonNegativeNumber : public Validator {
2472  public:
2473  NonNegativeNumber() : Validator("NONNEGATIVE") {
2474  func_ = [](std::string &number_str) {
2475  double number;
2476  if(!detail::lexical_cast(number_str, number)) {
2477  return std::string("Failed parsing number: (") + number_str + ')';
2478  }
2479  if(number < 0) {
2480  return std::string("Number less than 0: (") + number_str + ')';
2481  }
2482  return std::string();
2483  };
2484  }
2485 };
2486 
2488 class Number : public Validator {
2489  public:
2490  Number() : Validator("NUMBER") {
2491  func_ = [](std::string &number_str) {
2492  double number;
2493  if(!detail::lexical_cast(number_str, number)) {
2494  return std::string("Failed parsing as a number (") + number_str + ')';
2495  }
2496  return std::string();
2497  };
2498  }
2499 };
2500 
2501 } // namespace detail
2502 
2503 // Static is not needed here, because global const implies static.
2504 
2506 const detail::ExistingFileValidator ExistingFile;
2507 
2509 const detail::ExistingDirectoryValidator ExistingDirectory;
2510 
2512 const detail::ExistingPathValidator ExistingPath;
2513 
2515 const detail::NonexistentPathValidator NonexistentPath;
2516 
2518 const detail::IPV4Validator ValidIPV4;
2519 
2521 const detail::PositiveNumber PositiveNumber;
2522 
2524 const detail::NonNegativeNumber NonNegativeNumber;
2525 
2527 const detail::Number Number;
2528 
2530 class Range : public Validator {
2531  public:
2536  template <typename T> Range(T min, T max) {
2537  std::stringstream out;
2538  out << detail::type_name<T>() << " in [" << min << " - " << max << "]";
2539  description(out.str());
2540 
2541  func_ = [min, max](std::string &input) {
2542  T val;
2543  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
2544  if((!converted) || (val < min || val > max))
2545  return std::string("Value ") + input + " not in range " + std::to_string(min) + " to " +
2546  std::to_string(max);
2547 
2548  return std::string();
2549  };
2550  }
2551 
2553  template <typename T> explicit Range(T max) : Range(static_cast<T>(0), max) {}
2554 };
2555 
2557 class Bound : public Validator {
2558  public:
2563  template <typename T> Bound(T min, T max) {
2564  std::stringstream out;
2565  out << detail::type_name<T>() << " bounded to [" << min << " - " << max << "]";
2566  description(out.str());
2567 
2568  func_ = [min, max](std::string &input) {
2569  T val;
2570  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
2571  if(!converted) {
2572  return std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted";
2573  }
2574  if(val < min)
2575  input = detail::to_string(min);
2576  else if(val > max)
2577  input = detail::to_string(max);
2578 
2579  return std::string{};
2580  };
