2581  }
2582 
2584  template <typename T> explicit Bound(T max) : Bound(static_cast<T>(0), max) {}
2585 };
2586 
2587 namespace detail {
2588 template <typename T,
2589  enable_if_t<is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2590 auto smart_deref(T value) -> decltype(*value) {
2591  return *value;
2592 }
2593 
2594 template <
2595  typename T,
2596  enable_if_t<!is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2597 typename std::remove_reference<T>::type &smart_deref(T &value) {
2598  return value;
2599 }
2601 template <typename T> std::string generate_set(const T &set) {
2602  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2603  using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
2604  std::string out(1, '{');
2605  out.append(detail::join(
2606  detail::smart_deref(set),
2607  [](const iteration_type_t &v) { return detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v); },
2608  ","));
2609  out.push_back('}');
2610  return out;
2611 }
2612 
2614 template <typename T> std::string generate_map(const T &map, bool key_only = false) {
2615  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2616  using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
2617  std::string out(1, '{');
2618  out.append(detail::join(
2619  detail::smart_deref(map),
2620  [key_only](const iteration_type_t &v) {
2621  std::string res{detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v))};
2622 
2623  if(!key_only) {
2624  res.append("->");
2625  res += detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
2626  }
2627  return res;
2628  },
2629  ","));
2630  out.push_back('}');
2631  return out;
2632 }
2633 
2634 template <typename C, typename V> struct has_find {
2635  template <typename CC, typename VV>
2636  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<CC>().find(std::declval<VV>()), std::true_type());
2637  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> decltype(std::false_type());
2638 
2639  static const auto value = decltype(test<C, V>(0))::value;
2640  using type = std::integral_constant<bool, value>;
2641 };
2642 
2644 template <typename T, typename V, enable_if_t<!has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2645 auto search(const T &set, const V &val) -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
2646  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2647  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
2648  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&val](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
2649  return (detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v) == val);
2650  });
2651  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
2652 }
2653 
2655 template <typename T, typename V, enable_if_t<has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2656 auto search(const T &set, const V &val) -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
2657  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
2658  auto it = setref.find(val);
2659  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
2660 }
2661 
2663 template <typename T, typename V>
2664 auto search(const T &set, const V &val, const std::function<V(V)> &filter_function)
2665  -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
2666  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2667  // do the potentially faster first search
2668  auto res = search(set, val);
2669  if((res.first) || (!(filter_function))) {
2670  return res;
2671  }
2672  // if we haven't found it do the longer linear search with all the element translations
2673  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
2674  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
2675  V a{detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v)};
2676  a = filter_function(a);
2677  return (a == val);
2678  });
2679  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
2680 }
2681 
2682 // the following suggestion was made by Nikita Ofitserov(@himikof)
2683 // done in templates to prevent compiler warnings on negation of unsigned numbers
2684 
2686 template <typename T>
2687 inline typename std::enable_if<std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
2688  if((a > 0) == (b > 0)) {
2689  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / (std::abs)(a) < (std::abs)(b));
2690  } else {
2691  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() / (std::abs)(a) > -(std::abs)(b));
2692  }
2693 }
2695 template <typename T>
2696 inline typename std::enable_if<!std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
2697  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / a < b);
2698 }
2699 
2701 template <typename T> typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
2702  if(a == 0 || b == 0 || a == 1 || b == 1) {
2703  a *= b;
2704  return true;
2705  }
2706  if(a == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() || b == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)()) {
2707  return false;
2708  }
2709  if(overflowCheck(a, b)) {
2710  return false;
2711  }
2712  a *= b;
2713  return true;
2714 }
2715 
2717 template <typename T>
2718 typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
2719  T c = a * b;
2720  if(std::isinf(c) && !std::isinf(a) && !std::isinf(b)) {
2721  return false;
2722  }
2723  a = c;
2724  return true;
2725 }
2726 
2727 } // namespace detail
2729 class IsMember : public Validator {
2730  public:
2731  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
2732 
2734  template <typename T, typename... Args>
2735  IsMember(std::initializer_list<T> values, Args &&... args)
2736  : IsMember(std::vector<T>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
2737 
2739  template <typename T> explicit IsMember(T &&set) : IsMember(std::forward<T>(set), nullptr) {}
2740 
2743  template <typename T, typename F> explicit IsMember(T set, F filter_function) {
2744 
2745  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
2746  // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
2747  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
2748  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
2749 
2750  using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // This will convert bad types to good ones
2751  // (const char * to std::string)
2752 
2753  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
2754  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
2755 
2756  // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
2757  desc_function_ = [set]() { return detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set)); };
2758 
2759  // This is the function that validates
2760  // It stores a copy of the set pointer-like, so shared_ptr will stay alive
2761  func_ = [set, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
2762  local_item_t b;
2763  if(!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
2764  throw ValidationError(input); // name is added later
2765  }
2766  if(filter_fn) {
2767  b = filter_fn(b);
2768  }
2769  auto res = detail::search(set, b, filter_fn);
2770  if(res.first) {
2771  // Make sure the version in the input string is identical to the one in the set
2772  if(filter_fn) {
2773  input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(*(res.second)));
2774  }
2775 
2776  // Return empty error string (success)
2777  return std::string{};
2778  }
2779 
2780  // If you reach this point, the result was not found
2781  std::string out(" not in ");
2782  out += detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set));
2783  return out;
2784  };
2785  }
2786 
2788  template <typename T, typename... Args>
2789  IsMember(T &&set, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&... other)
2790  : IsMember(
2791  std::forward<T>(set),
2792  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
2793  other...) {}
2794 };
2795 
2797 template <typename T> using TransformPairs = std::vector<std::pair<std::string, T>>;
2798 
2800 class Transformer : public Validator {
2801  public:
2802  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
2803 
2805  template <typename... Args>
2806  Transformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values, Args &&... args)
2807  : Transformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
2808 
2810  template <typename T> explicit Transformer(T &&mapping) : Transformer(std::forward<T>(mapping), nullptr) {}
2811 
2814  template <typename T, typename F> explicit Transformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
2815 
2816  static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
2817  "mapping must produce value pairs");
2818  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
2819  // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
2820  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
2821  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
2822  using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to good ones
2823  // (const char * to std::string)
2824 
2825  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
2826  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
2827 
2828  // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
2829  desc_function_ = [mapping]() { return detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)); };
2830 
2831  func_ = [mapping, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
2832  local_item_t b;
2833  if(!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
2834  return std::string();
2835  // there is no possible way we can match anything in the mapping if we can't convert so just return
2836  }
2837  if(filter_fn) {
2838  b = filter_fn(b);
2839  }
2840  auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
2841  if(res.first) {
2842  input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
2843  }
2844  return std::string{};
2845  };
2846  }
2847 
2849  template <typename T, typename... Args>
2850  Transformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&... other)
2851  : Transformer(
2852  std::forward<T>(mapping),
2853  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
2854  other...) {}
2855 };
2856 
2858 class CheckedTransformer : public Validator {
2859  public:
2860  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
2861 
2863  template <typename... Args>
2864  CheckedTransformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values, Args &&... args)
2865  : CheckedTransformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
2866 
2868  template <typename T> explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping) : CheckedTransformer(std::move(mapping), nullptr) {}
2869 
2872  template <typename T, typename F> explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
2873 
2874  static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
2875  "mapping must produce value pairs");
2876  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
2877  // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
2878  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
2879  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
2880  using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to good ones
2881  // (const char * to std::string)
2882  using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
2883 
2884  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
2885  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
2886 
2887  auto tfunc = [mapping]() {
2888  std::string out("value in ");
2889  out += detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)) + " OR {";
2890  out += detail::join(
2891  detail::smart_deref(mapping),
2892  [](const iteration_type_t &v) { return detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v)); },
2893  ",");
2894  out.push_back('}');
2895  return out;
2896  };
2897 
2898  desc_function_ = tfunc;
2899 
2900  func_ = [mapping, tfunc, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
2901  local_item_t b;
2902  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, b);
2903  if(converted) {
2904  if(filter_fn) {
2905  b = filter_fn(b);
2906  }
2907  auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
2908  if(res.first) {
2909  input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
2910  return std::string{};
2911  }
2912  }
2913  for(const auto &v : detail::smart_deref(mapping)) {
2914  auto output_string = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
2915  if(output_string == input) {
2916  return std::string();
2917  }
2918  }
2919 
2920  return "Check " + input + " " + tfunc() + " FAILED";
2921  };
2922  }
2923 
2925  template <typename T, typename... Args>
2926  CheckedTransformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&... other)
2927  : CheckedTransformer(
2928  std::forward<T>(mapping),
2929  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
2930  other...) {}
2931 };
2932 
2934 inline std::string ignore_case(std::string item) { return detail::to_lower(item); }
2935 
2937 inline std::string ignore_underscore(std::string item) { return detail::remove_underscore(item); }
2938 
2940 inline std::string ignore_space(std::string item) {
2941  item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), ' '), std::end(item));
2942  item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), '\t'), std::end(item));
2943  return item;
2944 }
2945 
2957 class AsNumberWithUnit : public Validator {
2958  public:
2963  enum Options {
2964  CASE_SENSITIVE = 0,
2965  CASE_INSENSITIVE = 1,
2966  UNIT_OPTIONAL = 0,
2967  UNIT_REQUIRED = 2,
2968  DEFAULT = CASE_INSENSITIVE | UNIT_OPTIONAL
2969  };
2970 
2971  template <typename Number>
2972  explicit AsNumberWithUnit(std::map<std::string, Number> mapping,
2973  Options opts = DEFAULT,
2974  const std::string &unit_name = "UNIT") {
2975  description(generate_description<Number>(unit_name, opts));
2976  validate_mapping(mapping, opts);
2977 
2978  // transform function
2979  func_ = [mapping, opts](std::string &input) -> std::string {
2980  Number num;
2981 
2982  detail::rtrim(input);
2983  if(input.empty()) {
2984  throw ValidationError("Input is empty");
2985  }
2986 
2987  // Find split position between number and prefix
2988  auto unit_begin = input.end();
2989  while(unit_begin > input.begin() && std::isalpha(*(unit_begin - 1), std::locale())) {
2990  --unit_begin;
2991  }
2992 
2993  std::string unit{unit_begin, input.end()};
2994  input.resize(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(input.begin(), unit_begin)));
2995  detail::trim(input);
2996 
2997  if(opts & UNIT_REQUIRED && unit.empty()) {
2998  throw ValidationError("Missing mandatory unit");
2999  }
3000  if(opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
3001  unit = detail::to_lower(unit);
3002  }
3003 
3004  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, num);
3005  if(!converted) {
3006  throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted to " +
3007  detail::type_name<Number>());
3008  }
3009 
3010  if(unit.empty()) {
3011  // No need to modify input if no unit passed
3012  return {};
3013  }
3014 
3015  // find corresponding factor
3016  auto it = mapping.find(unit);
3017  if(it == mapping.end()) {
3018  throw ValidationError(unit +
3019  " unit not recognized. "
3020  "Allowed values: " +
3021  detail::generate_map(mapping, true));
3022  }
3023 
3024  // perform safe multiplication
3025  bool ok = detail::checked_multiply(num, it->second);
3026  if(!ok) {
3027  throw ValidationError(detail::to_string(num) + " multiplied by " + unit +
3028  " factor would cause number overflow. Use smaller value.");
3029  }
3030  input = detail::to_string(num);
3031 
3032  return {};
3033  };
3034  }
3035 
3036  private:
3039  template <typename Number> static void validate_mapping(std::map<std::string, Number> &mapping, Options opts) {
3040  for(auto &kv : mapping) {
3041  if(kv.first.empty()) {
3042  throw ValidationError("Unit must not be empty.");
3043  }
3044  if(!detail::isalpha(kv.first)) {
3045  throw ValidationError("Unit must contain only letters.");
3046  }
3047  }
3048 
3049  // make all units lowercase if CASE_INSENSITIVE
3050  if(opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
3051  std::map<std::string, Number> lower_mapping;
3052  for(auto &kv : mapping) {
3053  auto s = detail::to_lower(kv.first);
3054  if(lower_mapping.count(s)) {
3055  throw ValidationError(std::string("Several matching lowercase unit representations are found: ") +
3056  s);
3057  }
3058  lower_mapping[detail::to_lower(kv.first)] = kv.second;
3059  }
3060  mapping = std::move(lower_mapping);
3061  }
3062  }
3063 
3065  template <typename Number> static std::string generate_description(const std::string &name, Options opts) {
3066  std::stringstream out;
3067  out << detail::type_name<Number>() << ' ';
3068  if(opts & UNIT_REQUIRED) {
3069  out << name;
3070  } else {
3071  out << '[' << name << ']';
3072  }
3073  return out.str();
3074  }
3075 };
3076 
3088 class AsSizeValue : public AsNumberWithUnit {
3089  public:
3090  using result_t = std::uint64_t;
3091 
3099  explicit AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000) : AsNumberWithUnit(get_mapping(kb_is_1000)) {
3100  if(kb_is_1000) {
3101  description("SIZE [b, kb(=1000b), kib(=1024b), ...]");
3102  } else {
3103  description("SIZE [b, kb(=1024b), ...]");
3104  }
3105  }
3106 
3107  private:
3109  static std::map<std::string, result_t> init_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
3110  std::map<std::string, result_t> m;
3111  result_t k_factor = kb_is_1000 ? 1000 : 1024;
3112  result_t ki_factor = 1024;
3113  result_t k = 1;
3114  result_t ki = 1;
3115  m["b"] = 1;
3116  for(std::string p : {"k", "m", "g", "t", "p", "e"}) {
3117  k *= k_factor;
3118  ki *= ki_factor;
3119  m[p] = k;
3120  m[p + "b"] = k;
3121  m[p + "i"] = ki;
3122  m[p + "ib"] = ki;
3123  }
3124  return m;
3125  }
3126 
3128  static std::map<std::string, result_t> get_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
3129  if(kb_is_1000) {
3130  static auto m = init_mapping(true);
3131  return m;
3132  } else {
3133  static auto m = init_mapping(false);
3134  return m;
3135  }
3136  }
3137 };
3138 
3139 namespace detail {
3144 inline std::pair<std::string, std::string> split_program_name(std::string commandline) {
3145  // try to determine the programName
3146  std::pair<std::string, std::string> vals;
3147  trim(commandline);
3148  auto esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
3149  while(detail::check_path(commandline.substr(0, esp).c_str()) != path_type::file) {
3150  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', esp + 1);
3151  if(esp == std::string::npos) {
3152  // if we have reached the end and haven't found a valid file just assume the first argument is the
3153  // program name
3154  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
3155  break;
3156  }
3157  }
3158  vals.first = commandline.substr(0, esp);
3159  rtrim(vals.first);
3160  // strip the program name
3161  vals.second = (esp != std::string::npos) ? commandline.substr(esp + 1) : std::string{};
3162  ltrim(vals.second);
3163  return vals;
3164 }
3165 
3166 } // namespace detail
3168 
3169 } // namespace CLI

3176 class App;

3182 
3183 enum class AppFormatMode {
3184  Normal,
3185  All,
3186  Sub,
3187 };
3188 
3193 class FormatterBase {
3194  protected:
3197 
3199  std::size_t column_width_{30};
3200 
3203  std::map<std::string, std::string> labels_{};
3204 
3208 
3209  public:
3210  FormatterBase() = default;
3211  FormatterBase(const FormatterBase &) = default;
3212  FormatterBase(FormatterBase &&) = default;
3213 
3215  virtual ~FormatterBase() noexcept {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
3216 
3218  virtual std::string make_help(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode) const = 0;
3219 
3223 
3225  void label(std::string key, std::string val) { labels_[key] = val; }
3226 
3228  void column_width(std::size_t val) { column_width_ = val; }
3229 
3233 
3235  std::string get_label(std::string key) const {
3236  if(labels_.find(key) == labels_.end())
3237  return key;
3238  else
3239  return labels_.at(key);
3240  }
3241 
3243  std::size_t get_column_width() const { return column_width_; }
3244 
3246 };
3247 
3249 class FormatterLambda final : public FormatterBase {
3250  using funct_t = std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)>;
3251 
3253  funct_t lambda_;
3254 
3255  public:
3257  explicit FormatterLambda(funct_t funct) : lambda_(std::move(funct)) {}
3258 
3260  ~FormatterLambda() noexcept override {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
3261 
3263  std::string make_help(const App *app, std::string name, AppFormatMode mode) const override {
3264  return lambda_(app, name, mode);
3265  }
3266 };
3267 
3270 class Formatter : public FormatterBase {
3271  public:
3272  Formatter() = default;
3273  Formatter(const Formatter &) = default;
3274  Formatter(Formatter &&) = default;
3275 
3278 
3281  virtual std::string make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional, std::vector<const Option *> opts) const;
3282 
3284  virtual std::string make_positionals(const App *app) const;
3285 
3287  std::string make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
3288 
3290  virtual std::string make_subcommands(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
3291 
3293  virtual std::string make_subcommand(const App *sub) const;
3294 
3296  virtual std::string make_expanded(const App *sub) const;
3297 
3299  virtual std::string make_footer(const App *app) const;
3300 
3302  virtual std::string make_description(const App *app) const;
3303 
3305  virtual std::string make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const;
3306 
3308  std::string make_help(const App * /*app*/, std::string, AppFormatMode) const override;
3309 
3313 
3315  virtual std::string make_option(const Option *opt, bool is_positional) const {
3316  std::stringstream out;
3317  detail::format_help(
3318  out, make_option_name(opt, is_positional) + make_option_opts(opt), make_option_desc(opt), column_width_);
3319  return out.str();
3320  }
3321 
3323  virtual std::string make_option_name(const Option *, bool) const;
3324 
3326  virtual std::string make_option_opts(const Option *) const;
3327 
3329  virtual std::string make_option_desc(const Option *) const;
3330 
3332  virtual std::string make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const;
3333 
3335 };

3340 
3341 namespace CLI {
3342 
3343 using results_t = std::vector<std::string>;
3345 using callback_t = std::function<bool(const results_t &)>;
3346 
3347 class Option;
3348 class App;
3349 
3350 using Option_p = std::unique_ptr<Option>;
3352 enum class MultiOptionPolicy : char {
3353  Throw,
3354  TakeLast,
3355  TakeFirst,
3356  Join,
3357  TakeAll
3358 };
3359 
3362 template <typename CRTP> class OptionBase {
3363  friend App;
3364 
3365  protected:
3367  std::string group_ = std::string("Options");
3368 
3370  bool required_{false};
3371 
3373  bool ignore_case_{false};
3374 
3376  bool ignore_underscore_{false};
3377 
3379  bool configurable_{true};
3380 
3382  bool disable_flag_override_{false};
3383 
3385  char delimiter_{'\0'};
3386 
3388  bool always_capture_default_{false};
3389 
3391  MultiOptionPolicy multi_option_policy_{MultiOptionPolicy::Throw};
3392 
3394  template <typename T> void copy_to(T *other) const {
3395  other->group(group_);
3396  other->required(required_);
3397  other->ignore_case(ignore_case_);
3398  other->ignore_underscore(ignore_underscore_);
3399  other->configurable(configurable_);
3400  other->disable_flag_override(disable_flag_override_);
3401  other->delimiter(delimiter_);
3402  other->always_capture_default(always_capture_default_);
3403  other->multi_option_policy(multi_option_policy_);
3404  }
3405 
3406  public:
3407  // setters
3408 
3410  CRTP *group(const std::string &name) {
3411  group_ = name;
3412  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3413  }
3414 
3416  CRTP *required(bool value = true) {
3417  required_ = value;
3418  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3419  }
3420 
3422  CRTP *mandatory(bool value = true) { return required(value); }
3423 
3424  CRTP *always_capture_default(bool value = true) {
3425  always_capture_default_ = value;
3426  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3427  }
3428 
3429  // Getters
3430 
3432  const std::string &get_group() const { return group_; }
3433 
3435  bool get_required() const { return required_; }
3436 
3438  bool get_ignore_case() const { return ignore_case_; }
3439 
3441  bool get_ignore_underscore() const { return ignore_underscore_; }
3442 
3444  bool get_configurable() const { return configurable_; }
3445 
3447  bool get_disable_flag_override() const { return disable_flag_override_; }
3448 
3450  char get_delimiter() const { return delimiter_; }
3451 
3453  bool get_always_capture_default() const { return always_capture_default_; }
3454 
3456  MultiOptionPolicy get_multi_option_policy() const { return multi_option_policy_; }
3457 
3458  // Shortcuts for multi option policy
3459 
3461  CRTP *take_last() {
3462  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3463  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
3464  return self;
3465  }
3466 
3468  CRTP *take_first() {
3469  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3470  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst);
3471  return self;
3472  }
3473 
3475  CRTP *take_all() {
3476  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3477  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
3478  return self;
3479  }
3480 
3482  CRTP *join() {
3483  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3484  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
3485  return self;
3486  }
3487 
3489  CRTP *join(char delim) {
3490  auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3491  self->delimiter_ = delim;
3492  self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
3493  return self;
3494  }
3495 
3497  CRTP *configurable(bool value = true) {
3498  configurable_ = value;
3499  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3500  }
3501 
3503  CRTP *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
3504  delimiter_ = value;
3505  return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3506  }
3507 };
3508 
3511 class OptionDefaults : public OptionBase<OptionDefaults> {
3512  public:
3513  OptionDefaults() = default;
3514 
3515  // Methods here need a different implementation if they are Option vs. OptionDefault
3516 
3518  OptionDefaults *multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
3519  multi_option_policy_ = value;
3520  return this;
3521  }
3522 
3524  OptionDefaults *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
3525  ignore_case_ = value;
3526  return this;
3527  }
3528 
3530  OptionDefaults *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
3531  ignore_underscore_ = value;
3532  return this;
3533  }
3534 
3536  OptionDefaults *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
3537  disable_flag_override_ = value;
3538  return this;
3539  }
3540 
3542  OptionDefaults *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
3543  delimiter_ = value;
3544  return this;
3545  }
3546 };
3547 
3548 class Option : public OptionBase<Option> {
3549  friend App;
3550 
3551  protected:
3554 
3556  std::vector<std::string> snames_{};
3557 
3559  std::vector<std::string> lnames_{};
3560 
3563  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> default_flag_values_{};
3564 
3566  std::vector<std::string> fnames_{};
3567 
3569  std::string pname_{};
3570 
3572  std::string envname_{};
3573 
3577 
3579  std::string description_{};
3580 
3582  std::string default_str_{};
3583 
3587  std::function<std::string()> type_name_{[]() { return std::string(); }};
3588 
3590  std::function<std::string()> default_function_{};
3591 
3595 
3598  int type_size_max_{1};
3600  int type_size_min_{1};
3601 
3603  int expected_min_{1};
3605  int expected_max_{1};
3606 
3608  std::vector<Validator> validators_{};
3609 
3611  std::set<Option *> needs_{};
3612 
3614  std::set<Option *> excludes_{};
3615 
3619 
3621  App *parent_{nullptr};
3622 
3624  callback_t callback_{};
3625 
3629 
3631  results_t results_{};
3633  results_t proc_results_{};
3635  enum class option_state {
3636  parsing = 0,
3637  validated = 2,
3638  reduced = 4,
3639  callback_run = 6,
3640  };
3642  option_state current_option_state_{option_state::parsing};
3644  bool allow_extra_args_{false};
3646  bool flag_like_{false};
3648  bool run_callback_for_default_{false};
3650 
3652  Option(std::string option_name, std::string option_description, callback_t callback, App *parent)
3653  : description_(std::move(option_description)), parent_(parent), callback_(std::move(callback)) {
3654  std::tie(snames_, lnames_, pname_) = detail::get_names(detail::split_names(option_name));
3655  }
3656 
3657  public:
3660 
3661  Option(const Option &) = delete;
3662  Option &operator=(const Option &) = delete;
3663 
3665  std::size_t count() const { return results_.size(); }
3666 
3668  bool empty() const { return results_.empty(); }
3669 
3671  explicit operator bool() const { return !empty(); }
3672 
3674  void clear() {
3675  results_.clear();
3676  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
3677  }
3678 
3682 
3684  Option *expected(int value) {
3685  if(value < 0) {
3686  expected_min_ = -value;
3687  if(expected_max_ < expected_min_) {
3688  expected_max_ = expected_min_;
3689  }
3690  allow_extra_args_ = true;
3691  flag_like_ = false;
3692  } else if(value == detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
3693  expected_min_ = 1;
3694  expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
3695  allow_extra_args_ = true;
3696  flag_like_ = false;
3697  } else {
3698  expected_min_ = value;
3699  expected_max_ = value;
3700  flag_like_ = (expected_min_ == 0);
3701  }
3702  return this;
3703  }
3704 
3706  Option *expected(int value_min, int value_max) {
3707  if(value_min < 0) {
3708  value_min = -value_min;
3709  }
3710 
3711  if(value_max < 0) {
3712  value_max = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
3713  }
3714  if(value_max < value_min) {
3715  expected_min_ = value_max;
3716  expected_max_ = value_min;
3717  } else {
3718  expected_max_ = value_max;
3719  expected_min_ = value_min;
3720  }
3721 
3722  return this;
3723  }
3726  Option *allow_extra_args(bool value = true) {
3727  allow_extra_args_ = value;
3728  return this;
3729  }
3731  bool get_allow_extra_args() const { return allow_extra_args_; }
3732 
3735  Option *run_callback_for_default(bool value = true) {
3736  run_callback_for_default_ = value;
3737  return this;
3738  }
3740  bool get_run_callback_for_default() const { return run_callback_for_default_; }
3741 
3743  Option *check(Validator validator, const std::string &validator_name = "") {
3744  validator.non_modifying();
3745  validators_.push_back(std::move(validator));
3746  if(!validator_name.empty())
3747  validators_.back().name(validator_name);
3748  return this;
3749  }
3750 
3752  Option *check(std::function<std::string(const std::string &)> Validator,
3753  std::string Validator_description = "",
3754  std::string Validator_name = "") {
3755  validators_.emplace_back(Validator, std::move(Validator_description), std::move(Validator_name));
3756  validators_.back().non_modifying();
3757  return this;
3758  }
3759 
3761  Option *transform(Validator Validator, const std::string &Validator_name = "") {
3762  validators_.insert(validators_.begin(), std::move(Validator));
3763  if(!Validator_name.empty())
3764  validators_.front().name(Validator_name);
3765  return this;
3766  }
3767 
3769  Option *transform(const std::function<std::string(std::string)> &func,
3770  std::string transform_description = "",
3771  std::string transform_name = "") {
3772  validators_.insert(validators_.begin(),
3773  Validator(
3774  [func](std::string &val) {
3775  val = func(val);
3776  return std::string{};
3777  },
3778  std::move(transform_description),
3779  std::move(transform_name)));
3780 
3781  return this;
3782  }
3783 
3785  Option *each(const std::function<void(std::string)> &func) {
3786  validators_.emplace_back(
3787  [func](std::string &inout) {
3788  func(inout);
3789  return std::string{};
3790  },
3791  std::string{});
3792  return this;
3793  }
3795  Validator *get_validator(const std::string &Validator_name = "") {
3796  for(auto &Validator : validators_) {
3797  if(Validator_name == Validator.get_name()) {
3798  return &Validator;
3799  }
3800  }
3801  if((Validator_name.empty()) && (!validators_.empty())) {
3802  return &(validators_.front());
3803  }
3804  throw OptionNotFound(std::string{"Validator "} + Validator_name + " Not Found");
3805  }
3806 
3808  Validator *get_validator(int index) {
3809  // This is an signed int so that it is not equivalent to a pointer.
3810  if(index >= 0 && index < static_cast<int>(validators_.size())) {
3811  return &(validators_[static_cast<decltype(validators_)::size_type>(index)]);
3812  }
3813  throw OptionNotFound("Validator index is not valid");
3814  }
3815 
3817  Option *needs(Option *opt) {
3818  if(opt != this) {
3819  needs_.insert(opt);
3820  }
3821  return this;
3822  }
3823 
3825  template <typename T = App> Option *needs(std::string opt_name) {
3826  auto opt = static_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
3827  if(opt == nullptr) {
3828  throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
3829  }
3830  return needs(opt);
3831  }
3832 
3834  template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG> Option *needs(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
3835  needs(opt);
3836  return needs(opt1, args...);
3837  }
3838 
3840  bool remove_needs(Option *opt) {
3841  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(needs_), std::end(needs_), opt);
3842 
3843  if(iterator == std::end(needs_)) {
3844  return false;
3845  }
3846  needs_.erase(iterator);
3847  return true;
3848  }
3849 
3851  Option *excludes(Option *opt) {
3852  if(opt == this) {
3853  throw(IncorrectConstruction("and option cannot exclude itself"));
3854  }
3855  excludes_.insert(opt);
3856 
3857  // Help text should be symmetric - excluding a should exclude b
3858  opt->excludes_.insert(this);
3859 
3860  // Ignoring the insert return value, excluding twice is now allowed.
3861  // (Mostly to allow both directions to be excluded by user, even though the library does it for you.)
3862 
3863  return this;
3864  }
3865 
3867  template <typename T = App> Option *excludes(std::string opt_name) {
3868  auto opt = static_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
3869  if(opt == nullptr) {
3870  throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
3871  }
3872  return excludes(opt);
3873  }
3874 
3876  template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG> Option *excludes(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
3877  excludes(opt);
3878  return excludes(opt1, args...);
3879  }
3880 
3882  bool remove_excludes(Option *opt) {
3883  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(excludes_), std::end(excludes_), opt);
3884 
3885  if(iterator == std::end(excludes_)) {
3886  return false;
3887  }
3888  excludes_.erase(iterator);
3889  return true;
3890  }
3891 
3893  Option *envname(std::string name) {
3894  envname_ = std::move(name);
3895  return this;
3896  }
3897 
3902  template <typename T = App> Option *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
3903  if(!ignore_case_ && value) {
3904  ignore_case_ = value;
3905  auto *parent = static_cast<T *>(parent_);
3906  for(const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
3907  if(opt.get() == this) {
3908  continue;
3909  }
3910  auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
3911  if(!omatch.empty()) {
3912  ignore_case_ = false;
3913  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore case caused a name conflict with " + omatch);
3914  }
3915  }
3916  } else {
3917  ignore_case_ = value;
3918  }
3919  return this;
3920  }
3921 
3926  template <typename T = App> Option *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
3927 
3928  if(!ignore_underscore_ && value) {
3929  ignore_underscore_ = value;
3930  auto *parent = static_cast<T *>(parent_);
3931  for(const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
3932  if(opt.get() == this) {
3933  continue;
3934  }
3935  auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
3936  if(!omatch.empty()) {
3937  ignore_underscore_ = false;
3938  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore underscore caused a name conflict with " + omatch);
3939  }
3940  }
3941  } else {
3942  ignore_underscore_ = value;
3943  }
3944  return this;
3945  }
3946 
3948  Option *multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
3949  if(value != multi_option_policy_) {
3950  if(multi_option_policy_ == MultiOptionPolicy::Throw && expected_max_ == detail::expected_max_vector_size &&
3951  expected_min_ > 1) { // this bizarre condition is to maintain backwards compatibility
3952  // with the previous behavior of expected_ with vectors
3953  expected_max_ = expected_min_;
3954  }
3955  multi_option_policy_ = value;
3956  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
3957  }
3958  return this;
3959  }
3960 
3962  Option *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
3963  disable_flag_override_ = value;
3964  return this;
3965  }
3969 
3971  int get_type_size() const { return type_size_min_; }
3972 
3974  int get_type_size_min() const { return type_size_min_; }
3976  int get_type_size_max() const { return type_size_max_; }
3977 
3979  std::string get_envname() const { return envname_; }
3980 
3982  std::set<Option *> get_needs() const { return needs_; }
3983 
3985  std::set<Option *> get_excludes() const { return excludes_; }
3986 
3988  std::string get_default_str() const { return default_str_; }
3989 
3991  callback_t get_callback() const { return callback_; }
3992 
3994  const std::vector<std::string> &get_lnames() const { return lnames_; }
3995 
3997  const std::vector<std::string> &get_snames() const { return snames_; }
3998 
4000  const std::vector<std::string> &get_fnames() const { return fnames_; }
4001 
4003  int get_expected() const { return expected_min_; }
4004 
4006  int get_expected_min() const { return expected_min_; }
4008  int get_expected_max() const { return expected_max_; }
4009 
4011  int get_items_expected_min() const { return type_size_min_ * expected_min_; }
4012 
4014  int get_items_expected_max() const {
4015  int t = type_size_max_;
4016  return detail::checked_multiply(t, expected_max_) ? t : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4017  }
4019  int get_items_expected() const { return get_items_expected_min(); }
4020 
4022  bool get_positional() const { return pname_.length() > 0; }
4023 
4025  bool nonpositional() const { return (snames_.size() + lnames_.size()) > 0; }
4026 
4028  bool has_description() const { return description_.length() > 0; }
4029 
4031  const std::string &get_description() const { return description_; }
4032 
4034  Option *description(std::string option_description) {
4035  description_ = std::move(option_description);
4036  return this;
4037  }
4038 
4042 
4047  std::string get_name(bool positional = false,
4048  bool all_options = false
4049  ) const {
4050  if(get_group().empty())
4051  return {}; // Hidden
4052 
4053  if(all_options) {
4054 
4055  std::vector<std::string> name_list;
4056 
4058  if((positional && (!pname_.empty())) || (snames_.empty() && lnames_.empty())) {
4059  name_list.push_back(pname_);
4060  }
4061  if((get_items_expected() == 0) && (!fnames_.empty())) {
4062  for(const std::string &sname : snames_) {
4063  name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
4064  if(check_fname(sname)) {
4065  name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(sname, "") + "}";
4066  }
4067  }
4068 
4069  for(const std::string &lname : lnames_) {
4070  name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
4071  if(check_fname(lname)) {
4072  name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(lname, "") + "}";
4073  }
4074  }
4075  } else {
4076  for(const std::string &sname : snames_)
4077  name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
4078 
4079  for(const std::string &lname : lnames_)
4080  name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
4081  }
4082 
4083  return detail::join(name_list);
4084  }
4085 
4086  // This returns the positional name no matter what
4087  if(positional)
4088  return pname_;
4089 
4090  // Prefer long name
4091  if(!lnames_.empty())
4092  return std::string(2, '-') + lnames_[0];
4093 
4094  // Or short name if no long name
4095  if(!snames_.empty())
4096  return std::string(1, '-') + snames_[0];
4097 
4098  // If positional is the only name, it's okay to use that
4099  return pname_;
4100  }
4101 
4105 
4107  void run_callback() {
4108 
4109  if(current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
4110  _validate_results(results_);
4111  current_option_state_ = option_state::validated;
4112  }
4113 
4114  if(current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
4115  _reduce_results(proc_results_, results_);
4116  current_option_state_ = option_state::reduced;
4117  }
4118  if(current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced) {
4119  current_option_state_ = option_state::callback_run;
4120  if(!(callback_)) {
4121  return;
4122  }
4123  const results_t &send_results = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
4124  bool local_result = callback_(send_results);
4125 
4126  if(!local_result)
4127  throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
4128  }
4129  }
4130 
4132  const std::string &matching_name(const Option &other) const {
4133  static const std::string estring;
4134  for(const std::string &sname : snames_)
4135  if(other.check_sname(sname))
4136  return sname;
4137  for(const std::string &lname : lnames_)
4138  if(other.check_lname(lname))
4139  return lname;
4140 
4141  if(ignore_case_ ||
4142  ignore_underscore_) { // We need to do the inverse, in case we are ignore_case or ignore underscore
4143  for(const std::string &sname : other.snames_)
4144  if(check_sname(sname))
4145  return sname;
4146  for(const std::string &lname : other.lnames_)
4147  if(check_lname(lname))
4148  return lname;
4149  }
4150  return estring;
4151  }
4153  bool operator==(const Option &other) const { return !matching_name(other).empty(); }
4154 
4156  bool check_name(std::string name) const {
4157 
4158  if(name.length() > 2 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] == '-')
4159  return check_lname(name.substr(2));
4160  if(name.length() > 1 && name.front() == '-')
4161  return check_sname(name.substr(1));
4162 
4163  std::string local_pname = pname_;
4164  if(ignore_underscore_) {
4165  local_pname = detail::remove_underscore(local_pname);
4166  name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
4167  }
4168  if(ignore_case_) {
4169  local_pname = detail::to_lower(local_pname);
4170  name = detail::to_lower(name);
4171  }
4172  return name == local_pname;
4173  }
4174 
4176  bool check_sname(std::string name) const {
4177  return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), snames_, ignore_case_) >= 0);
4178  }
4179 
4181  bool check_lname(std::string name) const {
4182  return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), lnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
4183  }
4184 
4186  bool check_fname(std::string name) const {
4187  if(fnames_.empty()) {
4188  return false;
4189  }
4190  return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
4191  }
4192 
4195  std::string get_flag_value(const std::string &name, std::string input_value) const {
4196  static const std::string trueString{"true"};
4197  static const std::string falseString{"false"};
4198  static const std::string emptyString{"{}"};
4199  // check for disable flag override_
4200  if(disable_flag_override_) {
4201  if(!((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString))) {
4202  auto default_ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
4203  if(default_ind >= 0) {
4204  // We can static cast this to std::size_t because it is more than 0 in this block
4205  if(default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(default_ind)].second != input_value) {
4206  throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
4207  }
4208  } else {
4209  if(input_value != trueString) {
4210  throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
4211  }
4212  }
4213  }
4214  }
4215  auto ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
4216  if((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString)) {
4217  if(flag_like_) {
4218  return (ind < 0) ? trueString : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
4219  } else {
4220  return (ind < 0) ? default_str_ : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
4221  }
4222  }
4223  if(ind < 0) {
4224  return input_value;
4225  }
4226  if(default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second == falseString) {
4227  try {
4228  auto val = detail::to_flag_value(input_value);
4229  return (val == 1) ? falseString : (val == (-1) ? trueString : std::to_string(-val));
4230  } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
4231  return input_value;
4232  }
4233  } else {
4234  return input_value;
4235  }
4236  }
4237 
4239  Option *add_result(std::string s) {
4240  _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
4241  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4242  return this;
4243  }
4244 
4246  Option *add_result(std::string s, int &results_added) {
4247  results_added = _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
4248  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4249  return this;
4250  }
4251 
4253  Option *add_result(std::vector<std::string> s) {
4254  for(auto &str : s) {
4255  _add_result(std::move(str), results_);
4256  }
4257  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4258  return this;
4259  }
4260 
4262  results_t results() const { return results_; }
4263 
4265  results_t reduced_results() const {
4266  results_t res = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
4267  if(current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
4268  if(current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
4269  res = results_;
4270  _validate_results(res);
4271  }
4272  if(!res.empty()) {
4273  results_t extra;
4274  _reduce_results(extra, res);
4275  if(!extra.empty()) {
4276  res = std::move(extra);
4277  }
4278  }
4279  }
4280  return res;
4281  }
4282 
4284  template <typename T, enable_if_t<!std::is_const<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
4285  void results(T &output) const {
4286  bool retval;
4287  if(current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced || (results_.size() == 1 && validators_.empty())) {
4288  const results_t &res = (proc_results_.empty()) ? results_ : proc_results_;
4289  retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
4290  } else {
4291  results_t res;
4292  if(results_.empty()) {
4293  if(!default_str_.empty()) {
4294  // _add_results takes an rvalue only
4295  _add_result(std::string(default_str_), res);
4296  _validate_results(res);
4297  results_t extra;
4298  _reduce_results(extra, res);
4299  if(!extra.empty()) {
4300  res = std::move(extra);
4301  }
4302  } else {
4303  res.emplace_back();
4304  }
4305  } else {
4306  res = reduced_results();
4307  }
4308  retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
4309  }
4310  if(!retval) {
4311  throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
4312  }
4313  }
4314 
4316  template <typename T> T as() const {
4317  T output;
4318  results(output);
4319  return output;
4320  }
4321 
4323  bool get_callback_run() const { return (current_option_state_ == option_state::callback_run); }
4324 
4328 
4330  Option *type_name_fn(std::function<std::string()> typefun) {
4331  type_name_ = std::move(typefun);
4332  return this;
4333  }
4334 
4336  Option *type_name(std::string typeval) {
4337  type_name_fn([typeval]() { return typeval; });
4338  return this;
4339  }
4340 
4342  Option *type_size(int option_type_size) {
4343  if(option_type_size < 0) {
4344  // this section is included for backwards compatibility
4345  type_size_max_ = -option_type_size;
4346  type_size_min_ = -option_type_size;
4347  expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4348  } else {
4349  type_size_max_ = option_type_size;
4350  if(type_size_max_ < detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
4351  type_size_min_ = option_type_size;
4352  }
4353  if(type_size_max_ == 0)
4354  required_ = false;
4355  }
4356  return this;
4357  }
4359  Option *type_size(int option_type_size_min, int option_type_size_max) {
4360  if(option_type_size_min < 0 || option_type_size_max < 0) {
4361  // this section is included for backwards compatibility
4362  expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4363  option_type_size_min = (std::abs)(option_type_size_min);
4364  option_type_size_max = (std::abs)(option_type_size_max);
4365  }
4366 
4367  if(option_type_size_min > option_type_size_max) {
4368  type_size_max_ = option_type_size_min;
4369  type_size_min_ = option_type_size_max;
4370  } else {
4371  type_size_min_ = option_type_size_min;
4372  type_size_max_ = option_type_size_max;
4373  }
4374  if(type_size_max_ == 0) {
4375  required_ = false;
4376  }
4377  return this;
4378  }
4379 
4381  Option *default_function(const std::function<std::string()> &func) {
4382  default_function_ = func;
4383  return this;
4384  }
4385 
4387  Option *capture_default_str() {
4388  if(default_function_) {
4389  default_str_ = default_function_();
4390  }
4391  return this;
4392  }
4393 
4395  Option *default_str(std::string val) {
4396  default_str_ = std::move(val);
4397  return this;
4398  }
4399 
4402  template <typename X> Option *default_val(const X &val) {
4403  std::string val_str = detail::to_string(val);
4404  auto old_option_state = current_option_state_;
4405  results_t old_results{std::move(results_)};
4406  results_.clear();
4407  try {
4408  add_result(val_str);
4409  if(run_callback_for_default_) {
4410  run_callback(); // run callback sets the state we need to reset it again
4411  current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4412  } else {
4413  _validate_results(results_);
4414  current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
4415  }
4416  } catch(const CLI::Error &) {
4417  // this should be done
4418  results_ = std::move(old_results);
4419  current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
4420  throw;
4421  }
4422  results_ = std::move(old_results);
4423  default_str_ = std::move(val_str);
4424  return this;
4425  }
4426 
4428  std::string get_type_name() const {
4429  std::string full_type_name = type_name_();
4430  if(!validators_.empty()) {
4431  for(auto &Validator : validators_) {
4432  std::string vtype = Validator.get_description();
4433  if(!vtype.empty()) {
4434  full_type_name += ":" + vtype;
4435  }
4436  }
4437  }
4438  return full_type_name;
4439  }
4440 
4441  private:
4443  void _validate_results(results_t &res) const {
4444  // Run the Validators (can change the string)
4445  if(!validators_.empty()) {
4446  if(type_size_max_ > 1) { // in this context index refers to the index in the type
4447  int index = 0;
4448  if(get_items_expected_max() < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
4449  multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
4450  // create a negative index for the earliest ones
4451  index = get_items_expected_max() - static_cast<int>(res.size());
4452  }
4453 
4454  for(std::string &result : res) {
4455  if(result.empty() && type_size_max_ != type_size_min_ && index >= 0) {
4456  index = 0; // reset index for variable size chunks
4457  continue;
4458  }
4459  auto err_msg = _validate(result, (index >= 0) ? (index % type_size_max_) : index);
4460  if(!err_msg.empty())
4461  throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
4462  ++index;
4463  }
4464  } else {
4465  int index = 0;
4466  if(expected_max_ < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
4467  multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
4468  // create a negative index for the earliest ones
4469  index = expected_max_ - static_cast<int>(res.size());
4470  }
4471  for(std::string &result : res) {
4472  auto err_msg = _validate(result, index);
4473  ++index;
4474  if(!err_msg.empty())
4475  throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
4476  }
4477  }
4478  }
4479  }
4480 
4484  void _reduce_results(results_t &res, const results_t &original) const {
4485 
4486  // max num items expected or length of vector, always at least 1
4487  // Only valid for a trimming policy
4488 
4489  res.clear();
4490  // Operation depends on the policy setting
4491  switch(multi_option_policy_) {
4492  case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll:
4493  break;
4494  case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast: {
4495  // Allow multi-option sizes (including 0)
4496  std::size_t trim_size = std::min<std::size_t>(
4497  static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)), original.size());
4498  if(original.size() != trim_size) {
4499  res.assign(original.end() - static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size), original.end());
4500  }
4501  } break;
4502  case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst: {
4503  std::size_t trim_size = std::min<std::size_t>(
4504  static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)), original.size());
4505  if(original.size() != trim_size) {
4506  res.assign(original.begin(), original.begin() + static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size));
4507  }
4508  } break;
4509  case MultiOptionPolicy::Join:
4510  if(results_.size() > 1) {
4511  res.push_back(detail::join(original, std::string(1, (delimiter_ == '\0') ? '\n' : delimiter_)));
4512  }
4513  break;
4514  case MultiOptionPolicy::Throw:
4515  default: {
4516  auto num_min = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_min());
4517  auto num_max = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_max());
4518  if(num_min == 0) {
4519  num_min = 1;
4520  }
4521  if(num_max == 0) {
4522  num_max = 1;
4523  }
4524  if(original.size() < num_min) {
4525  throw ArgumentMismatch::AtLeast(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_min), original.size());
4526  }
4527  if(original.size() > num_max) {
4528  throw ArgumentMismatch::AtMost(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_max), original.size());
4529  }
4530  break;
4531  }
4532  }
4533  }
4534 
4535  // Run a result through the Validators
4536  std::string _validate(std::string &result, int index) const {
4537  std::string err_msg;
4538  if(result.empty() && expected_min_ == 0) {
4539  // an empty with nothing expected is allowed
4540  return err_msg;
4541  }
4542  for(const auto &vali : validators_) {
4543  auto v = vali.get_application_index();
4544  if(v == -1 || v == index) {
4545  try {
4546  err_msg = vali(result);
4547  } catch(const ValidationError &err) {
4548  err_msg = err.what();
4549  }
4550  if(!err_msg.empty())
4551  break;
4552  }
4553  }
4554 
4555  return err_msg;
4556  }
4557 
4559  int _add_result(std::string &&result, std::vector<std::string> &res) const {
4560  int result_count = 0;
4561  if(allow_extra_args_ && !result.empty() && result.front() == '[' &&
4562  result.back() == ']') { // this is now a vector string likely from the default or user entry
4563  result.pop_back();
4564 
4565  for(auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result.substr(1), ',')) {
4566  if(!var.empty()) {
4567  result_count += _add_result(std::move(var), res);
4568  }
4569  }
4570  return result_count;
4571  }
4572  if(delimiter_ == '\0') {
4573  res.push_back(std::move(result));
4574  ++result_count;
4575  } else {
4576  if((result.find_first_of(delimiter_) != std::string::npos)) {
4577  for(const auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result, delimiter_)) {
4578  if(!var.empty()) {
4579  res.push_back(var);
4580  ++result_count;
4581  }
4582  }
4583  } else {
4584  res.push_back(std::move(result));
4585  ++result_count;
4586  }
4587  }
4588  return result_count;
4589  }
4590 }; // namespace CLI
4591 
4592 } // namespace CLI
4593 
4594 // From App.hpp:
4595 
4596 namespace CLI {
4597 
4598 #ifndef CLI11_PARSE
4599 #define CLI11_PARSE(app, argc, argv) \
4600  try { \
4601  (app).parse((argc), (argv)); \
4602  } catch(const CLI::ParseError &e) { \
4603  return (app).exit(e); \
4604  }
4605 #endif
4606 
4607 namespace detail {
4608 enum class Classifier { NONE, POSITIONAL_MARK, SHORT, LONG, WINDOWS, SUBCOMMAND, SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR };
4609 struct AppFriend;
4610 } // namespace detail
4611 
4612 namespace FailureMessage {
4613 std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e);
4614 std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e);
4615 } // namespace FailureMessage
4616 
4618 
4619 enum class config_extras_mode : char { error = 0, ignore, capture };
4620 
4621 class App;
4622 
4623 using App_p = std::shared_ptr<App>;
4624 
4625 class Option_group;
4627 
4630 class App {
4631  friend Option;
4632  friend detail::AppFriend;
4633 
4634  protected:
4635  // This library follows the Google style guide for member names ending in underscores
4636 
4639 
4641  std::string name_{};
4642 
4644  std::string description_{};
4645 
4647  bool allow_extras_{false};
4648 
4651  config_extras_mode allow_config_extras_{config_extras_mode::ignore};
4652 
4654  bool prefix_command_{false};
4655 
4657  bool has_automatic_name_{false};
4658 
4660  bool required_{false};
4661 
4663  bool disabled_{false};
4664 
4666  bool pre_parse_called_{false};
4667 
4670  bool immediate_callback_{false};
4671 
4673  std::function<void(std::size_t)> pre_parse_callback_{};
4674 
4676  std::function<void()> parse_complete_callback_{};
4678  std::function<void()> final_callback_{};
4679 
4683 
4685  OptionDefaults option_defaults_{};
4686

4689 
4693

4696 
4698  std::function<std::string()> footer_callback_{};
4699 
4701  Option *help_ptr_{nullptr};
4702 
4704  Option *help_all_ptr_{nullptr};
4705

4708 
4710  std::function<std::string(const App *, const Error &e)> failure_message_{FailureMessage::simple};
4711 
4715 
4716  using missing_t = std::vector<std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>>;
4717 
4721  missing_t missing_{};
4722 
4724  std::vector<Option *> parse_order_{};
4725 
4727  std::vector<App *> parsed_subcommands_{};
4728 
4730  std::set<App *> exclude_subcommands_{};
4731 
4734  std::set<Option *> exclude_options_{};
4735 
4738  std::set<App *> need_subcommands_{};
4739 
4742  std::set<Option *> need_options_{};
4743 
4747 
4749  std::vector<App_p> subcommands_{};
4750 
4752  bool ignore_case_{false};
4753 
4755  bool ignore_underscore_{false};
4756 
4758  bool fallthrough_{false};
4759 
4761  bool allow_windows_style_options_{
4762 #ifdef _WIN32
4763  true
4764 #else
4765  false
4766 #endif
4767  };
4769  bool positionals_at_end_{false};
4770 
4771  enum class startup_mode : char { stable, enabled, disabled };
4774  startup_mode default_startup{startup_mode::stable};
4775 
4777  bool configurable_{false};
4778 
4780  bool validate_positionals_{false};
4781 
4783  App *parent_{nullptr};
4784 
4786  std::size_t parsed_{0};
4787 
4789  std::size_t require_subcommand_min_{0};
4790 
4792  std::size_t require_subcommand_max_{0};
4793 
4795  std::size_t require_option_min_{0};
4796 
4798  std::size_t require_option_max_{0};
4799 
4801  std::string group_{"Subcommands"};
4802 
4804  std::vector<std::string> aliases_{};
4805

4815 
4817 
4819  App(std::string app_description, std::string app_name, App *parent)
4820  : name_(std::move(app_name)), description_(std::move(app_description)), parent_(parent) {
4821  // Inherit if not from a nullptr
4822  if(parent_ != nullptr) {
4823  if(parent_->help_ptr_ != nullptr)
4824  set_help_flag(parent_->help_ptr_->get_name(false, true), parent_->help_ptr_->get_description());
4825  if(parent_->help_all_ptr_ != nullptr)
4826  set_help_all_flag(parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_name(false, true),
4827  parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_description());
4828 
4830  option_defaults_ = parent_->option_defaults_;
4831 
4832  // INHERITABLE
4833  failure_message_ = parent_->failure_message_;
4834  allow_extras_ = parent_->allow_extras_;
4835  allow_config_extras_ = parent_->allow_config_extras_;
4836  prefix_command_ = parent_->prefix_command_;
4837  immediate_callback_ = parent_->immediate_callback_;
4838  ignore_case_ = parent_->ignore_case_;
4839  ignore_underscore_ = parent_->ignore_underscore_;
4840  fallthrough_ = parent_->fallthrough_;
4841  validate_positionals_ = parent_->validate_positionals_;
4842  configurable_ = parent_->configurable_;
4843  allow_windows_style_options_ = parent_->allow_windows_style_options_;
4844  group_ = parent_->group_;
4845  footer_ = parent_->footer_;
4846  formatter_ = parent_->formatter_;
4847  config_formatter_ = parent_->config_formatter_;
4848  require_subcommand_max_ = parent_->require_subcommand_max_;
4849  }
4850  }
4851 
4852  public:
4855 
4857  explicit App(std::string app_description = "", std::string app_name = "")
4858  : App(app_description, app_name, nullptr) {
4859  set_help_flag("-h,--help", "Print this help message and exit");
4860  }
4861 
4862  App(const App &) = delete;
4863  App &operator=(const App &) = delete;
4864 
4866  virtual ~App() = default;
4867 
4874  App *callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
4875  if(immediate_callback_) {
4876  parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
4877  } else {
4878  final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
4879  }
4880  return this;
4881  }
4882 
4885  App *final_callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
4886  final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
4887  return this;
4888  }
4889 
4892  App *parse_complete_callback(std::function<void()> pc_callback) {
4893  parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(pc_callback);
4894  return this;
4895  }
4896 
4899  App *preparse_callback(std::function<void(std::size_t)> pp_callback) {
4900  pre_parse_callback_ = std::move(pp_callback);
4901  return this;
4902  }
4903 
4905  App *name(std::string app_name = "") {
4906 
4907  if(parent_ != nullptr) {
4908  auto oname = name_;
4909  name_ = app_name;
4910  auto &res = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
4911  if(!res.empty()) {
4912  name_ = oname;
4913  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(app_name + " conflicts with existing subcommand names"));
4914  }
4915  } else {
4916  name_ = app_name;
4917  }
4918  has_automatic_name_ = false;
4919  return this;
4920  }
4921 
4923  App *alias(std::string app_name) {
4924  if(!detail::valid_name_string(app_name)) {
4925  throw(IncorrectConstruction("alias is not a valid name string"));
4926  }
4927 
4928  if(parent_ != nullptr) {
4929  aliases_.push_back(app_name);
4930  auto &res = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
4931  if(!res.empty()) {
4932  aliases_.pop_back();
4933  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("alias already matches an existing subcommand: " + app_name));
4934  }
4935  } else {
4936  aliases_.push_back(app_name);
4937  }
4938 
4939  return this;
4940  }
4941 
4943  App *allow_extras(bool allow = true) {
4944  allow_extras_ = allow;
4945  return this;
4946  }
4947 
4949  App *required(bool require = true) {
4950  required_ = require;
4951  return this;
4952  }
4953 
4955  App *disabled(bool disable = true) {
4956  disabled_ = disable;
4957  return this;
4958  }
4959 
4961  App *disabled_by_default(bool disable = true) {
4962  if(disable) {
4963  default_startup = startup_mode::disabled;
4964  } else {
4965  default_startup = (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled) ? startup_mode::enabled : startup_mode::stable;
4966  }
4967  return this;
4968  }
4969 
4972  App *enabled_by_default(bool enable = true) {
4973  if(enable) {
4974  default_startup = startup_mode::enabled;
4975  } else {
4976  default_startup =
4977  (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled) ? startup_mode::disabled : startup_mode::stable;
4978  }
4979  return this;
4980  }
4981 
4983  App *immediate_callback(bool immediate = true) {
4984  immediate_callback_ = immediate;
4985  if(immediate_callback_) {
4986  if(final_callback_ && !(parse_complete_callback_)) {
4987  std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
4988  }
4989  } else if(!(final_callback_) && parse_complete_callback_) {
4990  std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
4991  }
4992  return this;
4993  }
4994 
4996  App *validate_positionals(bool validate = true) {
4997  validate_positionals_ = validate;
4998  return this;
4999  }
5000 
5002  App *allow_config_extras(bool allow = true) {
5003  if(allow) {
5004  allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::capture;
5005  allow_extras_ = true;
5006  } else {
5007  allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::error;
5008  }
5009  return this;
5010  }
5011 
5013  App *allow_config_extras(config_extras_mode mode) {
5014  allow_config_extras_ = mode;
5015  return this;
5016  }
5017 
5019  App *prefix_command(bool allow = true) {
5020  prefix_command_ = allow;
5021  return this;
5022  }
5023 
5025  App *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
5026  if(value && !ignore_case_) {
5027  ignore_case_ = true;
5028  auto *p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
5029  auto &match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
5030  if(!match.empty()) {
5031  ignore_case_ = false; // we are throwing so need to be exception invariant
5032  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("ignore case would cause subcommand name conflicts: " + match);
5033  }
5034  }
5035  ignore_case_ = value;
5036  return this;
5037  }
5038 
5041  App *allow_windows_style_options(bool value = true) {
5042  allow_windows_style_options_ = value;
5043  return this;
5044  }
5045 
5047  App *positionals_at_end(bool value = true) {
5048  positionals_at_end_ = value;
5049  return this;
5050  }
5051 
5053  App *configurable(bool value = true) {
5054  configurable_ = value;
5055  return this;
5056  }
5057 
5059  App *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
5060  if(value && !ignore_underscore_) {
5061  ignore_underscore_ = true;
5062  auto *p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
5063  auto &match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
5064  if(!match.empty()) {
5065  ignore_underscore_ = false;
5066  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("ignore underscore would cause subcommand name conflicts: " + match);
5067  }
5068  }
5069  ignore_underscore_ = value;
5070  return this;
5071  }
5072 
5074  App *formatter(std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> fmt) {
5075  formatter_ = fmt;
5076  return this;
5077  }
5078 
5080  App *formatter_fn(std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)> fmt) {
5081  formatter_ = std::make_shared<FormatterLambda>(fmt);
5082  return this;
5083  }
5084 
5086  App *config_formatter(std::shared_ptr<Config> fmt) {
5087  config_formatter_ = fmt;
5088  return this;
5089  }
5090 
5092  bool parsed() const { return parsed_ > 0; }
5093 
5095  OptionDefaults *option_defaults() { return &option_defaults_; }
5096 
5100 
5115  Option *add_option(std::string option_name,
5116  callback_t option_callback,
5117  std::string option_description = "",
5118  bool defaulted = false,
5119  std::function<std::string()> func = {}) {
5120  Option myopt{option_name, option_description, option_callback, this};
5121 
5122  if(std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [&myopt](const Option_p &v) {
5123  return *v == myopt;
5124  }) == std::end(options_)) {
5125  options_.emplace_back();
5126  Option_p &option = options_.back();
5127  option.reset(new Option(option_name, option_description, option_callback, this));
5128 
5129  // Set the default string capture function
5130  option->default_function(func);
5131 
5132  // For compatibility with CLI11 1.7 and before, capture the default string here
5133  if(defaulted)
5134  option->capture_default_str();
5135 
5136  // Transfer defaults to the new option
5137  option_defaults_.copy_to(option.get());
5138 
5139  // Don't bother to capture if we already did
5140  if(!defaulted && option->get_always_capture_default())
5141  option->capture_default_str();
5142 
5143  return option.get();
5144  }
5145  // we know something matches now find what it is so we can produce more error information
5146  for(auto &opt : options_) {
5147  auto &matchname = opt->matching_name(myopt);
5148  if(!matchname.empty()) {
5149  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("added option matched existing option name: " + matchname));
5150  }
5151  }
5152  // this line should not be reached the above loop should trigger the throw
5153  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("added option matched existing option name")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
5154  }
5155 
5157  template <typename AssignTo,
5158  typename ConvertTo = AssignTo,
5159  enable_if_t<!std::is_const<ConvertTo>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5160  Option *add_option(std::string option_name,
5161  AssignTo &variable,
5162  std::string option_description = "",
5163  bool defaulted = false) {
5164 
5165  auto fun = [&variable](const CLI::results_t &res) { // comment for spacing
5166  return detail::lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(res, variable);
5167  };
5168 
5169  Option *opt = add_option(option_name, fun, option_description, defaulted, [&variable]() {
5170  return CLI::detail::checked_to_string<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(variable);
5171  });
5172  opt->type_name(detail::type_name<ConvertTo>());
5173  // these must be actual lvalues since (std::max) sometimes is defined in terms of references and references
5174  // to structs used in the evaluation can be temporary so that would cause issues.
5175  auto Tcount = detail::type_count<AssignTo>::value;
5176  auto XCcount = detail::type_count<ConvertTo>::value;
5177  opt->type_size((std::max)(Tcount, XCcount));
5178  opt->expected(detail::expected_count<ConvertTo>::value);
5179  opt->run_callback_for_default();
5180  return opt;
5181  }
5182 
5184  template <typename T>
5185  Option *add_option_function(std::string option_name,
5186  const std::function<void(const T &)> &func,
5187  std::string option_description = "") {
5188 
5189  auto fun = [func](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5190  T variable;
5191  bool result = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, variable);
5192  if(result) {
5193  func(variable);
5194  }
5195  return result;
5196  };
5197 
5198  Option *opt = add_option(option_name, std::move(fun), option_description, false);
5199  opt->type_name(detail::type_name<T>());
5200  opt->type_size(detail::type_count<T>::value);
5201  opt->expected(detail::expected_count<T>::value);
5202  return opt;
5203  }
5204 
5206  Option *add_option(std::string option_name) {
5207  return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t(), std::string{}, false);
5208  }
5209 
5211  template <typename T,
5212  enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value && std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value, detail::enabler> =
5213  detail::dummy>
5214  Option *add_option(std::string option_name, T &option_description) {
5215  return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t(), option_description, false);
5216  }
5217 
5219  Option *set_help_flag(std::string flag_name = "", const std::string &help_description = "") {
5220  // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to assign to help_description
5221  if(help_ptr_ != nullptr) {
5222  remove_option(help_ptr_);
5223  help_ptr_ = nullptr;
5224  }
5225 
5226  // Empty name will simply remove the help flag
5227  if(!flag_name.empty()) {
5228  help_ptr_ = add_flag(flag_name, help_description);
5229  help_ptr_->configurable(false);
5230  }
5231 
5232  return help_ptr_;
5233  }
5234 
5236  Option *set_help_all_flag(std::string help_name = "", const std::string &help_description = "") {
5237  // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to assign to flag_description
5238  if(help_all_ptr_ != nullptr) {
5239  remove_option(help_all_ptr_);
5240  help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
5241  }
5242 
5243  // Empty name will simply remove the help all flag
5244  if(!help_name.empty()) {
5245  help_all_ptr_ = add_flag(help_name, help_description);
5246  help_all_ptr_->configurable(false);
5247  }
5248 
5249  return help_all_ptr_;
5250  }
5251 
5252  private:
5254  Option *_add_flag_internal(std::string flag_name, CLI::callback_t fun, std::string flag_description) {
5255  Option *opt;
5256  if(detail::has_default_flag_values(flag_name)) {
5257  // check for default values and if it has them
5258  auto flag_defaults = detail::get_default_flag_values(flag_name);
5259  detail::remove_default_flag_values(flag_name);
5260  opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description), false);
5261  for(const auto &fname : flag_defaults)
5262  opt->fnames_.push_back(fname.first);
5263  opt->default_flag_values_ = std::move(flag_defaults);
5264  } else {
5265  opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description), false);
5266  }
5267  // flags cannot have positional values
5268  if(opt->get_positional()) {
5269  auto pos_name = opt->get_name(true);
5270  remove_option(opt);
5271  throw IncorrectConstruction::PositionalFlag(pos_name);
5272  }
5273  opt->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
5274  opt->expected(0);
5275  opt->required(false);
5276  return opt;
5277  }
5278 
5279  public:
5281  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name) { return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(), std::string{}); }
5282 
5286  template <typename T,
5287  enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value && std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value, detail::enabler> =
5288  detail::dummy>
5289  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name, T &flag_description) {
5290  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(), flag_description);
5291  }
5292 
5295  template <typename T,
5296  enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && !is_bool<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5297  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5298  T &flag_count,
5299  std::string flag_description = "") {
5300  flag_count = 0;
5301  CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_count](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5302  try {
5303  detail::sum_flag_vector(res, flag_count);
5304  } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
5305  return false;
5306  }
5307  return true;
5308  };
5309  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))
5310  ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
5311  }
5312 
5315  template <typename T,
5316  enable_if_t<!is_vector<T>::value && !std::is_const<T>::value &&
5317  (!std::is_integral<T>::value || is_bool<T>::value) &&
5318  !std::is_constructible<std::function<void(int)>, T>::value,
5319  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5320  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5321  T &flag_result,
5322  std::string flag_description = "") {
5323 
5324  CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_result](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5325  return CLI::detail::lexical_cast(res[0], flag_result);
5326  };
5327  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))->run_callback_for_default();
5328  }
5329 
5331  template <
5332  typename T,
5333  enable_if_t<!std::is_assignable<std::function<void(std::int64_t)>, T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5334  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5335  std::vector<T> &flag_results,
5336  std::string flag_description = "") {
5337  CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_results](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5338  bool retval = true;
5339  for(const auto &elem : res) {
5340  flag_results.emplace_back();
5341  retval &= detail::lexical_cast(elem, flag_results.back());
5342  }
5343  return retval;
5344  };
5345  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))
5346  ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll)
5347  ->run_callback_for_default();
5348  }
5349 
5351  Option *add_flag_callback(std::string flag_name,
5352  std::function<void(void)> function,
5353  std::string flag_description = "") {
5354 
5355  CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5356  bool trigger{false};
5357  auto result = CLI::detail::lexical_cast(res[0], trigger);
5358  if(result && trigger) {
5359  function();
5360  }
5361  return result;
5362  };
5363  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description));
5364  }
5365 
5367  Option *add_flag_function(std::string flag_name,
5368  std::function<void(std::int64_t)> function,
5369  std::string flag_description = "") {
5370 
5371  CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5372  std::int64_t flag_count = 0;
5373  detail::sum_flag_vector(res, flag_count);
5374  function(flag_count);
5375  return true;
5376  };
5377  return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))
5378  ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
5379  }
5380 
5381 #ifdef CLI11_CPP14
5382  Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5384  std::function<void(std::int64_t)> function,
5385  std::string flag_description = "") {
5386  return add_flag_function(std::move(flag_name), std::move(function), std::move(flag_description));
5387  }
5388 #endif
5389 
5391  template <typename T>
5392  Option *add_set(std::string option_name,
5393  T &member,
5394  std::set<T> options,
5395  std::string option_description = "") {
5396 
5397  Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description));
5398  opt->check(IsMember{options});
5399  return opt;
5400  }
5401 
5403  template <typename T>
5404  Option *add_mutable_set(std::string option_name,
5405  T &member,
5406  const std::set<T> &options,
5407  std::string option_description = "") {
5408 
5409  Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description));
5410  opt->check(IsMember{&options});
5411  return opt;
5412  }
5413 
5415  template <typename T>
5416  Option *add_set(std::string option_name,
5417  T &member,
5418  std::set<T> options,
5419  std::string option_description,
5420  bool defaulted) {
5421 
5422  Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description), defaulted);
5423  opt->check(IsMember{options});
5424  return opt;
5425  }
5426 
5428  template <typename T>
5429  Option *add_mutable_set(std::string option_name,
5430  T &member,
5431  const std::set<T> &options,
5432  std::string option_description,
5433  bool defaulted) {
5434 
5435  Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description), defaulted);
5436  opt->check(IsMember{&options});
5437  return opt;
5438  }
5439 
5441  template <typename T, typename XC = double>
5442  Option *add_complex(std::string option_name,
5443  T &variable,
5444  std::string option_description = "",
5445  bool defaulted = false,
5446  std::string label = "COMPLEX") {
5447 
5448  CLI::callback_t fun = [&variable](const results_t &res) {
5449  XC x, y;
5450  bool worked;
5451  if(res.size() >= 2 && !res[1].empty()) {
5452  auto str1 = res[1];
5453  if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j')
5454  str1.pop_back();
5455  worked = detail::lexical_cast(res[0], x) && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
5456  } else {
5457  auto str1 = res.front();
5458  auto nloc = str1.find_last_of('-');
5459  if(nloc != std::string::npos && nloc > 0) {
5460  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1.substr(0, nloc), x);
5461  str1 = str1.substr(nloc);
5462  if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j')
5463  str1.pop_back();
5464  worked = worked && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
5465  } else {
5466  if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
5467  str1.pop_back();
5468  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
5469  x = XC{0};
5470  } else {
5471  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, x);
5472  y = XC{0};
5473  }
5474  }
5475  }
5476  if(worked)
5477  variable = T{x, y};
5478  return worked;
5479  };
5480 
5481  auto default_function = [&variable]() { return CLI::detail::checked_to_string<T, T>(variable); };
5482 
5483  CLI::Option *opt =
5484  add_option(option_name, std::move(fun), std::move(option_description), defaulted, default_function);
5485 
5486  opt->type_name(label)->type_size(1, 2)->delimiter('+')->run_callback_for_default();
5487  return opt;
5488  }
