5489 
5491  Option *set_config(std::string option_name = "",
5492  std::string default_filename = "",
5493  const std::string &help_message = "Read an ini file",
5494  bool config_required = false) {
5495 
5496  // Remove existing config if present
5497  if(config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
5498  remove_option(config_ptr_);
5499  config_ptr_ = nullptr; // need to remove the config_ptr completely
5500  }
5501 
5502  // Only add config if option passed
5503  if(!option_name.empty()) {
5504  config_ptr_ = add_option(option_name, help_message);
5505  if(config_required) {
5506  config_ptr_->required();
5507  }
5508  if(!default_filename.empty()) {
5509  config_ptr_->default_str(std::move(default_filename));
5510  }
5511  config_ptr_->configurable(false);
5512  }
5513 
5514  return config_ptr_;
5515  }
5516 
5518  bool remove_option(Option *opt) {
5519  // Make sure no links exist
5520  for(Option_p &op : options_) {
5521  op->remove_needs(opt);
5522  op->remove_excludes(opt);
5523  }
5524 
5525  if(help_ptr_ == opt)
5526  help_ptr_ = nullptr;
5527  if(help_all_ptr_ == opt)
5528  help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
5529 
5530  auto iterator =
5531  std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [opt](const Option_p &v) { return v.get() == opt; });
5532  if(iterator != std::end(options_)) {
5533  options_.erase(iterator);
5534  return true;
5535  }
5536  return false;
5537  }
5538 
5540  template <typename T = Option_group>
5541  T *add_option_group(std::string group_name, std::string group_description = "") {
5542  auto option_group = std::make_shared<T>(std::move(group_description), group_name, this);
5543  auto ptr = option_group.get();
5544  // move to App_p for overload resolution on older gcc versions
5545  App_p app_ptr = std::dynamic_pointer_cast<App>(option_group);
5546  add_subcommand(std::move(app_ptr));
5547  return ptr;
5548  }
5549 
5553 
5555  App *add_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name = "", std::string subcommand_description = "") {
5556  if(!subcommand_name.empty() && !detail::valid_name_string(subcommand_name)) {
5557  throw IncorrectConstruction("subcommand name is not valid");
5558  }
5559  CLI::App_p subcom = std::shared_ptr<App>(new App(std::move(subcommand_description), subcommand_name, this));
5560  return add_subcommand(std::move(subcom));
5561  }
5562 
5564  App *add_subcommand(CLI::App_p subcom) {
5565  if(!subcom)
5566  throw IncorrectConstruction("passed App is not valid");
5567  auto ckapp = (name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
5568  auto &mstrg = _compare_subcommand_names(*subcom, *ckapp);
5569  if(!mstrg.empty()) {
5570  throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("subcommand name or alias matches existing subcommand: " + mstrg));
5571  }
5572  subcom->parent_ = this;
5573  subcommands_.push_back(std::move(subcom));
5574  return subcommands_.back().get();
5575  }
5576 
5578  bool remove_subcommand(App *subcom) {
5579  // Make sure no links exist
5580  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
5581  sub->remove_excludes(subcom);
5582  sub->remove_needs(subcom);
5583  }
5584 
5585  auto iterator = std::find_if(
5586  std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), [subcom](const App_p &v) { return v.get() == subcom; });
5587  if(iterator != std::end(subcommands_)) {
5588  subcommands_.erase(iterator);
5589  return true;
5590  }
5591  return false;
5592  }
5595  App *get_subcommand(const App *subcom) const {
5596  if(subcom == nullptr)
5597  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5598  for(const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
5599  if(subcomptr.get() == subcom)
5600  return subcomptr.get();
5601  throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
5602  }
5603 
5605  App *get_subcommand(std::string subcom) const {
5606  auto subc = _find_subcommand(subcom, false, false);
5607  if(subc == nullptr)
5608  throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
5609  return subc;
5610  }
5612  App *get_subcommand(int index = 0) const {
5613  if(index >= 0) {
5614  auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
5615  if(uindex < subcommands_.size())
5616  return subcommands_[uindex].get();
5617  }
5618  throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
5619  }
5620 
5622  CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(App *subcom) const {
5623  if(subcom == nullptr)
5624  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5625  for(const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
5626  if(subcomptr.get() == subcom)
5627  return subcomptr;
5628  throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
5629  }
5630 
5632  CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(std::string subcom) const {
5633  for(const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
5634  if(subcomptr->check_name(subcom))
5635  return subcomptr;
5636  throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
5637  }
5638 
5640  CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(int index = 0) const {
5641  if(index >= 0) {
5642  auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
5643  if(uindex < subcommands_.size())
5644  return subcommands_[uindex];
5645  }
5646  throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
5647  }
5648 
5650  App *get_option_group(std::string group_name) const {
5651  for(const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
5652  if(app->name_.empty() && app->group_ == group_name) {
5653  return app.get();
5654  }
5655  }
5656  throw OptionNotFound(group_name);
5657  }
5658 
5662  std::size_t count() const { return parsed_; }
5663 
5666  std::size_t count_all() const {
5667  std::size_t cnt{0};
5668  for(auto &opt : options_) {
5669  cnt += opt->count();
5670  }
5671  for(auto &sub : subcommands_) {
5672  cnt += sub->count_all();
5673  }
5674  if(!get_name().empty()) { // for named subcommands add the number of times the subcommand was called
5675  cnt += parsed_;
5676  }
5677  return cnt;
5678  }
5679 
5681  App *group(std::string group_name) {
5682  group_ = group_name;
5683  return this;
5684  }
5685 
5687  App *require_subcommand() {
5688  require_subcommand_min_ = 1;
5689  require_subcommand_max_ = 0;
5690  return this;
5691  }
5692 
5696  App *require_subcommand(int value) {
5697  if(value < 0) {
5698  require_subcommand_min_ = 0;
5699  require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
5700  } else {
5701  require_subcommand_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5702  require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5703  }
5704  return this;
5705  }
5706 
5709  App *require_subcommand(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
5710  require_subcommand_min_ = min;
5711  require_subcommand_max_ = max;
5712  return this;
5713  }
5714 
5716  App *require_option() {
5717  require_option_min_ = 1;
5718  require_option_max_ = 0;
5719  return this;
5720  }
5721 
5725  App *require_option(int value) {
5726  if(value < 0) {
5727  require_option_min_ = 0;
5728  require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
5729  } else {
5730  require_option_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5731  require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5732  }
5733  return this;
5734  }
5735 
5738  App *require_option(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
5739  require_option_min_ = min;
5740  require_option_max_ = max;
5741  return this;
5742  }
5743 
5746  App *fallthrough(bool value = true) {
5747  fallthrough_ = value;
5748  return this;
5749  }
5750 
5753  explicit operator bool() const { return parsed_ > 0; }
5754 
5758 
5762  virtual void pre_callback() {}
5763 
5767  //
5769  void clear() {
5770 
5771  parsed_ = 0;
5772  pre_parse_called_ = false;
5773 
5774  missing_.clear();
5775  parsed_subcommands_.clear();
5776  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
5777  opt->clear();
5778  }
5779  for(const App_p &subc : subcommands_) {
5780  subc->clear();
5781  }
5782  }
5783 
5786  void parse(int argc, const char *const *argv) {
5787  // If the name is not set, read from command line
5788  if(name_.empty() || has_automatic_name_) {
5789  has_automatic_name_ = true;
5790  name_ = argv[0];
5791  }
5792 
5793  std::vector<std::string> args;
5794  args.reserve(static_cast<std::size_t>(argc) - 1);
5795  for(int i = argc - 1; i > 0; i--)
5796  args.emplace_back(argv[i]);
5797  parse(std::move(args));
5798  }
5799 
5804  void parse(std::string commandline, bool program_name_included = false) {
5805 
5806  if(program_name_included) {
5807  auto nstr = detail::split_program_name(commandline);
5808  if((name_.empty()) || (has_automatic_name_)) {
5809  has_automatic_name_ = true;
5810  name_ = nstr.first;
5811  }
5812  commandline = std::move(nstr.second);
5813  } else {
5814  detail::trim(commandline);
5815  }
5816  // the next section of code is to deal with quoted arguments after an '=' or ':' for windows like operations
5817  if(!commandline.empty()) {
5818  commandline = detail::find_and_modify(commandline, "=", detail::escape_detect);
5819  if(allow_windows_style_options_)
5820  commandline = detail::find_and_modify(commandline, ":", detail::escape_detect);
5821  }
5822 
5823  auto args = detail::split_up(std::move(commandline));
5824  // remove all empty strings
5825  args.erase(std::remove(args.begin(), args.end(), std::string{}), args.end());
5826  std::reverse(args.begin(), args.end());
5827 
5828  parse(std::move(args));
5829  }
5830 
5833  void parse(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
5834  // Clear if parsed
5835  if(parsed_ > 0)
5836  clear();
5837 
5838  // parsed_ is incremented in commands/subcommands,
5839  // but placed here to make sure this is cleared when
5840  // running parse after an error is thrown, even by _validate or _configure.
5841  parsed_ = 1;
5842  _validate();
5843  _configure();
5844  // set the parent as nullptr as this object should be the top now
5845  parent_ = nullptr;
5846  parsed_ = 0;
5847 
5848  _parse(args);
5849  run_callback();
5850  }
5851 
5853  void parse(std::vector<std::string> &&args) {
5854  // Clear if parsed
5855  if(parsed_ > 0)
5856  clear();
5857 
5858  // parsed_ is incremented in commands/subcommands,
5859  // but placed here to make sure this is cleared when
5860  // running parse after an error is thrown, even by _validate or _configure.
5861  parsed_ = 1;
5862  _validate();
5863  _configure();
5864  // set the parent as nullptr as this object should be the top now
5865  parent_ = nullptr;
5866  parsed_ = 0;
5867 
5868  _parse(std::move(args));
5869  run_callback();
5870  }
5871 
5873  void failure_message(std::function<std::string(const App *, const Error &e)> function) {
5874  failure_message_ = function;
5875  }
5876 
5878  int exit(const Error &e, std::ostream &out = std::cout, std::ostream &err = std::cerr) const {
5879 
5881  if(e.get_name() == "RuntimeError")
5882  return e.get_exit_code();
5883 
5884  if(e.get_name() == "CallForHelp") {
5885  out << help();
5886  return e.get_exit_code();
5887  }
5888 
5889  if(e.get_name() == "CallForAllHelp") {
5890  out << help("", AppFormatMode::All);
5891  return e.get_exit_code();
5892  }
5893 
5894  if(e.get_exit_code() != static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::Success)) {
5895  if(failure_message_)
5896  err << failure_message_(this, e) << std::flush;
5897  }
5898 
5899  return e.get_exit_code();
5900  }
5901 
5905 
5907  std::size_t count(std::string option_name) const { return get_option(option_name)->count(); }
5908 
5911  std::vector<App *> get_subcommands() const { return parsed_subcommands_; }
5912 
5915  std::vector<const App *> get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(const App *)> &filter) const {
5916  std::vector<const App *> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
5917  std::transform(std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), std::begin(subcomms), [](const App_p &v) {
5918  return v.get();
5919  });
5920 
5921  if(filter) {
5922  subcomms.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms),
5923  std::end(subcomms),
5924  [&filter](const App *app) { return !filter(app); }),
5925  std::end(subcomms));
5926  }
5927 
5928  return subcomms;
5929  }
5930 
5933  std::vector<App *> get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(App *)> &filter) {
5934  std::vector<App *> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
5935  std::transform(std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), std::begin(subcomms), [](const App_p &v) {
5936  return v.get();
5937  });
5938 
5939  if(filter) {
5940  subcomms.erase(
5941  std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms), std::end(subcomms), [&filter](App *app) { return !filter(app); }),
5942  std::end(subcomms));
5943  }
5944 
5945  return subcomms;
5946  }
5947 
5949  bool got_subcommand(const App *subcom) const {
5950  // get subcom needed to verify that this was a real subcommand
5951  return get_subcommand(subcom)->parsed_ > 0;
5952  }
5953 
5955  bool got_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name) const { return get_subcommand(subcommand_name)->parsed_ > 0; }
5956 
5958  App *excludes(Option *opt) {
5959  if(opt == nullptr) {
5960  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5961  }
5962  exclude_options_.insert(opt);
5963  return this;
5964  }
5965 
5967  App *excludes(App *app) {
5968  if(app == nullptr) {
5969  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5970  }
5971  if(app == this) {
5972  throw OptionNotFound("cannot self reference in needs");
5973  }
5974  auto res = exclude_subcommands_.insert(app);
5975  // subcommand exclusion should be symmetric
5976  if(res.second) {
5977  app->exclude_subcommands_.insert(this);
5978  }
5979  return this;
5980  }
5981 
5982  App *needs(Option *opt) {
5983  if(opt == nullptr) {
5984  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5985  }
5986  need_options_.insert(opt);
5987  return this;
5988  }
5989 
5990  App *needs(App *app) {
5991  if(app == nullptr) {
5992  throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5993  }
5994  if(app == this) {
5995  throw OptionNotFound("cannot self reference in needs");
5996  }
5997  need_subcommands_.insert(app);
5998  return this;
5999  }
6000 
6002  bool remove_excludes(Option *opt) {
6003  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_options_), std::end(exclude_options_), opt);
6004  if(iterator == std::end(exclude_options_)) {
6005  return false;
6006  }
6007  exclude_options_.erase(iterator);
6008  return true;
6009  }
6010 
6012  bool remove_excludes(App *app) {
6013  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_subcommands_), std::end(exclude_subcommands_), app);
6014  if(iterator == std::end(exclude_subcommands_)) {
6015  return false;
6016  }
6017  auto other_app = *iterator;
6018  exclude_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
6019  other_app->remove_excludes(this);
6020  return true;
6021  }
6022 
6024  bool remove_needs(Option *opt) {
6025  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(need_options_), std::end(need_options_), opt);
6026  if(iterator == std::end(need_options_)) {
6027  return false;
6028  }
6029  need_options_.erase(iterator);
6030  return true;
6031  }
6032 
6034  bool remove_needs(App *app) {
6035  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(need_subcommands_), std::end(need_subcommands_), app);
6036  if(iterator == std::end(need_subcommands_)) {
6037  return false;
6038  }
6039  need_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
6040  return true;
6041  }
6042 
6046 
6048  App *footer(std::string footer_string) {
6049  footer_ = std::move(footer_string);
6050  return this;
6051  }
6053  App *footer(std::function<std::string()> footer_function) {
6054  footer_callback_ = std::move(footer_function);
6055  return this;
6056  }
6059  std::string config_to_str(bool default_also = false, bool write_description = false) const {
6060  return config_formatter_->to_config(this, default_also, write_description, "");
6061  }
6062 
6065  std::string help(std::string prev = "", AppFormatMode mode = AppFormatMode::Normal) const {
6066  if(prev.empty())
6067  prev = get_name();
6068  else
6069  prev += " " + get_name();
6070 
6071  // Delegate to subcommand if needed
6072  auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
6073  if(!selected_subcommands.empty()) {
6074  return selected_subcommands.at(0)->help(prev, mode);
6075  }
6076  return formatter_->make_help(this, prev, mode);
6077  }
6078 
6082 
6084  std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> get_formatter() const { return formatter_; }
6085 
6087  std::shared_ptr<Config> get_config_formatter() const { return config_formatter_; }
6088 
6090  std::shared_ptr<ConfigBase> get_config_formatter_base() const {
6091  // This is safer as a dynamic_cast if we have RTTI, as Config -> ConfigBase
6092 #if defined(__cpp_rtti) || (defined(__GXX_RTTI) && __GXX_RTTI) || (defined(_HAS_STATIC_RTTI) && (_HAS_STATIC_RTTI == 0))
6093  return std::dynamic_pointer_cast<ConfigBase>(config_formatter_);
6094 #else
6095  return std::static_pointer_cast<ConfigBase>(config_formatter_);
6096 #endif
6097  }
6098 
6100  std::string get_description() const { return description_; }
6101 
6103  App *description(std::string app_description) {
6104  description_ = std::move(app_description);
6105  return this;
6106  }
6107 
6109  std::vector<const Option *> get_options(const std::function<bool(const Option *)> filter = {}) const {
6110  std::vector<const Option *> options(options_.size());
6111  std::transform(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), std::begin(options), [](const Option_p &val) {
6112  return val.get();
6113  });
6114 
6115  if(filter) {
6116  options.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(options),
6117  std::end(options),
6118  [&filter](const Option *opt) { return !filter(opt); }),
6119  std::end(options));
6120  }
6121 
6122  return options;
6123  }
6124 
6126  std::vector<Option *> get_options(const std::function<bool(Option *)> filter = {}) {
6127  std::vector<Option *> options(options_.size());
6128  std::transform(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), std::begin(options), [](const Option_p &val) {
6129  return val.get();
6130  });
6131 
6132  if(filter) {
6133  options.erase(
6134  std::remove_if(std::begin(options), std::end(options), [&filter](Option *opt) { return !filter(opt); }),
6135  std::end(options));
6136  }
6137 
6138  return options;
6139  }
6140 
6142  Option *get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) noexcept {
6143  for(Option_p &opt : options_) {
6144  if(opt->check_name(option_name)) {
6145  return opt.get();
6146  }
6147  }
6148  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
6149  // also check down into nameless subcommands
6150  if(subc->get_name().empty()) {
6151  auto opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
6152  if(opt != nullptr) {
6153  return opt;
6154  }
6155  }
6156  }
6157  return nullptr;
6158  }
6159 
6161  const Option *get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) const noexcept {
6162  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
6163  if(opt->check_name(option_name)) {
6164  return opt.get();
6165  }
6166  }
6167  for(const auto &subc : subcommands_) {
6168  // also check down into nameless subcommands
6169  if(subc->get_name().empty()) {
6170  auto opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
6171  if(opt != nullptr) {
6172  return opt;
6173  }
6174  }
6175  }
6176  return nullptr;
6177  }
6178 
6180  const Option *get_option(std::string option_name) const {
6181  auto opt = get_option_no_throw(option_name);
6182  if(opt == nullptr) {
6183  throw OptionNotFound(option_name);
6184  }
6185  return opt;
6186  }
6187 
6189  Option *get_option(std::string option_name) {
6190  auto opt = get_option_no_throw(option_name);
6191  if(opt == nullptr) {
6192  throw OptionNotFound(option_name);
6193  }
6194  return opt;
6195  }
6196 
6198  const Option *operator[](const std::string &option_name) const { return get_option(option_name); }
6199 
6201  const Option *operator[](const char *option_name) const { return get_option(option_name); }
6202 
6204  bool get_ignore_case() const { return ignore_case_; }
6205 
6207  bool get_ignore_underscore() const { return ignore_underscore_; }
6208 
6210  bool get_fallthrough() const { return fallthrough_; }
6211 
6213  bool get_allow_windows_style_options() const { return allow_windows_style_options_; }
6214 
6216  bool get_positionals_at_end() const { return positionals_at_end_; }
6217 
6219  bool get_configurable() const { return configurable_; }
6220 
6222  const std::string &get_group() const { return group_; }
6223 
6225  std::string get_footer() const { return (footer_callback_) ? footer_callback_() + '\n' + footer_ : footer_; }
6226 
6228  std::size_t get_require_subcommand_min() const { return require_subcommand_min_; }
6229 
6231  std::size_t get_require_subcommand_max() const { return require_subcommand_max_; }
6232 
6234  std::size_t get_require_option_min() const { return require_option_min_; }
6235 
6237  std::size_t get_require_option_max() const { return require_option_max_; }
6238 
6240  bool get_prefix_command() const { return prefix_command_; }
6241 
6243  bool get_allow_extras() const { return allow_extras_; }
6244 
6246  bool get_required() const { return required_; }
6247 
6249  bool get_disabled() const { return disabled_; }
6250 
6252  bool get_immediate_callback() const { return immediate_callback_; }
6253 
6255  bool get_disabled_by_default() const { return (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled); }
6256 
6258  bool get_enabled_by_default() const { return (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled); }
6260  bool get_validate_positionals() const { return validate_positionals_; }
6261 
6263  config_extras_mode get_allow_config_extras() const { return allow_config_extras_; }
6264 
6266  Option *get_help_ptr() { return help_ptr_; }
6267 
6269  const Option *get_help_ptr() const { return help_ptr_; }
6270 
6272  const Option *get_help_all_ptr() const { return help_all_ptr_; }
6273 
6275  Option *get_config_ptr() { return config_ptr_; }
6276 
6278  const Option *get_config_ptr() const { return config_ptr_; }
6279 
6281  App *get_parent() { return parent_; }
6282 
6284  const App *get_parent() const { return parent_; }
6285 
6287  const std::string &get_name() const { return name_; }
6288 
6290  const std::vector<std::string> &get_aliases() const { return aliases_; }
6291 
6293  App *clear_aliases() {
6294  aliases_.clear();
6295  return this;
6296  }
6297 
6299  std::string get_display_name() const { return (!name_.empty()) ? name_ : "[Option Group: " + get_group() + "]"; }
6300 
6302  bool check_name(std::string name_to_check) const {
6303  std::string local_name = name_;
6304  if(ignore_underscore_) {
6305  local_name = detail::remove_underscore(name_);
6306  name_to_check = detail::remove_underscore(name_to_check);
6307  }
6308  if(ignore_case_) {
6309  local_name = detail::to_lower(name_);
6310  name_to_check = detail::to_lower(name_to_check);
6311  }
6312 
6313  if(local_name == name_to_check) {
6314  return true;
6315  }
6316  for(auto les : aliases_) {
6317  if(ignore_underscore_) {
6318  les = detail::remove_underscore(les);
6319  }
6320  if(ignore_case_) {
6321  les = detail::to_lower(les);
6322  }
6323  if(les == name_to_check) {
6324  return true;
6325  }
6326  }
6327  return false;
6328  }
6329 
6331  std::vector<std::string> get_groups() const {
6332  std::vector<std::string> groups;
6333 
6334  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
6335  // Add group if it is not already in there
6336  if(std::find(groups.begin(), groups.end(), opt->get_group()) == groups.end()) {
6337  groups.push_back(opt->get_group());
6338  }
6339  }
6340 
6341  return groups;
6342  }
6343 
6345  const std::vector<Option *> &parse_order() const { return parse_order_; }
6346 
6348  std::vector<std::string> remaining(bool recurse = false) const {
6349  std::vector<std::string> miss_list;
6350  for(const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &miss : missing_) {
6351  miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
6352  }
6353  // Get from a subcommand that may allow extras
6354  if(recurse) {
6355  if(!allow_extras_) {
6356  for(const auto &sub : subcommands_) {
6357  if(sub->name_.empty() && !sub->missing_.empty()) {
6358  for(const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &miss : sub->missing_) {
6359  miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
6360  }
6361  }
6362  }
6363  }
6364  // Recurse into subcommands
6365 
6366  for(const App *sub : parsed_subcommands_) {
6367  std::vector<std::string> output = sub->remaining(recurse);
6368  std::copy(std::begin(output), std::end(output), std::back_inserter(miss_list));
6369  }
6370  }
6371  return miss_list;
6372  }
6373 
6375  std::vector<std::string> remaining_for_passthrough(bool recurse = false) const {
6376  std::vector<std::string> miss_list = remaining(recurse);
6377  std::reverse(std::begin(miss_list), std::end(miss_list));
6378  return miss_list;
6379  }
6380 
6382  std::size_t remaining_size(bool recurse = false) const {
6383  auto remaining_options = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::count_if(
6384  std::begin(missing_), std::end(missing_), [](const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &val) {
6385  return val.first != detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
6386  }));
6387 
6388  if(recurse) {
6389  for(const App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6390  remaining_options += sub->remaining_size(recurse);
6391  }
6392  }
6393  return remaining_options;
6394  }
6395 
6397 
6398  protected:
6403  void _validate() const {
6404  // count the number of positional only args
6405  auto pcount = std::count_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [](const Option_p &opt) {
6406  return opt->get_items_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size && !opt->nonpositional();
6407  });
6408  if(pcount > 1) {
6409  auto pcount_req = std::count_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [](const Option_p &opt) {
6410  return opt->get_items_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size && !opt->nonpositional() &&
6411  opt->get_required();
6412  });
6413  if(pcount - pcount_req > 1) {
6414  throw InvalidError(name_);
6415  }
6416  }
6417 
6418  std::size_t nameless_subs{0};
6419  for(const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
6420  app->_validate();
6421  if(app->get_name().empty())
6422  ++nameless_subs;
6423  }
6424 
6425  if(require_option_min_ > 0) {
6426  if(require_option_max_ > 0) {
6427  if(require_option_max_ < require_option_min_) {
6428  throw(InvalidError("Required min options greater than required max options",
6429  ExitCodes::InvalidError));
6430  }
6431  }
6432  if(require_option_min_ > (options_.size() + nameless_subs)) {
6433  throw(InvalidError("Required min options greater than number of available options",
6434  ExitCodes::InvalidError));
6435  }
6436  }
6437  }
6438 
6442  void _configure() {
6443  if(default_startup == startup_mode::enabled) {
6444  disabled_ = false;
6445  } else if(default_startup == startup_mode::disabled) {
6446  disabled_ = true;
6447  }
6448  for(const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
6449  if(app->has_automatic_name_) {
6450  app->name_.clear();
6451  }
6452  if(app->name_.empty()) {
6453  app->fallthrough_ = false; // make sure fallthrough_ is false to prevent infinite loop
6454  app->prefix_command_ = false;
6455  }
6456  // make sure the parent is set to be this object in preparation for parse
6457  app->parent_ = this;
6458  app->_configure();
6459  }
6460  }
6462  void run_callback(bool final_mode = false) {
6463  pre_callback();
6464  // in the main app if immediate_callback_ is set it runs the main callback before the used subcommands
6465  if(!final_mode && parse_complete_callback_) {
6466  parse_complete_callback_();
6467  }
6468  // run the callbacks for the received subcommands
6469  for(App *subc : get_subcommands()) {
6470  subc->run_callback(true);
6471  }
6472  // now run callbacks for option_groups
6473  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
6474  if(subc->name_.empty() && subc->count_all() > 0) {
6475  subc->run_callback(true);
6476  }
6477  }
6478 
6479  // finally run the main callback
6480  if(final_callback_ && (parsed_ > 0)) {
6481  if(!name_.empty() || count_all() > 0) {
6482  final_callback_();
6483  }
6484  }
6485  }
6486 
6488  bool _valid_subcommand(const std::string &current, bool ignore_used = true) const {
6489  // Don't match if max has been reached - but still check parents
6490  if(require_subcommand_max_ != 0 && parsed_subcommands_.size() >= require_subcommand_max_) {
6491  return parent_ != nullptr && parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
6492  }
6493  auto com = _find_subcommand(current, true, ignore_used);
6494  if(com != nullptr) {
6495  return true;
6496  }
6497  // Check parent if exists, else return false
6498  return parent_ != nullptr && parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
6499  }
6500 
6502  detail::Classifier _recognize(const std::string &current, bool ignore_used_subcommands = true) const {
6503  std::string dummy1, dummy2;
6504 
6505  if(current == "--")
6506  return detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
6507  if(_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used_subcommands))
6508  return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND;
6509  if(detail::split_long(current, dummy1, dummy2))
6510  return detail::Classifier::LONG;
6511  if(detail::split_short(current, dummy1, dummy2)) {
6512  if(dummy1[0] >= '0' && dummy1[0] <= '9') {
6513  if(get_option_no_throw(std::string{'-', dummy1[0]}) == nullptr) {
6514  return detail::Classifier::NONE;
6515  }
6516  }
6517  return detail::Classifier::SHORT;
6518  }
6519  if((allow_windows_style_options_) && (detail::split_windows_style(current, dummy1, dummy2)))
6520  return detail::Classifier::WINDOWS;
6521  if((current == "++") && !name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr)
6522  return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR;
6523  return detail::Classifier::NONE;
6524  }
6525 
6526  // The parse function is now broken into several parts, and part of process
6527 
6529  void _process_config_file() {
6530  if(config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
6531  bool config_required = config_ptr_->get_required();
6532  bool file_given = config_ptr_->count() > 0;
6533  auto config_file = config_ptr_->as<std::string>();
6534  if(config_file.empty()) {
6535  if(config_required) {
6536  throw FileError::Missing("no specified config file");
6537  }
6538  return;
6539  }
6540 
6541  auto path_result = detail::check_path(config_file.c_str());
6542  if(path_result == detail::path_type::file) {
6543  try {
6544  std::vector<ConfigItem> values = config_formatter_->from_file(config_file);
6545  _parse_config(values);
6546  if(!file_given) {
6547  config_ptr_->add_result(config_file);
6548  }
6549  } catch(const FileError &) {
6550  if(config_required || file_given)
6551  throw;
6552  }
6553  } else if(config_required || file_given) {
6554  throw FileError::Missing(config_file);
6555  }
6556  }
6557  }
6558 
6560  void _process_env() {
6561  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
6562  if(opt->count() == 0 && !opt->envname_.empty()) {
6563  char *buffer = nullptr;
6564  std::string ename_string;
6565 
6566 #ifdef _MSC_VER
6567  // Windows version
6568  std::size_t sz = 0;
6569  if(_dupenv_s(&buffer, &sz, opt->envname_.c_str()) == 0 && buffer != nullptr) {
6570  ename_string = std::string(buffer);
6571  free(buffer);
6572  }
6573 #else
6574  // This also works on Windows, but gives a warning
6575  buffer = std::getenv(opt->envname_.c_str());
6576  if(buffer != nullptr)
6577  ename_string = std::string(buffer);
6578 #endif
6579 
6580  if(!ename_string.empty()) {
6581  opt->add_result(ename_string);
6582  }
6583  }
6584  }
6585 
6586  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6587  if(sub->get_name().empty() || !sub->parse_complete_callback_)
6588  sub->_process_env();
6589  }
6590  }
6591 
6593  void _process_callbacks() {
6594 
6595  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6596  // process the priority option_groups first
6597  if(sub->get_name().empty() && sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
6598  if(sub->count_all() > 0) {
6599  sub->_process_callbacks();
6600  sub->run_callback();
6601  }
6602  }
6603  }
6604 
6605  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
6606  if(opt->count() > 0 && !opt->get_callback_run()) {
6607  opt->run_callback();
6608  }
6609  }
6610  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6611  if(!sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
6612  sub->_process_callbacks();
6613  }
6614  }
6615  }
6616 
6620  void _process_help_flags(bool trigger_help = false, bool trigger_all_help = false) const {
6621  const Option *help_ptr = get_help_ptr();
6622  const Option *help_all_ptr = get_help_all_ptr();
6623 
6624  if(help_ptr != nullptr && help_ptr->count() > 0)
6625  trigger_help = true;
6626  if(help_all_ptr != nullptr && help_all_ptr->count() > 0)
6627  trigger_all_help = true;
6628 
6629  // If there were parsed subcommands, call those. First subcommand wins if there are multiple ones.
6630  if(!parsed_subcommands_.empty()) {
6631  for(const App *sub : parsed_subcommands_)
6632  sub->_process_help_flags(trigger_help, trigger_all_help);
6633 
6634  // Only the final subcommand should call for help. All help wins over help.
6635  } else if(trigger_all_help) {
6636  throw CallForAllHelp();
6637  } else if(trigger_help) {
6638  throw CallForHelp();
6639  }
6640  }
6641 
6643  void _process_requirements() {
6644  // check excludes
6645  bool excluded{false};
6646  std::string excluder;
6647  for(auto &opt : exclude_options_) {
6648  if(opt->count() > 0) {
6649  excluded = true;
6650  excluder = opt->get_name();
6651  }
6652  }
6653  for(auto &subc : exclude_subcommands_) {
6654  if(subc->count_all() > 0) {
6655  excluded = true;
6656  excluder = subc->get_display_name();
6657  }
6658  }
6659  if(excluded) {
6660  if(count_all() > 0) {
6661  throw ExcludesError(get_display_name(), excluder);
6662  }
6663  // if we are excluded but didn't receive anything, just return
6664  return;
6665  }
6666 
6667  // check excludes
6668  bool missing_needed{false};
6669  std::string missing_need;
6670  for(auto &opt : need_options_) {
6671  if(opt->count() == 0) {
6672  missing_needed = true;
6673  missing_need = opt->get_name();
6674  }
6675  }
6676  for(auto &subc : need_subcommands_) {
6677  if(subc->count_all() == 0) {
6678  missing_needed = true;
6679  missing_need = subc->get_display_name();
6680  }
6681  }
6682  if(missing_needed) {
6683  if(count_all() > 0) {
6684  throw RequiresError(get_display_name(), missing_need);
6685  }
6686  // if we missing something but didn't have any options, just return
6687  return;
6688  }
6689 
6690  std::size_t used_options = 0;
6691  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
6692 
6693  if(opt->count() != 0) {
6694  ++used_options;
6695  }
6696  // Required but empty
6697  if(opt->get_required() && opt->count() == 0) {
6698  throw RequiredError(opt->get_name());
6699  }
6700  // Requires
6701  for(const Option *opt_req : opt->needs_)
6702  if(opt->count() > 0 && opt_req->count() == 0)
6703  throw RequiresError(opt->get_name(), opt_req->get_name());
6704  // Excludes
6705  for(const Option *opt_ex : opt->excludes_)
6706  if(opt->count() > 0 && opt_ex->count() != 0)
6707  throw ExcludesError(opt->get_name(), opt_ex->get_name());
6708  }
6709  // check for the required number of subcommands
6710  if(require_subcommand_min_ > 0) {
6711  auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
6712  if(require_subcommand_min_ > selected_subcommands.size())
6713  throw RequiredError::Subcommand(require_subcommand_min_);
6714  }
6715 
6716  // Max error cannot occur, the extra subcommand will parse as an ExtrasError or a remaining item.
6717 
6718  // run this loop to check how many unnamed subcommands were actually used since they are considered options
6719  // from the perspective of an App
6720  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6721  if(sub->disabled_)
6722  continue;
6723  if(sub->name_.empty() && sub->count_all() > 0) {
6724  ++used_options;
6725  }
6726  }
6727 
6728  if(require_option_min_ > used_options || (require_option_max_ > 0 && require_option_max_ < used_options)) {
6729  auto option_list = detail::join(options_, [](const Option_p &ptr) { return ptr->get_name(false, true); });
6730  if(option_list.compare(0, 10, "-h,--help,") == 0) {
6731  option_list.erase(0, 10);
6732  }
6733  auto subc_list = get_subcommands([](App *app) { return ((app->get_name().empty()) && (!app->disabled_)); });
6734  if(!subc_list.empty()) {
6735  option_list += "," + detail::join(subc_list, [](const App *app) { return app->get_display_name(); });
6736  }
6737  throw RequiredError::Option(require_option_min_, require_option_max_, used_options, option_list);
6738  }
6739 
6740  // now process the requirements for subcommands if needed
6741  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6742  if(sub->disabled_)
6743  continue;
6744  if(sub->name_.empty() && sub->required_ == false) {
6745  if(sub->count_all() == 0) {
6746  if(require_option_min_ > 0 && require_option_min_ <= used_options) {
6747  continue;
6748  // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing in this option group skip checking
6749  // requirements
6750  }
6751  if(require_option_max_ > 0 && used_options >= require_option_min_) {
6752  continue;
6753  // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing in this option group skip checking
6754  // requirements
6755  }
6756  }
6757  }
6758  if(sub->count() > 0 || sub->name_.empty()) {
6759  sub->_process_requirements();
6760  }
6761 
6762  if(sub->required_ && sub->count_all() == 0) {
6763  throw(CLI::RequiredError(sub->get_display_name()));
6764  }
6765  }
6766  }
6767 
6769  void _process() {
6770  _process_config_file();
6771  _process_env();
6772  _process_callbacks();
6773  _process_help_flags();
6774  _process_requirements();
6775  }
6776 
6778  void _process_extras() {
6779  if(!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
6780  std::size_t num_left_over = remaining_size();
6781  if(num_left_over > 0) {
6782  throw ExtrasError(name_, remaining(false));
6783  }
6784  }
6785 
6786  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6787  if(sub->count() > 0)
6788  sub->_process_extras();
6789  }
6790  }
6791 
6794  void _process_extras(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
6795  if(!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
6796  std::size_t num_left_over = remaining_size();
6797  if(num_left_over > 0) {
6798  args = remaining(false);
6799  throw ExtrasError(name_, args);
6800  }
6801  }
6802 
6803  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6804  if(sub->count() > 0)
6805  sub->_process_extras(args);
6806  }
6807  }
6808 
6810  void increment_parsed() {
6811  ++parsed_;
6812  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
6813  if(sub->get_name().empty())
6814  sub->increment_parsed();
6815  }
6816  }
6818  void _parse(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
6819  increment_parsed();
6820  _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
6821  bool positional_only = false;
6822 
6823  while(!args.empty()) {
6824  if(!_parse_single(args, positional_only)) {
6825  break;
6826  }
6827  }
6828 
6829  if(parent_ == nullptr) {
6830  _process();
6831 
6832  // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
6833  _process_extras(args);
6834 
6835  // Convert missing (pairs) to extras (string only) ready for processing in another app
6836  args = remaining_for_passthrough(false);
6837  } else if(parse_complete_callback_) {
6838  _process_env();
6839  _process_callbacks();
6840  _process_help_flags();
6841  _process_requirements();
6842  run_callback();
6843  }
6844  }
6845 
6847  void _parse(std::vector<std::string> &&args) {
6848  // this can only be called by the top level in which case parent == nullptr by definition
6849  // operation is simplified
6850  increment_parsed();
6851  _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
6852  bool positional_only = false;
6853 
6854  while(!args.empty()) {
6855  _parse_single(args, positional_only);
6856  }
6857  _process();
6858 
6859  // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
6860  _process_extras();
6861  }
6862 
6867  void _parse_config(std::vector<ConfigItem> &args) {
6868  for(ConfigItem item : args) {
6869  if(!_parse_single_config(item) && allow_config_extras_ == config_extras_mode::error)
6870  throw ConfigError::Extras(item.fullname());
6871  }
6872  }
6873 
6875  bool _parse_single_config(const ConfigItem &item, std::size_t level = 0) {
6876  if(level < item.parents.size()) {
6877  try {
6878  auto subcom = get_subcommand(item.parents.at(level));
6879  auto result = subcom->_parse_single_config(item, level + 1);
6880 
6881  return result;
6882  } catch(const OptionNotFound &) {
6883  return false;
6884  }
6885  }
6886  // check for section open
6887  if(item.name == "++") {
6888  if(configurable_) {
6889  increment_parsed();
6890  _trigger_pre_parse(2);
6891  if(parent_ != nullptr) {
6892  parent_->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(this);
6893  }
6894  }
6895  return true;
6896  }
6897  // check for section close
6898  if(item.name == "--") {
6899  if(configurable_) {
6900  _process_callbacks();
6901  _process_requirements();
6902  run_callback();
6903  }
6904  return true;
6905  }
6906  Option *op = get_option_no_throw("--" + item.name);
6907  if(op == nullptr) {
6908  // If the option was not present
6909  if(get_allow_config_extras() == config_extras_mode::capture)
6910  // Should we worry about classifying the extras properly?
6911  missing_.emplace_back(detail::Classifier::NONE, item.fullname());
6912  return false;
6913  }
6914 
6915  if(!op->get_configurable())
6916  throw ConfigError::NotConfigurable(item.fullname());
6917 
6918  if(op->empty()) {
6919  // Flag parsing
6920  if(op->get_expected_min() == 0) {
6921  auto res = config_formatter_->to_flag(item);
6922  res = op->get_flag_value(item.name, res);
6923 
6924  op->add_result(res);
6925 
6926  } else {
6927  op->add_result(item.inputs);
6928  op->run_callback();
6929  }
6930  }
6931 
6932  return true;
6933  }
6934 
6937  bool _parse_single(std::vector<std::string> &args, bool &positional_only) {
6938  bool retval = true;
6939  detail::Classifier classifier = positional_only ? detail::Classifier::NONE : _recognize(args.back());
6940  switch(classifier) {
6941  case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
6942  args.pop_back();
6943  positional_only = true;
6944  if((!_has_remaining_positionals()) && (parent_ != nullptr)) {
6945  retval = false;
6946  } else {
6947  _move_to_missing(classifier, "--");
6948  }
6949  break;
6950  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
6951  // treat this like a positional mark if in the parent app
6952  args.pop_back();
6953  retval = false;
6954  break;
6955  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
6956  retval = _parse_subcommand(args);
6957  break;
6958  case detail::Classifier::LONG:
6959  case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
6960  case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS:
6961  // If already parsed a subcommand, don't accept options_
6962  _parse_arg(args, classifier);
6963  break;
6964  case detail::Classifier::NONE:
6965  // Probably a positional or something for a parent (sub)command
6966  retval = _parse_positional(args, false);
6967  if(retval && positionals_at_end_) {
6968  positional_only = true;
6969  }
6970  break;
6971  // LCOV_EXCL_START
6972  default:
6973  throw HorribleError("unrecognized classifier (you should not see this!)");
6974  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
6975  }
6976  return retval;
6977  }
6978 
6980  std::size_t _count_remaining_positionals(bool required_only = false) const {
6981  std::size_t retval = 0;
6982  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
6983  if(opt->get_positional() && (!required_only || opt->get_required())) {
6984  if(opt->get_items_expected_min() > 0 &&
6985  static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
6986  retval += static_cast<std::size_t>(opt->get_items_expected_min()) - opt->count();
6987  }
6988  }
6989  }
6990  return retval;
6991  }
6992 
6994  bool _has_remaining_positionals() const {
6995  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
6996  if(opt->get_positional() && ((static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()))) {
6997  return true;
6998  }
6999  }
7000 
7001  return false;
7002  }
7003 
7007  bool _parse_positional(std::vector<std::string> &args, bool haltOnSubcommand) {
7008 
7009  const std::string &positional = args.back();
7010 
7011  if(positionals_at_end_) {
7012  // deal with the case of required arguments at the end which should take precedence over other arguments
7013  auto arg_rem = args.size();
7014  auto remreq = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
7015  if(arg_rem <= remreq) {
7016  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7017  if(opt->get_positional() && opt->required_) {
7018  if(static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
7019  if(validate_positionals_) {
7020  std::string pos = positional;
7021  pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
7022  if(!pos.empty()) {
7023  continue;
7024  }
7025  }
7026  opt->add_result(positional);
7027  parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
7028  args.pop_back();
7029  return true;
7030  }
7031  }
7032  }
7033  }
7034  }
7035  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7036  // Eat options, one by one, until done
7037  if(opt->get_positional() &&
7038  (static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min() || opt->get_allow_extra_args())) {
7039  if(validate_positionals_) {
7040  std::string pos = positional;
7041  pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
7042  if(!pos.empty()) {
7043  continue;
7044  }
7045  }
7046  opt->add_result(positional);
7047  parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
7048  args.pop_back();
7049  return true;
7050  }
7051  }
7052 
7053  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7054  if((subc->name_.empty()) && (!subc->disabled_)) {
7055  if(subc->_parse_positional(args, false)) {
7056  if(!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
7057  subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
7058  }
7059  return true;
7060  }
7061  }
7062  }
7063  // let the parent deal with it if possible
7064  if(parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
7065  return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_positional(args, static_cast<bool>(parse_complete_callback_));
7066 
7068  auto com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
7069  if(com != nullptr && (require_subcommand_max_ == 0 || require_subcommand_max_ > parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
7070  if(haltOnSubcommand) {
7071  return false;
7072  }
7073  args.pop_back();
7074  com->_parse(args);
7075  return true;
7076  }
7079  auto parent_app = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
7080  com = parent_app->_find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
7081  if(com != nullptr && (com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ == 0 ||
7082  com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ > com->parent_->parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
7083  return false;
7084  }
7085 
7086  if(positionals_at_end_) {
7087  throw CLI::ExtrasError(name_, args);
7088  }
7090  if(parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
7091  return false;
7092  }
7094  _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, positional);
7095  args.pop_back();
7096  if(prefix_command_) {
7097  while(!args.empty()) {
7098  _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, args.back());
7099  args.pop_back();
7100  }
7101  }
7102 
7103  return true;
7104  }
7105 
7108  App *_find_subcommand(const std::string &subc_name, bool ignore_disabled, bool ignore_used) const noexcept {
7109  for(const App_p &com : subcommands_) {
7110  if(com->disabled_ && ignore_disabled)
7111  continue;
7112  if(com->get_name().empty()) {
7113  auto subc = com->_find_subcommand(subc_name, ignore_disabled, ignore_used);
7114  if(subc != nullptr) {
7115  return subc;
7116  }
7117  }
7118  if(com->check_name(subc_name)) {
7119  if((!*com) || !ignore_used)
7120  return com.get();
7121  }
7122  }
7123  return nullptr;
7124  }
7125 
7130  bool _parse_subcommand(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
7131  if(_count_remaining_positionals(/* required */ true) > 0) {
7132  _parse_positional(args, false);
7133  return true;
7134  }
7135  auto com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, true);
7136  if(com != nullptr) {
7137  args.pop_back();
7138  parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
7139  com->_parse(args);
7140  auto parent_app = com->parent_;
7141  while(parent_app != this) {
7142  parent_app->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
7143  parent_app->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
7144  parent_app = parent_app->parent_;
7145  }
7146  return true;
7147  }
7148 
7149  if(parent_ == nullptr)
7150  throw HorribleError("Subcommand " + args.back() + " missing");
7151  return false;
7152  }
7153 
7156  bool _parse_arg(std::vector<std::string> &args, detail::Classifier current_type) {
7157 
7158  std::string current = args.back();
7159 
7160  std::string arg_name;
7161  std::string value;
7162  std::string rest;
7163 
7164  switch(current_type) {
7165  case detail::Classifier::LONG:
7166  if(!detail::split_long(current, arg_name, value))
7167  throw HorribleError("Long parsed but missing (you should not see this):" + args.back());
7168  break;
7169  case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
7170  if(!detail::split_short(current, arg_name, rest))
7171  throw HorribleError("Short parsed but missing! You should not see this");
7172  break;
7173  case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS:
7174  if(!detail::split_windows_style(current, arg_name, value))
7175  throw HorribleError("windows option parsed but missing! You should not see this");
7176  break;
7177  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
7178  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
7179  case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
7180  case detail::Classifier::NONE:
7181  default:
7182  throw HorribleError("parsing got called with invalid option! You should not see this");
7183  }
7184 
7185  auto op_ptr =
7186  std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [arg_name, current_type](const Option_p &opt) {
7187  if(current_type == detail::Classifier::LONG)
7188  return opt->check_lname(arg_name);
7189  if(current_type == detail::Classifier::SHORT)
7190  return opt->check_sname(arg_name);
7191  // this will only get called for detail::Classifier::WINDOWS
7192  return opt->check_lname(arg_name) || opt->check_sname(arg_name);
7193  });
7194 
7195  // Option not found
7196  if(op_ptr == std::end(options_)) {
7197  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7198  if(subc->name_.empty() && !subc->disabled_) {
7199  if(subc->_parse_arg(args, current_type)) {
7200  if(!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
7201  subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
7202  }
7203  return true;
7204  }
7205  }
7206  }
7207  // If a subcommand, try the master command
7208  if(parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
7209  return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_arg(args, current_type);
7210  // don't capture missing if this is a nameless subcommand
7211  if(parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
7212  return false;
7213  }
7214  // Otherwise, add to missing
7215  args.pop_back();
7216  _move_to_missing(current_type, current);
7217  return true;
7218  }
7219 
7220  args.pop_back();
7221 
7222  // Get a reference to the pointer to make syntax bearable
7223  Option_p &op = *op_ptr;
7224 
7225  int min_num = (std::min)(op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_items_expected_min());
7226  int max_num = op->get_items_expected_max();
7227 
7228  // Make sure we always eat the minimum for unlimited vectors
7229  int collected = 0; // total number of arguments collected
7230  int result_count = 0; // local variable for number of results in a single arg string
7231  // deal with purely flag like things
7232  if(max_num == 0) {
7233  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, value);
7234  op->add_result(res);
7235  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
7236  } else if(!value.empty()) { // --this=value
7237  op->add_result(value, result_count);
7238  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
7239  collected += result_count;
7240  // -Trest
7241  } else if(!rest.empty()) {
7242  op->add_result(rest, result_count);
7243  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
7244  rest = "";
7245  collected += result_count;
7246  }
7247 
7248  // gather the minimum number of arguments
7249  while(min_num > collected && !args.empty()) {
7250  std::string current_ = args.back();
7251  args.pop_back();
7252  op->add_result(current_, result_count);
7253  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
7254  collected += result_count;
7255  }
7256 
7257  if(min_num > collected) { // if we have run out of arguments and the minimum was not met
7258  throw ArgumentMismatch::TypedAtLeast(op->get_name(), min_num, op->get_type_name());
7259  }
7260 
7261  if(max_num > collected || op->get_allow_extra_args()) { // we allow optional arguments
7262  auto remreqpos = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
7263  // we have met the minimum now optionally check up to the maximum
7264  while((collected < max_num || op->get_allow_extra_args()) && !args.empty() &&
7265  _recognize(args.back(), false) == detail::Classifier::NONE) {
7266  // If any required positionals remain, don't keep eating
7267  if(remreqpos >= args.size()) {
7268  break;
7269  }
7270 
7271  op->add_result(args.back(), result_count);
7272  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
7273  args.pop_back();
7274  collected += result_count;
7275  }
7276 
7277  // Allow -- to end an unlimited list and "eat" it
7278  if(!args.empty() && _recognize(args.back()) == detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK)
7279  args.pop_back();
7280  // optional flag that didn't receive anything now get the default value
7281  if(min_num == 0 && max_num > 0 && collected == 0) {
7282  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, std::string{});
7283  op->add_result(res);
7284  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
7285  }
7286  }
7287 
7288  // if we only partially completed a type then add an empty string for later processing
7289  if(min_num > 0 && op->get_type_size_max() != min_num && collected % op->get_type_size_max() != 0) {
7290  op->add_result(std::string{});
7291  }
7292 
7293  if(!rest.empty()) {
7294  rest = "-" + rest;
7295  args.push_back(rest);
7296  }
7297  return true;
7298  }
7299 
7301  void _trigger_pre_parse(std::size_t remaining_args) {
7302  if(!pre_parse_called_) {
7303  pre_parse_called_ = true;
7304  if(pre_parse_callback_) {
7305  pre_parse_callback_(remaining_args);
7306  }
7307  } else if(immediate_callback_) {
7308  if(!name_.empty()) {
7309  auto pcnt = parsed_;
7310  auto extras = std::move(missing_);
7311  clear();
7312  parsed_ = pcnt;
7313  pre_parse_called_ = true;
7314  missing_ = std::move(extras);
7315  }
7316  }
7317  }
7318 
7320  App *_get_fallthrough_parent() {
7321  if(parent_ == nullptr) {
7322  throw(HorribleError("No Valid parent"));
7323  }
7324  auto fallthrough_parent = parent_;
7325  while((fallthrough_parent->parent_ != nullptr) && (fallthrough_parent->get_name().empty())) {
7326  fallthrough_parent = fallthrough_parent->parent_;
7327  }
7328  return fallthrough_parent;
7329  }
7330 
7332  const std::string &_compare_subcommand_names(const App &subcom, const App &base) const {
7333  static const std::string estring;
7334  if(subcom.disabled_) {
7335  return estring;
7336  }
7337  for(auto &subc : base.subcommands_) {
7338  if(subc.get() != &subcom) {
7339  if(subc->disabled_) {
7340  continue;
7341  }
7342  if(!subcom.get_name().empty()) {
7343  if(subc->check_name(subcom.get_name())) {
7344  return subcom.get_name();
7345  }
7346  }
7347  if(!subc->get_name().empty()) {
7348  if(subcom.check_name(subc->get_name())) {
7349  return subc->get_name();
7350  }
7351  }
7352  for(const auto &les : subcom.aliases_) {
7353  if(subc->check_name(les)) {
7354  return les;
7355  }
7356  }
7357  // this loop is needed in case of ignore_underscore or ignore_case on one but not the other
7358  for(const auto &les : subc->aliases_) {
7359  if(subcom.check_name(les)) {
7360  return les;
7361  }
7362  }
7363  // if the subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
7364  if(subc->get_name().empty()) {
7365  auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(subcom, *subc);
7366  if(!cmpres.empty()) {
7367  return cmpres;
7368  }
7369  }
7370  // if the test subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
7371  if(subcom.get_name().empty()) {
7372  auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(*subc, subcom);
7373  if(!cmpres.empty()) {
7374  return cmpres;
7375  }
7376  }
7377  }
7378  }
7379  return estring;
7380  }
7382  void _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier val_type, const std::string &val) {
7383  if(allow_extras_ || subcommands_.empty()) {
7384  missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
7385  return;
7386  }
7387  // allow extra arguments to be places in an option group if it is allowed there
7388  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7389  if(subc->name_.empty() && subc->allow_extras_) {
7390  subc->missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
7391  return;
7392  }
7393  }
7394  // if we haven't found any place to put them yet put them in missing
7395  missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
7396  }
7397 
7398  public:
7400  void _move_option(Option *opt, App *app) {
7401  if(opt == nullptr) {
7402  throw OptionNotFound("the option is NULL");
7403  }
7404  // verify that the give app is actually a subcommand
7405  bool found = false;
7406  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7407  if(app == subc.get()) {
7408  found = true;
7409  }
7410  }
7411  if(!found) {
7412  throw OptionNotFound("The Given app is not a subcommand");
7413  }
7414 
7415  if((help_ptr_ == opt) || (help_all_ptr_ == opt))
7416  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move help options");
7417 
7418  if(config_ptr_ == opt)
7419  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move config file options");
7420 
7421  auto iterator =
7422  std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [opt](const Option_p &v) { return v.get() == opt; });
7423  if(iterator != std::end(options_)) {
7424  const auto &opt_p = *iterator;
7425  if(std::find_if(std::begin(app->options_), std::end(app->options_), [&opt_p](const Option_p &v) {
7426  return (*v == *opt_p);
7427  }) == std::end(app->options_)) {
7428  // only erase after the insertion was successful
7429  app->options_.push_back(std::move(*iterator));
7430  options_.erase(iterator);
7431  } else {
7432  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("option was not located: " + opt->get_name());
7433  }
7434  } else {
7435  throw OptionNotFound("could not locate the given Option");
7436  }
7437  }
7438 }; // namespace CLI
7439 
7441 class Option_group : public App {
7442  public:
7443  Option_group(std::string group_description, std::string group_name, App *parent)
7444  : App(std::move(group_description), "", parent) {
7445  group(group_name);
7446  // option groups should have automatic fallthrough
7447  }
7448  using App::add_option;
7450  Option *add_option(Option *opt) {
7451  if(get_parent() == nullptr) {
7452  throw OptionNotFound("Unable to locate the specified option");
7453  }
7454  get_parent()->_move_option(opt, this);
7455  return opt;
7456  }
7458  void add_options(Option *opt) { add_option(opt); }
7460  template <typename... Args> void add_options(Option *opt, Args... args) {
7461  add_option(opt);
7462  add_options(args...);
7463  }
7464  using App::add_subcommand;
7466  App *add_subcommand(App *subcom) {
7467  App_p subc = subcom->get_parent()->get_subcommand_ptr(subcom);
7468  subc->get_parent()->remove_subcommand(subcom);
7469  add_subcommand(std::move(subc));
7470  return subcom;
7471  }
7472 };
7474 inline void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
7475  app_to_enable->enabled_by_default(false);
7476  app_to_enable->disabled_by_default();
7477  trigger_app->preparse_callback([app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(false); });
7478 }
7479 
7481 inline void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
7482  for(auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
7483  app->enabled_by_default(false);
7484  app->disabled_by_default();
7485  }
7486 
7487  trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
7488  for(auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
7489  app->disabled(false);
7490  }
7491  });
7492 }
7493 
7495 inline void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
7496  app_to_enable->disabled_by_default(false);
7497  app_to_enable->enabled_by_default();
7498  trigger_app->preparse_callback([app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(); });
7499 }
7500 
7502 inline void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
7503  for(auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
7504  app->disabled_by_default(false);
7505  app->enabled_by_default();
7506  }
7507 
7508  trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
7509  for(auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
7510  app->disabled();
7511  }
7512  });
7513 }
7514 
7516 inline void deprecate_option(Option *opt, const std::string &replacement = "") {
7517  Validator deprecate_warning{[opt, replacement](std::string &) {
7518  std::cout << opt->get_name() << " is deprecated please use '" << replacement
7519  << "' instead\n";
7520  return std::string();
7521  },
7522  "DEPRECATED"};
7523  deprecate_warning.application_index(0);
7524  opt->check(deprecate_warning);
7525  if(!replacement.empty()) {
7526  opt->description(opt->get_description() + " DEPRECATED: please use '" + replacement + "' instead");
7527  }
7528 }
7529 
7531 inline void deprecate_option(App *app, const std::string &option_name, const std::string &replacement = "") {
7532  auto opt = app->get_option(option_name);
7533  deprecate_option(opt, replacement);
7534 }
7535 
7537 inline void deprecate_option(App &app, const std::string &option_name, const std::string &replacement = "") {
7538  auto opt = app.get_option(option_name);
7539  deprecate_option(opt, replacement);
7540 }
7541 
7543 inline void retire_option(App *app, Option *opt) {
7544  App temp;
7545  auto option_copy = temp.add_option(opt->get_name(false, true))
7546  ->type_size(opt->get_type_size_min(), opt->get_type_size_max())
7547  ->expected(opt->get_expected_min(), opt->get_expected_max())
7548  ->allow_extra_args(opt->get_allow_extra_args());
7549 
7550  app->remove_option(opt);
7551  auto opt2 = app->add_option(option_copy->get_name(false, true), "option has been retired and has no effect")
7552  ->type_name("RETIRED")
7553  ->default_str("RETIRED")
7554  ->type_size(option_copy->get_type_size_min(), option_copy->get_type_size_max())
7555  ->expected(option_copy->get_expected_min(), option_copy->get_expected_max())
7556  ->allow_extra_args(option_copy->get_allow_extra_args());
7557 
7558  Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
7559  std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name() << " is retired and has no effect\n";
7560  return std::string();
7561  },
7562  ""};
7563  retired_warning.application_index(0);
7564  opt2->check(retired_warning);
7565 }
7566 
7568 inline void retire_option(App &app, Option *opt) { retire_option(&app, opt); }
7569 
7571 inline void retire_option(App *app, const std::string &option_name) {
7572 
7573  auto opt = app->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7574  if(opt != nullptr) {
7575  retire_option(app, opt);
7576  return;
7577  }
7578  auto opt2 = app->add_option(option_name, "option has been retired and has no effect")
7579  ->type_name("RETIRED")
7580  ->expected(0, 1)
7581  ->default_str("RETIRED");
7582  Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
7583  std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name() << " is retired and has no effect\n";
7584  return std::string();
7585  },
7586  ""};
7587  retired_warning.application_index(0);
7588  opt2->check(retired_warning);
7589 }
7590 
7592 inline void retire_option(App &app, const std::string &option_name) { retire_option(&app, option_name); }
7593 
7594 namespace FailureMessage {
7595 
7597 inline std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e) {
7598  std::string header = std::string(e.what()) + "\n";
7599  std::vector<std::string> names;
7600 
7601  // Collect names
7602  if(app->get_help_ptr() != nullptr)
7603  names.push_back(app->get_help_ptr()->get_name());
7604 
7605  if(app->get_help_all_ptr() != nullptr)
7606  names.push_back(app->get_help_all_ptr()->get_name());
7607 
7608  // If any names found, suggest those
7609  if(!names.empty())
7610  header += "Run with " + detail::join(names, " or ") + " for more information.\n";
7611 
7612  return header;
7613 }
7614 
7616 inline std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e) {
7617  std::string header = std::string("ERROR: ") + e.get_name() + ": " + e.what() + "\n";
7618  header += app->help();
7619  return header;
7620 }
7621 
7622 } // namespace FailureMessage
7623 
7624 namespace detail {
7626 struct AppFriend {
7627 #ifdef CLI11_CPP14
7628 
7630  template <typename... Args> static decltype(auto) parse_arg(App *app, Args &&... args) {
7631  return app->_parse_arg(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7632  }
7633 
7635  template <typename... Args> static decltype(auto) parse_subcommand(App *app, Args &&... args) {
7636  return app->_parse_subcommand(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7637  }
7638 #else
7639  template <typename... Args>
7641  static auto parse_arg(App *app, Args &&... args) ->
7642  typename std::result_of<decltype (&App::_parse_arg)(App, Args...)>::type {
7643  return app->_parse_arg(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7644  }
7645 
7647  template <typename... Args>
7648  static auto parse_subcommand(App *app, Args &&... args) ->
7649  typename std::result_of<decltype (&App::_parse_subcommand)(App, Args...)>::type {
7650  return app->_parse_subcommand(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7651  }
7652 #endif
7653  static App *get_fallthrough_parent(App *app) { return app->_get_fallthrough_parent(); }
7655 };
7656 } // namespace detail
7657 
7658 } // namespace CLI
7659 
7660 // From Config.hpp:
7661 
7662 namespace CLI {
7663 
7664 namespace detail {
7665 
7666 inline std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string &arg) {
7667  if(arg.empty()) {
7668  return std::string(2, '"');
7669  }
7670  // some specifically supported strings
7671  if(arg == "true" || arg == "false" || arg == "nan" || arg == "inf") {
7672  return arg;
7673  }
7674  // floating point conversion can convert some hex codes, but don't try that here
7675  if(arg.compare(0, 2, "0x") != 0 && arg.compare(0, 2, "0X") != 0) {
7676  double val;
7677  if(detail::lexical_cast(arg, val)) {
7678  return arg;
7679  }
7680  }
7681  // just quote a single non numeric character
7682  if(arg.size() == 1) {
7683  return std::string("'") + arg + '\'';
7684  }
7685  // handle hex, binary or octal arguments
7686  if(arg.front() == '0') {
7687  if(arg[1] == 'x') {
7688  if(std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) {
7689  return (x >= '0' && x <= '9') || (x >= 'A' && x <= 'F') || (x >= 'a' && x <= 'f');
7690  })) {
7691  return arg;
7692  }
7693  } else if(arg[1] == 'o') {
7694  if(std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) { return (x >= '0' && x <= '7'); })) {
7695  return arg;
7696  }
7697  } else if(arg[1] == 'b') {
7698  if(std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) { return (x == '0' || x == '1'); })) {
7699  return arg;
7700  }
7701  }
7702  }
7703  if(arg.find_first_of('"') == std::string::npos) {
7704  return std::string("\"") + arg + '"';
7705  } else {
7706  return std::string("'") + arg + '\'';
7707  }
7708 }
7709 
7711 inline std::string
7712 ini_join(const std::vector<std::string> &args, char sepChar = ',', char arrayStart = '[', char arrayEnd = ']') {
7713  std::string joined;
7714  if(args.size() > 1 && arrayStart != '\0') {
7715  joined.push_back(arrayStart);
7716  }
7717  std::size_t start = 0;
7718  for(const auto &arg : args) {
7719  if(start++ > 0) {
7720  joined.push_back(sepChar);
7721  if(isspace(sepChar) == 0) {
7722  joined.push_back(' ');
7723  }
7724  }
7725  joined.append(convert_arg_for_ini(arg));
7726  }
7727  if(args.size() > 1 && arrayEnd != '\0') {
7728  joined.push_back(arrayEnd);
7729  }
7730  return joined;
7731 }
7732 
7733 inline std::vector<std::string> generate_parents(const std::string &section, std::string &name) {
7734  std::vector<std::string> parents;
7735  if(detail::to_lower(section) != "default") {
7736  if(section.find('.') != std::string::npos) {
7737  parents = detail::split(section, '.');
7738  } else {
7739  parents = {section};
7740  }
7741  }
7742  if(name.find('.') != std::string::npos) {
7743  std::vector<std::string> plist = detail::split(name, '.');
7744  name = plist.back();
7745  detail::remove_quotes(name);
7746  plist.pop_back();
7747  parents.insert(parents.end(), plist.begin(), plist.end());
7748  }
7749 
7750  // clean up quotes on the parents
7751  for(auto &parent : parents) {
7752  detail::remove_quotes(parent);
7753  }
7754  return parents;
7755 }
7756 
7758 inline void checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem> &output, const std::string &currentSection) {
7759 
7760  std::string estring;
7761  auto parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, estring);
7762  if(!output.empty() && output.back().name == "--") {
7763  std::size_t msize = (parents.size() > 1U) ? parents.size() : 2;
7764  while(output.back().parents.size() >= msize) {
7765  output.push_back(output.back());
7766  output.back().parents.pop_back();
7767  }
7768 
7769  if(parents.size() > 1) {
7770  std::size_t common = 0;
7771  std::size_t mpair = (std::min)(output.back().parents.size(), parents.size() - 1);
7772  for(std::size_t ii = 0; ii < mpair; ++ii) {
7773  if(output.back().parents[ii] != parents[ii]) {
7774  break;
7775  }
7776  ++common;
7777  }
7778  if(common == mpair) {
7779  output.pop_back();
7780  } else {
7781  while(output.back().parents.size() > common + 1) {
7782  output.push_back(output.back());
7783  output.back().parents.pop_back();
7784  }
7785  }
7786  for(std::size_t ii = common; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
7787  output.emplace_back();
7788  output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(), parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
7789  output.back().name = "++";
7790  }
7791  }
7792  } else if(parents.size() > 1) {
7793  for(std::size_t ii = 0; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
7794  output.emplace_back();
7795  output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(), parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
7796  output.back().name = "++";
7797  }
7798  }
7799 
7800  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
7801  output.emplace_back();
7802  output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
7803  output.back().name = "++";
7804 }
7805 } // namespace detail
7806 
7807 inline std::vector<ConfigItem> ConfigBase::from_config(std::istream &input) const {
7808  std::string line;
7809  std::string section = "default";
7810 
7811  std::vector<ConfigItem> output;
7812  bool defaultArray = (arrayStart == '\0' || arrayStart == ' ') && arrayStart == arrayEnd;
7813  char aStart = (defaultArray) ? '[' : arrayStart;
7814  char aEnd = (defaultArray) ? ']' : arrayEnd;
7815  char aSep = (defaultArray && arraySeparator == ' ') ? ',' : arraySeparator;
7816 
7817  while(getline(input, line)) {
7818  std::vector<std::string> items_buffer;
7819  std::string name;
7820 
7821  detail::trim(line);
7822  std::size_t len = line.length();
7823  if(len > 1 && line.front() == '[' && line.back() == ']') {
7824  if(section != "default") {
7825  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
7826  output.emplace_back();
7827  output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(section, name);
7828  output.back().name = "--";
7829  }
7830  section = line.substr(1, len - 2);
7831  // deal with double brackets for TOML
7832  if(section.size() > 1 && section.front() == '[' && section.back() == ']') {
7833  section = section.substr(1, section.size() - 2);
7834  }
7835  if(detail::to_lower(section) == "default") {
7836  section = "default";
7837  } else {
7838  detail::checkParentSegments(output, section);
7839  }
7840  continue;
7841  }
7842  if(len == 0) {
7843  continue;
7844  }
7845  // comment lines
7846  if(line.front() == ';' || line.front() == '#' || line.front() == commentChar) {
7847  continue;
7848  }
7849 
7850  // Find = in string, split and recombine
7851  auto pos = line.find(valueDelimiter);
7852  if(pos != std::string::npos) {
7853  name = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(0, pos));
7854  std::string item = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(pos + 1));
7855  if(item.size() > 1 && item.front() == aStart && item.back() == aEnd) {
7856  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item.substr(1, item.length() - 2), aSep);
7857  } else if(defaultArray && item.find_first_of(aSep) != std::string::npos) {
7858  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item, aSep);
7859  } else if(defaultArray && item.find_first_of(' ') != std::string::npos) {
7860  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item);
7861  } else {
7862  items_buffer = {item};
7863  }
7864  } else {
7865  name = detail::trim_copy(line);
7866  items_buffer = {"true"};
7867  }
7868  if(name.find('.') == std::string::npos) {
7869  detail::remove_quotes(name);
7870  }
7871  // clean up quotes on the items
7872  for(auto &it : items_buffer) {
7873  detail::remove_quotes(it);
7874  }
7875 
7876  std::vector<std::string> parents = detail::generate_parents(section, name);
7877 
7878  if(!output.empty() && name == output.back().name && parents == output.back().parents) {
7879  output.back().inputs.insert(output.back().inputs.end(), items_buffer.begin(), items_buffer.end());
7880  } else {
7881  output.emplace_back();
7882  output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
7883  output.back().name = std::move(name);
7884  output.back().inputs = std::move(items_buffer);
7885  }
7886  }
7887  if(section != "default") {
7888  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
7889  std::string ename;
7890  output.emplace_back();
7891  output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(section, ename);
7892  output.back().name = "--";
7893  while(output.back().parents.size() > 1) {
7894  output.push_back(output.back());
7895  output.back().parents.pop_back();
7896  }
7897  }
7898  return output;
7899 }
7900 
7901 inline std::string
7902 ConfigBase::to_config(const App *app, bool default_also, bool write_description, std::string prefix) const {
7903  std::stringstream out;
7904  std::string commentLead;
7905  commentLead.push_back(commentChar);
7906  commentLead.push_back(' ');
7907 
7908  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
7909  bool defaultUsed = false;
7910  groups.insert(groups.begin(), std::string("Options"));
7911  if(write_description) {
7912  out << commentLead << app->get_description() << '\n';
7913  }
7914  for(auto &group : groups) {
7915  if(group == "Options" || group.empty()) {
7916  if(defaultUsed) {
7917  continue;
7918  }
7919  defaultUsed = true;
7920  }
7921  if(write_description && group != "Options" && !group.empty()) {
7922  out << '\n' << commentLead << group << " Options\n";
7923  }
7924  for(const Option *opt : app->get_options({})) {
7925 
7926  // Only process option with a long-name and configurable
7927  if(!opt->get_lnames().empty() && opt->get_configurable()) {
7928  if(opt->get_group() != group) {
7929  if(!(group == "Options" && opt->get_group().empty())) {
7930  continue;
7931  }
7932  }
7933  std::string name = prefix + opt->get_lnames()[0];
7934  std::string value = detail::ini_join(opt->reduced_results(), arraySeparator, arrayStart, arrayEnd);
7935 
7936  if(value.empty() && default_also) {
7937  if(!opt->get_default_str().empty()) {
7938  value = detail::convert_arg_for_ini(opt->get_default_str());
7939  } else if(opt->get_expected_min() == 0) {
7940  value = "false";
7941  }
7942  }
7943 
7944  if(!value.empty()) {
7945  if(write_description && opt->has_description()) {
7946  out << '\n';
7947  out << commentLead << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, opt->get_description()) << '\n';
7948  }
7949  out << name << valueDelimiter << value << '\n';
7950  }
7951  }
7952  }
7953  }
7954  auto subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
7955  for(const App *subcom : subcommands) {
7956  if(subcom->get_name().empty()) {
7957  if(write_description && !subcom->get_group().empty()) {
7958  out << '\n' << commentLead << subcom->get_group() << " Options\n";
7959  }
7960  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix);
7961  }
7962  }
7963 
7964  for(const App *subcom : subcommands) {
7965  if(!subcom->get_name().empty()) {
7966  if(subcom->get_configurable() && app->got_subcommand(subcom)) {
7967  if(!prefix.empty() || app->get_parent() == nullptr) {
7968  out << '[' << prefix << subcom->get_name() << "]\n";
7969  } else {
7970  std::string subname = app->get_name() + "." + subcom->get_name();
7971  auto p = app->get_parent();
7972  while(p->get_parent() != nullptr) {
7973  subname = p->get_name() + "." + subname;
7974  p = p->get_parent();
7975  }
7976  out << '[' << subname << "]\n";
7977  }
7978  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, "");
7979  } else {
7980  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix + subcom->get_name() + ".");
7981  }
7982  }
7983  }
7984 
7985  return out.str();
7986 }
7987 
7988 } // namespace CLI
7989 
7990 // From Formatter.hpp:
7991 
7992 namespace CLI {
7993 
7994 inline std::string
7995 Formatter::make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional, std::vector<const Option *> opts) const {
7996  std::stringstream out;
7997 
7998  out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
7999  for(const Option *opt : opts) {
8000  out << make_option(opt, is_positional);
8001  }
8002 
8003  return out.str();
8004 }
8005 
8006 inline std::string Formatter::make_positionals(const App *app) const {
8007  std::vector<const Option *> opts =
8008  app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return !opt->get_group().empty() && opt->get_positional(); });
8009 
8010  if(opts.empty())
8011  return std::string();
8012 
8013  return make_group(get_label("Positionals"), true, opts);
8014 }
8015 
8016 inline std::string Formatter::make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const {
8017  std::stringstream out;
8018  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
8019 
8020  // Options
8021  for(const std::string &group : groups) {
8022  std::vector<const Option *> opts = app->get_options([app, mode, &group](const Option *opt) {
8023  return opt->get_group() == group // Must be in the right group
8024  && opt->nonpositional() // Must not be a positional
8025  && (mode != AppFormatMode::Sub // If mode is Sub, then
8026  || (app->get_help_ptr() != opt // Ignore help pointer
8027  && app->get_help_all_ptr() != opt)); // Ignore help all pointer
8028  });
8029  if(!group.empty() && !opts.empty()) {
8030  out << make_group(group, false, opts);
8031 
8032  if(group != groups.back())
8033  out << "\n";
8034  }
8035  }
8036 
8037  return out.str();
8038 }
8039 
8040 inline std::string Formatter::make_description(const App *app) const {
8041  std::string desc = app->get_description();
8042  auto min_options = app->get_require_option_min();
8043  auto max_options = app->get_require_option_max();
8044  if(app->get_required()) {
8045  desc += " REQUIRED ";
8046  }
8047  if((max_options == min_options) && (min_options > 0)) {
8048  if(min_options == 1) {
8049  desc += " \n[Exactly 1 of the following options is required]";
8050  } else {
8051  desc += " \n[Exactly " + std::to_string(min_options) + "options from the following list are required]";
8052  }
8053  } else if(max_options > 0) {
8054  if(min_options > 0) {
8055  desc += " \n[Between " + std::to_string(min_options) + " and " + std::to_string(max_options) +
8056  " of the follow options are required]";
8057  } else {
8058  desc += " \n[At most " + std::to_string(max_options) + " of the following options are allowed]";
8059  }
8060  } else if(min_options > 0) {
8061  desc += " \n[At least " + std::to_string(min_options) + " of the following options are required]";
8062  }
8063  return (!desc.empty()) ? desc + "\n" : std::string{};
8064 }
8065 
8066 inline std::string Formatter::make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const {
8067  std::stringstream out;
8068 
8069  out << get_label("Usage") << ":" << (name.empty() ? "" : " ") << name;
8070 
8071  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
8072 
8073  // Print an Options badge if any options exist
8074  std::vector<const Option *> non_pos_options =
8075  app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return opt->nonpositional(); });
8076  if(!non_pos_options.empty())
8077  out << " [" << get_label("OPTIONS") << "]";
8078 
8079  // Positionals need to be listed here
8080  std::vector<const Option *> positionals = app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return opt->get_positional(); });
8081 
8082  // Print out positionals if any are left
8083  if(!positionals.empty()) {
8084  // Convert to help names
8085  std::vector<std::string> positional_names(positionals.size());
8086  std::transform(positionals.begin(), positionals.end(), positional_names.begin(), [this](const Option *opt) {
8087  return make_option_usage(opt);
8088  });
8089 
8090  out << " " << detail::join(positional_names, " ");
8091  }
8092 
8093  // Add a marker if subcommands are expected or optional
